synopsis: Amadeus Cho assembles the New Agents of Atlas: Silk, Wave, Aero, Sword Master, Luna Snow, and Shang-Chi to defend the Pan-Asian portal cities during War of the Realms. Features Asian and Asian-American heroes (#1-5).
connection_notes: Spins off from: War of the Realms. Continues from: Agents of Atlas Complete (original Pak run).

title: Young Avengers by Kieron Gillen Omnibus
issues_collected: Young Avengers (2013) #1-15, Marvel NOW! Point One #1 (YA story)
synopsis: Wiccan, Hulkling, Kate Bishop, Noh-Varr, Kid Loki, America Chavez, and Prodigy face an interdimensional parasite called Mother. Genre-bending, stylistically groundbreaking run with McKelvie's innovative layouts (#1-15).
connection_notes: Continues from: Young Avengers by Heinberg, Children's Crusade. Kid Loki from: Journey into Mystery by Gillen. Leads to: New Avengers by Ewing.

title: Champions (2020) by Eve L. Ewing
issues_collected: Champions (2020) #1-10, Outlawed #1
synopsis: Kamala's Law outlaws teen vigilantes. Ms. Marvel, Miles Morales, Nova, Viv Vision, Ironheart, and new members go underground to resist unjust legislation. Kamala Khan's political awakening (#1-10).
connection_notes: Continues from: Champions by Waid. Ties into: Outlawed event. Parallel: Power Pack (2020), New Warriors (2020).

title: Marvel Knights 20th Anniversary
issues_collected: Marvel Knights 20th #1-6
synopsis: Daredevil, Punisher, Jessica Jones, Luke Cage, and Bruce Banner awaken in a world where superheroes never existed. Memory-loss mystery celebrating 20 years of the Marvel Knights imprint (#1-6).
connection_notes: Anniversary celebration of: Marvel Knights era (1998-2004). Standalone miniseries.

title: Winter Guard Complete
issues_collected: Winter Guard #1-4
synopsis: Russia's superhero team -- Red Guardian, Darkstar, Vostok, Crimson Dynamo, Ursa Major, and Perun -- faces internal power struggles and ancient Slavic threats. Reveals dark secrets of the Red Room (#1-4).
connection_notes: Expands: Black Widow mythos, Red Guardian from movie tie-ins. References: Soviet Super-Soldiers history.

title: Avengers A.I. Complete
issues_collected: Avengers A.I. #1-12
synopsis: Hank Pym leads a team of artificial beings -- Vision, Victor Mancha, Doombot, and new AI Monica Chang -- to police the Diamond, a virtual dimension born from Age of Ultron's timeline damage (#1-12).
connection_notes: Spins off from: Age of Ultron event. Features: Victor Mancha from Runaways.

title: Ultimates by Al Ewing Complete
synopsis: Black Panther, Captain Marvel, Blue Marvel, America Chavez, and Spectrum tackle cosmic-scale problems: curing Galactus (#1-6), confronting the First Firmament, and redefining Marvel's cosmology. Ewing's masterwork (#1-12, Ultimates 2 #1-100).
connection_notes: Builds on: Mighty Avengers by Ewing. Leads to: Defenders (2021), Immortal Hulk cosmology. Ties into: Civil War II, Secret Empire.

title: Avengers: The Children's Crusade
issues_collected: Avengers: The Children's Crusade #1-9
synopsis: The Young Avengers search for the Scarlet Witch, who has been missing since House of M. Wiccan and Speed confront whether she is truly their mother. Doctor Doom's role in M-Day revealed. Pivotal for mutant continuity (#1-9).
connection_notes: Prerequisite: House of M, Young Avengers by Heinberg. Leads to: AvX, Uncanny Avengers by Remender. Resolves: Scarlet Witch's M-Day legacy.

title: Mighty Avengers by Dan Slott Complete
issues_collected: Mighty Avengers #1-20
synopsis: Tony Stark's official pro-Registration Avengers team: Ares, Sentry, Wasp, Wonder Man, Black Widow, Ms. Marvel. Ultron takes over Tony's body (#1-6). Major Secret Invasion tie-in reveals Skrull infiltrators (#7-20).
connection_notes: Spins off from: Civil War. Parallel: New Avengers Omnibus Vol. 2. Ties into: Secret Invasion.

title: Pet Avengers Complete Collection
issues_collected: Lockjaw and the Pet Avengers #1-4, Pet Avengers vs Avengers #1-4, Tails of the Pet Avengers
synopsis: Lockjaw, Throg (frog Thor), Lockheed, Hairball (Niels the cat), Redwing, and Ms. Lion assemble to collect the Infinity Gems before Thanos. All-ages fun with Marvel's animal heroes (#1-4 x2).
connection_notes: References: Infinity Gems mythology. Comedic standalone team book.

title: New Avengers: A.I.M. by Al Ewing
issues_collected: New Avengers (2015) #1-18
synopsis: Sunspot buys A.I.M. and transforms it into Avengers Idea Mechanics. Wiccan, Hulkling, Squirrel Girl, Hawkeye, Power Man, and White Tiger operate from A.I.M. Island. Ewing's signature wit with cosmic stakes (#1-18).
connection_notes: Continues from: Avengers by Hickman (Sunspot's arc). Leads to: U.S.Avengers. Parallel: Ultimates by Ewing.

title: Squadron Supreme by James Robinson
issues_collected: Squadron Supreme (2015) #1-15
synopsis: Survivors from destroyed universes -- Hyperion, Nighthawk, Blur, Doctor Spectrum, Power Princess -- unite in post-Secret Wars 616. They take lethal action, including destroying Atlantis. Morally grey team book (#1-15).
connection_notes: Spins off from: Secret Wars (2015) multiverse destruction. References: Squadron Supreme (1985). Parallel: Ultimates by Ewing.

title: Dark Avengers/Thunderbolts by Jeff Parker
issues_collected: Dark Avengers (2012) #175-190
synopsis: Thunderbolts relaunched as Dark Avengers. Skaar, Ragnarok (clone Thor), Toxic Doxie, Ai Apaec, and Trickshot pose as heroes while Luke Cage manages them. Reality-bending finale wraps Parker's run (#175-190).
connection_notes: Continues from: Thunderbolts by Jeff Parker. Leads to: Thunderbolts by Soule (Red Hulk team).

title: Secret Avengers by Ales Kot
issues_collected: Secret Avengers (2014) #1-15
synopsis: SHIELD covert ops with Hawkeye, Black Widow, Spider-Woman, and MODOK (as a SHIELD agent!). Surreal, self-aware espionage comedy. Vladimir the sentient bomb. The weirdest Avengers book ever published (#1-15).
connection_notes: Continues from: Secret Avengers by Spencer. Standalone in tone but connects to: SHIELD operations.

title: Avengers: No Road Home
issues_collected: Avengers: No Road Home #1-10
synopsis: Nyx, goddess of night, steals the sun. Hercules, Voyager, Hawkeye, Scarlet Witch, Vision, Hulk, Spectrum, and Rocket traverse mythological realms to reclaim three shards of night. Sequel to No Surrender (#1-10).
connection_notes: Continues from: Avengers: No Surrender. Leads to: Avengers by Aaron. Features: Conan's Marvel debut.

title: Avengers: No Surrender
synopsis: Earth stolen for a contest between Grandmaster and Challenger. All Avengers teams unite. Voyager revealed. Hulk returns from the dead. Weekly event concluding the pre-Fresh Start era with a 16-part epic (#675-690).
connection_notes: Ties together: Waid, Ewing, and Zub Avengers threads. Leads to: No Road Home, Avengers by Aaron, Immortal Hulk.

title: Thunderbolts by Daniel Way & Charles Soule
issues_collected: Thunderbolts (2012) #1-32, Annual #1
synopsis: Red Hulk assembles a kill squad: Deadpool, Punisher, Elektra, Venom (Flash Thompson), and Agent Venom. Maximum violence against the worst threats. Soule takes over and adds Ghost Rider (#1-32).
connection_notes: Parallel: Thunderbolts by Parker. Leads to: Thunderbolts by Zub. Dark counterpart to Avengers.

title: Avengers: Earth's Mightiest Heroes by Joe Casey
issues_collected: Avengers: Earth's Mightiest Heroes #1-8, Avengers: Earth's Mightiest Heroes II #1-8
synopsis: Behind-the-scenes retelling of the Avengers' early years. Explores Jarvis's recruitment, the team's government relationship, and the personal costs of being Earth's Mightiest Heroes. Fills gaps in early continuity (#1-8 x2).
connection_notes: Enriches: Avengers Omnibus Vol. 1-2 continuity. Standalone prestige miniseries.

title: Union Jack Complete
issues_collected: Union Jack (2006) #1-4, Union Jack (1998) #1-3
synopsis: Britain's street-level hero defends London from vampire terrorists and HYDRA in the 2006 series. Joined by Sabra, Contessa, and Arabian Knight. The 1998 series covers his WWII Invaders legacy (#1-4, #1-3).
connection_notes: References: Invaders legacy, Captain Britain. Parallel: MI:13.

title: Secret Warriors by Jonathan Hickman Complete Vol. 2
issues_collected: Secret Warriors #17-28
synopsis: Nick Fury's endgame: the triple-agent war between SHIELD, HYDRA, and Leviathan concludes. Revelation that HYDRA has been inside SHIELD since its founding. Fury's long game pays off in devastating fashion (#17-28).
connection_notes: Continues from: Secret Warriors Omnibus (Vol. 1). Leads to: SHIELD by Hickman. Prerequisite for: Understanding Hickman's Marvel cosmology.

title: Spider-Man Epic Collection: Great Power
issues_collected: Amazing Fantasy #15, Amazing Spider-Man #1-17, Annual #1
synopsis: The origin of Spider-Man and his earliest adventures. Uncle Ben's death (AF #15), debut of Doctor Octopus (#3), Sandman (#4), Lizard (#6), Electro (#9), Mysterio (#13), Green Goblin (#14), and the Sinister Six (Annual #1).
connection_notes: Leads to: Spider-Man Epic Collection: Great Responsibility. Budget alternative to ASM Omnibus Vol. 1. Parallel: FF and Avengers origins.

title: Spider-Man Epic Collection: Great Responsibility
issues_collected: Amazing Spider-Man #18-38, Annual #2
synopsis: The culmination of Lee and Ditko's legendary run. Kraven the Hunter (#15 flashback, #34), Scorpion (#20), Molten Man (#28), and the Master Planner Saga (#31-33) -- one of the greatest Spider-Man stories ever told.
connection_notes: Leads to: ASM Omnibus Vol. 2 (Romita era). Budget alternative to ASM Omnibus Vol. 1. Prerequisite: Great Power.

title: Avengers Epic Collection: Earth's Mightiest Heroes
issues_collected: Avengers #1-20
synopsis: The founding of the Avengers. Thor, Iron Man, Hulk, Ant-Man, and Wasp unite against Loki (#1). Captain America revived from ice (#4). Kang the Conqueror debuts (#8). Wonder Man introduced (#9). Cap's Kooky Quartet forms (#16).
connection_notes: Budget alternative to Avengers Omnibus Vol. 1. Parallel: FF and Spider-Man origins. Leads to: Avengers Omnibus Vol. 2.

title: X-Men Epic Collection: Children of the Atom
issues_collected: X-Men #1-23
synopsis: The original X-Men: Cyclops, Marvel Girl, Beast, Iceman, and Angel under Professor Xavier. Magneto debuts (#1), the Brotherhood of Evil Mutants forms, and the Sentinels first appear (#14). The foundation of mutant mythology.
connection_notes: Prerequisite for all X-Men reading. Leads to: UXM Claremont Omnibus Vol. 1 (Giant-Size relaunch). Parallel: other Silver Age origins.

title: Fantastic Four Epic Collection: World's Greatest Comic Magazine
issues_collected: Fantastic Four #1-18
synopsis: Where the Marvel Universe begins. Mole Man (#1), Skrulls (#2), Namor's return (#4), Doctor Doom debut (#5), Impossible Man (#11), and the Watcher's first appearance (#13). Budget alternative to FF Omnibus Vol. 1.
connection_notes: Leads to: FF Epic Collection: The Coming of Galactus. Budget alternative to FF Omnibus Vol. 1. The starting point of Marvel continuity.

title: Fantastic Four Epic Collection: The Coming of Galactus
issues_collected: Fantastic Four #39-56, Annual #3
synopsis: Peak Lee/Kirby FF. The Inhumans fully introduced (#44-47), the Galactus Trilogy (#48-50) -- the most important cosmic event in early Marvel -- and Black Panther's first appearance (#52-53). Silver Surfer and Galactus debut.
connection_notes: Spins off: Silver Surfer, Inhumans, Black Panther. Budget alternative to FF Omnibus Vol. 2. Leads to: FF Omnibus Vol. 3.

title: Hulk Epic Collection: Man or Monster?
issues_collected: Incredible Hulk #1-6, Tales to Astonish #59-86
synopsis: Bruce Banner's gamma-irradiated origin and early rampages. The original six-issue series (#1-6) plus the Tales to Astonish continuation. Introduction of the Leader, Abomination, and the Hulk's dual-identity struggle.
connection_notes: Leads to: Incredible Hulk Omnibus (continuation). Parallel: other Silver Age origins. Budget entry point for Hulk.

title: Daredevil Epic Collection: The Man Without Fear
issues_collected: Daredevil #1-21
synopsis: Matt Murdock's origin as the blind lawyer turned vigilante. Wally Wood's iconic redesign of the red costume (#7). Early rogues include the Owl, Stilt-Man, and the first clash with the Gladiator. Foundation for all Daredevil stories.
connection_notes: Leads to: DD Miller Omnibus (the run that defined the character). Parallel: other Silver Age origins.

title: Doctor Strange Epic Collection: Master of the Mystic Arts
issues_collected: Strange Tales #110-141
synopsis: The origin and early adventures of the Sorcerer Supreme. Ditko's psychedelic visuals define Marvel's magical dimension. Dormammu, Baron Mordo, the Ancient One, and the Eye of Agamotto all introduced. The Eternity arc (#130-146) is groundbreaking.
connection_notes: Foundation for all Doctor Strange stories. Leads to: Doctor Strange Englehart/Brunner. Parallel: other Lee/Ditko creations.

title: Black Panther Epic Collection: Panther's Rage
issues_collected: Jungle Action #6-24
synopsis: The first true Black Panther solo saga and one of comics' first long-form graphic narratives. T'Challa returns to Wakanda to face Erik Killmonger's revolution. Deeply political, beautifully rendered, and ahead of its time.
connection_notes: First essential Black Panther story after FF #52-53 debut. Leads to: Black Panther by Kirby, then Priest. Prerequisite for Killmonger as a character.

title: Luke Cage Epic Collection: Retribution
issues_collected: Hero for Hire #1-16
synopsis: Luke Cage: the first Black superhero to headline his own Marvel series. Framed prisoner gains unbreakable skin and super strength, opens a storefront hero business in Harlem. Gritty, street-level Bronze Age Marvel.
connection_notes: Leads to: Power Man and Iron Fist. Parallel: other Bronze Age new heroes (Iron Fist, Shang-Chi). Foundation for Netflix Luke Cage.

title: Ghost Rider Epic Collection: Hell on Wheels
issues_collected: Marvel Spotlight #5-12, Ghost Rider #1-14
synopsis: Johnny Blaze makes a deal with the devil and becomes the Spirit of Vengeance. The origin of Ghost Rider in Marvel Spotlight #5, plus the first fourteen issues of his solo series. Motorcycle stunts meet supernatural horror.
connection_notes: Leads to: Ghost Rider Johnny Blaze complete. Parallel: other Bronze Age horror titles (Tomb of Dracula, Werewolf by Night). Foundation for all Ghost Rider stories.

title: Punisher Epic Collection: Circle of Blood
issues_collected: Punisher #1-10 (1986 limited series), Punisher #1-8 (1987 ongoing)
synopsis: Frank Castle graduates from guest villain to solo star. The 1986 limited series that launched the Punisher franchise, followed by the start of his first ongoing. Gritty urban vigilante action that defined 1980s Marvel.
connection_notes: Leads to: Punisher War Journal, Punisher MAX. Character first appeared in ASM #129. Parallel: Daredevil Miller era.

title: Silver Surfer Epic Collection: Freedom
issues_collected: Silver Surfer #1-18
synopsis: Norrin Radd, trapped on Earth by Galactus's barrier, struggles with humanity's capacity for both beauty and violence. Mephisto tempts the Surfer (#3). Deeply philosophical, prestige-format storytelling from Lee's most personal project.
connection_notes: Budget alternative to Silver Surfer Omnibus Vol. 1. Prerequisite: FF Omnibus Vol. 2 (Galactus Trilogy). Leads to: Silver Surfer return in cosmic 1990s.

title: Captain Marvel Epic Collection: The Coming of Captain Marvel
issues_collected: Marvel Super-Heroes #12-13, Captain Marvel #1-21
synopsis: Kree warrior Mar-Vell is sent to spy on Earth and becomes its champion instead. Introduction of the Kree Empire's ground-level perspective, Yon-Rogg, Carol Danvers (pre-powers), and the Negative Zone Rick Jones bond.
connection_notes: Leads to: Captain Marvel by Starlin, Death of Captain Marvel. Foundation for all Captain Marvel/Carol Danvers stories. Parallel: Kree-Skrull War in Avengers.

title: Defenders Epic Collection: The Day of the Defenders
issues_collected: Marvel Feature #1-3, Defenders #1-19
synopsis: Marvel's 'non-team' assembles: Doctor Strange, Hulk, Namor, and Silver Surfer join forces reluctantly. The Avengers-Defenders War crossover, Valkyrie joins, and the team dynamic of heroes who don't want to be a team.
connection_notes: Leads to: Defenders Omnibus Vol. 1. Parallel: Avengers ongoing. Features characters from multiple solo titles converging.

title: Iron Fist Epic Collection: The Fury of Iron Fist
issues_collected: Marvel Premiere #15-25, Iron Fist #1-15
synopsis: Danny Rand trained in the mystical city of K'un-Lun becomes the Immortal Iron Fist. Early Claremont/Byrne collaboration before their X-Men fame. Martial arts action meets Marvel mysticism. Leads directly into Power Man and Iron Fist.
connection_notes: Leads to: Power Man and Iron Fist, Immortal Iron Fist. Pre-X-Men Claremont/Byrne work. Parallel: other Bronze Age martial arts titles (Shang-Chi).

title: Spider-Woman Epic Collection: A Tangled Web
issues_collected: Spider-Woman #1-25
synopsis: Jessica Drew, originally created to secure Marvel's trademark, becomes a compelling character in her own right. HYDRA origins, pheromone powers, and a noir-ish detective flavor. Foundation for all modern Spider-Woman stories.
connection_notes: Leads to: Spider-Woman Agent of SWORD, Spider-Woman Omnibus (modern). Parallel: other late-Bronze Age titles.

title: Thor Epic Collection: The God of Thunder
issues_collected: Journey into Mystery #83-100
synopsis: Dr. Donald Blake discovers a gnarled walking stick that transforms him into the Mighty Thor. Loki debut (#85), Odin and Asgard introduced, the Enchantress and Executioner appear. The mythological foundation of the Marvel Universe.
connection_notes: Budget alternative to Thor Lee/Kirby Omnibus Vol. 1. Leads to: Tales of Asgard backup features, Thor ongoing. Parallel: other Silver Age origins.

title: Iron Man Epic Collection: The Golden Avenger
issues_collected: Tales of Suspense #39-58, Iron Man #1
synopsis: Tony Stark, captured and wounded, builds the first Iron Man armor to escape. Cold War origins, early armor evolution, the Mandarin debuts (#50), and Black Widow's first appearance (#52). The foundation of Marvel's tech hero.
connection_notes: Budget alternative to Tales of Suspense Omnibus Vol. 1. Leads to: Iron Man Demon in a Bottle. Parallel: other Silver Age origins.

title: Captain America Epic Collection: The Coming of the Falcon
issues_collected: Captain America #100-119
synopsis: Cap gets his own title and gains his greatest partner. The Falcon debuts (#117) as the first African-American superhero in mainstream comics. Red Skull clashes, MODOK appears, and Cap confronts 1960s political upheaval.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Avengers Omnibus Vol. 1 (Cap's revival). Leads to: Cap Englehart Omnibus (Secret Empire). Foundation for Cap/Falcon partnership.

title: Wolverine Epic Collection: Back to Basics
issues_collected: Wolverine (1988) #1-23
synopsis: Logan's first ongoing solo series. Patch persona in Madripoor, Jessica Drew crossover, Silver Samurai, and the Gehenna Stone affair. Claremont explores Wolverine independent of the X-Men in a noir-flavored Pacific Rim setting.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Wolverine by Claremont/Miller limited series. Leads to: Wolverine Hama Omnibus Vol. 1. Parallel: UXM Claremont Omnibus Vol. 4-5.

title: X-Force Epic Collection: Under the Gun
issues_collected: X-Force #1-15, New Mutants #100
synopsis: Cable transforms the New Mutants into X-Force, a proactive paramilitary mutant team. Deadpool cameos, Domino joins, and the early 90s extreme aesthetic is on full display. X-Force #1 sold five million copies. Peak speculation era.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: New Mutants Omnibus Vol. 2. Leads to: X-Cutioner's Song crossover. Parallel: X-Men (1991) Omnibus Vol. 1. Deadpool spins off from here.

title: Werewolf by Night Epic Collection: Full Moon Rise
issues_collected: Marvel Spotlight #2-4, Werewolf by Night #1-20
synopsis: Jack Russell's lycanthropic curse anchors Marvel's Bronze Age horror line. Moon Knight first appears in #32 of the ongoing (later volumes). Atmospheric horror with a sympathetic monster protagonist and classic Ploog artwork.
connection_notes: Parallel: Tomb of Dracula, Ghost Rider, Man-Thing. Part of Marvel's Bronze Age horror expansion. Leads to: Moon Knight's solo career.

title: New Warriors Epic Collection: Forces of Darkness, Forces of Light
issues_collected: New Warriors #1-18, Thor #411-412
synopsis: Young heroes Night Thrasher, Nova, Namorita, Firestar, Speedball, and Marvel Boy form a new generation of Avengers-level heroes. Fresh and energetic, the team that would later be tragically connected to Civil War's inciting incident.
connection_notes: Leads to: Civil War (Stamford incident). Parallel: early 90s team books. Characters previously appeared in various solo titles.

title: Amazing Spider-Man Compendium Vol. 1
issues_collected: Amazing Fantasy #15, Amazing Spider-Man #1-67, Annuals #1-5
synopsis: Massive budget-friendly collection spanning the entire Ditko and early Romita eras. Every classic villain origin, Uncle Ben's death, the Master Planner Saga, the Goblin mystery, Gwen Stacy and MJ's introductions. The definitive Silver Age Spider-Man.
connection_notes: Budget alternative to ASM Omnibus Vols. 1-2. Covers the most essential Spider-Man stories. Leads to: Spider-Man Death of the Stacys.

title: X-Men Milestone Compendium Vol. 1
issues_collected: Giant-Size X-Men #1, Uncanny X-Men #94-179, Annuals #3-8
synopsis: The essential Claremont X-Men run in one massive, affordable volume. New team formation, Phoenix Saga, Dark Phoenix Saga, Days of Future Past, Brood Saga, and the start of the Morlock storylines. Covers UXM Omnibus Vols. 1-3 content.
connection_notes: Budget alternative to UXM Claremont Omnibus Vols. 1-3. The most important X-Men stories ever published. Leads to: X-Men Milestone Compendium Vol. 2.

title: Avengers Compendium Vol. 1
issues_collected: Avengers #1-50
synopsis: The first fifty issues of Earth's Mightiest Heroes. Team formation, Captain America's revival (#4), Kang debut, Cap's Kooky Quartet, Ultron's origin, and the Vision's introduction. Budget-friendly way to experience Silver Age Avengers.
connection_notes: Budget alternative to Avengers Omnibus Vols. 1-2. Parallel: FF, Spider-Man Silver Age. Leads to: Kree-Skrull War in Avengers.

title: Venom Modern Era Compendium Vol. 1
issues_collected: Venom (2018) #1-35, plus Web of Venom tie-ins
synopsis: Donny Cates reinvents Venom mythology. Knull, the God of Symbiotes, is revealed as the void before creation. Eddie Brock's bond with the symbiote deepens. Leads directly into Absolute Carnage and King in Black.
connection_notes: Budget alternative to Venom by Cates Omnibus. Leads to: Absolute Carnage, King in Black. Prerequisite for modern Venom mythology.

title: Deadpool Modern Era Compendium
synopsis: The definitive modern Deadpool run. Dead Presidents arc, SHIELD agent Wade, marriage to Shiklah, and the tragedy beneath the comedy. Duggan and Posehn find the emotional core of the Merc with a Mouth.
connection_notes: Budget alternative to Deadpool Posehn/Duggan Omnibus. Leads to: Deadpool in Uncanny Avengers. Parallel: other All-New Marvel Now titles.

title: Punisher Compendium Vol. 1
issues_collected: Punisher MAX #1-60
synopsis: Garth Ennis's brutal, unflinching MAX series. Frank Castle in a world without superheroes. Born, In the Beginning, The Slavers, Barracuda, and Long Cold Dark. The most acclaimed Punisher run and a defining work of the MAX imprint.
connection_notes: Budget alternative to Punisher MAX Omnibus Vols. 1-2. Mature readers. Standalone continuity. The definitive Punisher story.

title: Wolverine Compendium Vol. 1
issues_collected: Wolverine (1988) #1-47
synopsis: The first chunk of Wolverine's solo ongoing. Claremont's Madripoor Patch era transitions to Larry Hama's definitive character-building run. Sabretooth rivalry deepens, Weapon X backstory hints, and Logan's struggle with his feral nature.
connection_notes: Budget alternative to Wolverine Hama Omnibus Vol. 1. Leads to: Wolverine Hama Omnibus Vol. 2. Parallel: UXM Claremont Omnibus Vols. 4-5.

title: Moon Knight Compendium
issues_collected: Moon Knight (1980) #1-38, Moon Knight Special Edition #1-3
synopsis: Marc Spector, Steven Grant, Jake Lockley -- the original Moon Knight run that established the character's dissociative identity disorder and Khonshu mythology. Sienkiewicz's art evolves from Neal Adams homage to avant-garde expressionism.
connection_notes: Budget alternative to Moon Knight Moench Omnibus Vol. 1. Leads to: Marc Spector Moon Knight Omnibus, then Ellis relaunch. Foundation for all Moon Knight.

title: Marvel Horror Compendium
issues_collected: Tomb of Dracula #1-25, Werewolf by Night #1-15, Ghost Rider #1-10, Man-Thing #1-10
synopsis: The essential Bronze Age Marvel horror titles collected together. Tomb of Dracula's literary vampire saga, Werewolf by Night's lycanthropic tragedy, Ghost Rider's supernatural vengeance, and Man-Thing's swamp horror. Blade debuts in Tomb of Dracula #10.
connection_notes: Parallel: mainstream Marvel Bronze Age. Blade debut here leads to modern Blade stories. Foundation for Blood Hunt (2024).

title: Spider-Man: Clone Saga Complete Compendium
issues_collected: Web of Spider-Man #117-129, ASM #394-406, Spider-Man #51-63, Spectacular Spider-Man #217-229
synopsis: The infamous Clone Saga in its entirety. Ben Reilly returns, Peter's clone or original status flips repeatedly, and editorial chaos reigns. Historically significant as the storyline that nearly destroyed Spider-Man. Essential for understanding 90s Marvel's crisis.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: ASM Omnibus Vol. 3 (original clone storyline). Leads to: Heroes Reborn era. Budget alternative to Clone Saga Omnibus Vols. 1-2. CONTINUITY WARNING: highly contested.

title: Wolverine: Origin
issues_collected: Origin #1-6
synopsis: The long-awaited origin of Wolverine. Young James Howlett in 19th century Alberta, the first emergence of bone claws, and the tragedy that forged the man who would become Logan. Painted art by Andy Kubert in a prestige format.
connection_notes: Fills in backstory for all Wolverine. Leads to: Wolverine by Claremont/Miller, Weapon X program. Standalone but enriches every Wolverine story.

title: Doctor Strange: The Oath
issues_collected: Doctor Strange: The Oath #1-5
synopsis: Strange quests for a magical elixir that could cure all disease -- including Wong's terminal cancer. A mystery that questions whether Strange became the wrong kind of doctor. Widely considered the best Doctor Strange story of the modern era.
connection_notes: Standalone but enriches New Avengers (Strange as a member). Parallel: Bendis Avengers era. Perfect entry point for Doctor Strange.

title: Spider-Man: Blue
issues_collected: Spider-Man: Blue #1-6
synopsis: Peter Parker revisits his early days with Gwen Stacy on Valentine's Day, telling the story of falling in love while battling the Green Goblin and the Rhino. A beautiful, melancholy love letter to the Romita-era ASM stories.
connection_notes: Retells/enhances ASM #40-75 era. Part of the Loeb/Sale 'color' series (Blue, Yellow, Gray, White). Standalone but enriched by reading ASM Omnibus Vol. 2.

title: Daredevil: Yellow
issues_collected: Daredevil: Yellow #1-6
synopsis: Matt Murdock writes letters to Karen Page, revisiting his early days as Daredevil -- the yellow costume, early encounters with Electro and the Owl, and falling in love with Karen. A moving, painterly retelling of DD's origin era.
connection_notes: Retells/enhances Daredevil #1-7 era. Part of the Loeb/Sale 'color' series. Standalone but pairs well with DD Miller Omnibus.

title: Hulk: Gray
issues_collected: Hulk: Gray #1-6
synopsis: Bruce Banner and Doc Samson revisit the first terrifying days of the Hulk -- the gamma bomb test, the gray-skinned original Hulk, Betty Ross, and General Thunderbolt Ross. A tragic retelling of Incredible Hulk #1-6.
connection_notes: Retells Incredible Hulk #1-6 era. Part of the Loeb/Sale 'color' series. Standalone but enriched by Hulk Epic: Man or Monster.

title: Captain America: White
issues_collected: Captain America: White #0-5
synopsis: Steve Rogers remembers Bucky Barnes in a WWII-set story about their earliest partnership. The final installment of the Loeb/Sale 'color' series, completed after Tim Sale's passing. A tribute to heroism and friendship.
connection_notes: Part of the Loeb/Sale 'color' series (Blue, Yellow, Gray, White). Standalone. Enriched by Captain America Brubaker (Winter Soldier).

title: Silver Surfer: Parable
issues_collected: Silver Surfer: Parable #1-2
synopsis: Galactus returns to Earth not to devour it but to be worshipped as a god. The Silver Surfer must confront religious fanaticism. Stan Lee's final great Silver Surfer story, illustrated by legendary French artist Moebius in a stunning prestige format.
connection_notes: Standalone. Prerequisite: FF Omnibus Vol. 2 (Galactus Trilogy) for context. A masterclass in comics storytelling by two legends.

title: Punisher: Born
issues_collected: Punisher: Born #1-4
synopsis: Vietnam, 1971. Captain Frank Castle's final tour at Firebase Valley Forge. The war is lost, his base is about to be overrun, and something inside Frank makes a deal. The true origin of the Punisher -- where the killing started.
connection_notes: Prequel to Punisher MAX. Leads to: Punisher MAX Omnibus Vol. 1. Essential context for Ennis's entire Punisher run. Mature readers.

title: Marvel Boy
issues_collected: Marvel Boy #1-6
synopsis: Noh-Varr, a Kree warrior from another dimension, crash-lands on Earth and declares war on humanity. Morrison's punk-rock take on the Marvel Universe, with kinetic action and subversive ideas. Noh-Varr later joins the Avengers.
connection_notes: Leads to: Dark Avengers (Noh-Varr as Captain Marvel), Young Avengers by Gillen. Parallel: Morrison's New X-Men. Early Marvel Knights experimentation.

title: Inhumans vs. X-Men
issues_collected: IVX #1-6, plus tie-ins
synopsis: The Terrigen Mist cloud is sterilizing mutants. The X-Men go to war against the Inhumans to destroy it. Emma Frost's descent into villainy begins here. The event that ended Marvel's Inhumans push and restored X-Men prominence.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Death of X, Extraordinary X-Men. Leads to: ResurrXion relaunch, Emma Frost as villain. Parallel: All-New All-Different era.

title: Death of the Inhumans
issues_collected: Death of the Inhumans #1-5
synopsis: The Kree Empire unleashes Vox to systematically exterminate every Inhuman. Black Bolt faces the genocide of his people. Brutal, high-stakes cosmic horror that dramatically reduces the Inhuman population and sets up a darker status quo.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Inhumans vs. X-Men, Royals. Parallel: Cates's Venom run. Leads to: reduced Inhuman presence in Marvel.

title: Miracleman: The Silver Age
issues_collected: Miracleman: The Silver Age #1-7
synopsis: The long-awaited continuation of Gaiman and Buckingham's Miracleman, finally completed after decades of legal disputes. Young Miracleman returns from the dead into a utopian world he doesn't recognize. Meditative, literary superhero storytelling.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Miracleman by Moore, Miracleman: The Golden Age by Gaiman. Standalone from main Marvel continuity. Published under Marvel's imprint.

title: Amazing Fantasy (2022)
issues_collected: Amazing Fantasy (2022) #1-5
synopsis: A World War II-set alternate take on Spider-Man's origin, reimagining Peter Parker as a young soldier who gains spider-powers during the war. Kaare Andrews delivers a cinematic, beautifully painted reimagining of the foundational Spider-Man myth.
connection_notes: Standalone alternate universe story. Thematic connection to Captain America WWII stories. Not connected to main 616 continuity.

title: The Twelve
issues_collected: The Twelve #1-12
synopsis: Twelve Golden Age heroes captured by Nazis in 1945 are revived in the modern Marvel Universe. A murder mystery and character study as these relics of a different era confront a world that moved on without them. Phantom Reporter, Blue Blade, and Electro among the twelve.
connection_notes: Standalone limited series. Parallel: other Golden Age revivalist stories. Thematic connection to Captain America's man-out-of-time theme.

title: Marvels Annotated
issues_collected: Marvels #0-4 (annotated edition with supplementary material)
synopsis: The definitive edition of the landmark series, with extensive annotations revealing every reference and Easter egg. Photorealist Phil Sheldon witnesses the Marvel Universe from street level. Enhanced with Ross's original sketches and Busiek's commentary.
connection_notes: Enhanced version of Marvels. Standalone but references entire Marvel history from 1939-1974. Pairs with: FF, Spider-Man, and X-Men Silver Age stories.

title: Marvel Zombies: The Complete Collection Vol. 1
issues_collected: Marvel Zombies #1-5, Marvel Zombies: Dead Days, Ultimate Fantastic Four #21-23, 30-32
synopsis: Earth-2149: a zombie virus infects every superhero. The Avengers, X-Men, and FF become flesh-eating monsters who devour Galactus and gain cosmic power. Darkly comedic horror from Walking Dead creator Robert Kirkman. Originated in Ultimate FF.
connection_notes: Alternate universe (Earth-2149). Originated from Ultimate FF crossover. Leads to: Marvel Zombies Complete Collection Vol. 2. No 616 continuity impact.

title: Marvel Zombies: The Complete Collection Vol. 2
issues_collected: Marvel Zombies 2 #1-5, Marvel Zombies 3 #1-4, Marvel Zombies 4 #1-4
synopsis: The zombie saga continues. Zombie Galacti return to Earth, Machine Man and Jocasta face the infection in MZ3, and Morbius tries to contain the virus in MZ4. The zombie universe expands with increasingly creative horror scenarios.
connection_notes: Sequel to Marvel Zombies Complete Collection Vol. 1. Alternate universe. No 616 continuity impact. Machine Man's role leads to his Agent of ARMOR status.

title: Earth X
issues_collected: Earth X #0-12, #X
synopsis: An alternate future where everyone on Earth has gained superpowers via Terrigen Mists. An obese, retired Captain America narrates as Machine Man investigates. A grand unified theory of the Marvel Universe that recontextualizes Celestials, Inhumans, and mutants.
connection_notes: Alternate universe. Leads to: Universe X. Ross's worldbuilding connects all Marvel mythology. Standalone but rewards deep Marvel knowledge.

title: Universe X
issues_collected: Universe X #0-12, #X
synopsis: The sequel to Earth X. Mar-Vell builds a paradise in the Realm of the Dead while the living world faces a new Celestial threat. Captain America carries the torch. Deeper mythology about death, resurrection, and the nature of Marvel's cosmic order.
connection_notes: Sequel to Earth X. Leads to: Paradise X (trilogy conclusion). Same alternate universe. Dense, rewarding cosmic mythology.

title: Spider-Man Noir: The Complete Collection
issues_collected: Spider-Man Noir #1-4, Spider-Man Noir: Eyes Without a Face #1-4
synopsis: 1933, the Great Depression. Peter Parker gains spider-powers and becomes a masked vigilante fighting the Goblin's criminal empire. Pulp noir aesthetic meets Spider-Man mythology. The version featured in Into the Spider-Verse and the live-action Noir series.
connection_notes: Alternate universe (Earth-90214). Connected to Spider-Verse events. Standalone noir reimagining. Foundation for Amazon's Spider-Noir show.

title: Old Man Hawkeye
issues_collected: Old Man Hawkeye #1-12
synopsis: Set five years before Old Man Logan. Clint Barton is going blind and embarks on a revenge quest against the former allies who betrayed the Avengers. A prequel that fleshes out the Wasteland timeline with stunning Checchetto artwork.
connection_notes: Prequel to Old Man Logan by Millar/McNiven. Same alternate universe (Earth-807128). Parallel: Old Man Logan, Old Man Quill.

title: Old Man Quill
issues_collected: Old Man Quill #1-12
synopsis: Peter Quill returns to Earth in the Wasteland timeline to find the planet conquered by super-villains. A cosmic perspective on the Old Man Logan universe, with Quill leading a ragtag team through villain-controlled territories.
connection_notes: Set in the Old Man Logan universe (Earth-807128). Parallel: Old Man Logan, Old Man Hawkeye. Standalone but enriched by the other 'Old Man' titles.

title: Spider-Punk: Arms Race
issues_collected: Spider-Punk: Arms Race #1-4
synopsis: Hobie Brown, the anarchist Spider-Man of Earth-138, faces a new corporate threat after defeating President Osborn. Punk rock energy meets superhero action in a universe where the revolution never stops. Follows Spider-Punk: Battle of the Banned.
connection_notes: Alternate universe (Earth-138). Connected to Spider-Verse. Sequel to Spider-Punk: Battle of the Banned. Standalone.

title: What If? Classic Complete Collection Vol. 1
synopsis: The Watcher presents alternate realities: What if Spider-Man joined the Fantastic Four? What if the Hulk had Bruce Banner's brain? What if the Avengers had never been? Classic 'road not taken' stories that explore Marvel's multiverse concept.
connection_notes: Standalone alternate universe stories. Foundation for the What If...? Disney+ series. Parallel: all main Marvel continuity (these diverge from it).

title: Avengers Forever Omnibus
issues_collected: Avengers Forever #1-12, Avengers #1.5, plus supplementary material
synopsis: Rick Jones summons Avengers from across time to fight Immortus and the Time-Keepers. Past, present, and future Avengers unite in a love letter to Avengers history. Busiek masterfully weaves decades of continuity into a time-spanning epic.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: broad Avengers knowledge. Connects to: Kang Dynasty, Avengers Busiek/Perez. References every era of Avengers history. A continuity nerd's dream.

title: Sins of Sinister Omnibus
issues_collected: Sins of Sinister #1, Immoral X-Men #1-3, Storm & the Brotherhood of Mutants #1-3, Nightcrawlers #1-3, Sins of Sinister: Dominion #1
synopsis: Sinister hijacks the Quiet Council and creates a dark timeline where Krakoa conquers the galaxy. Spanning 100, 1000, and 10 years into the future, each mini-series shows how Sinister's manipulations corrupt mutantkind. Essential for understanding the Fall of X setup.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Immortal X-Men by Gillen. Leads to: Fall of X. Parallel: X-Men Red by Ewing Vol. 2.

title: Dark X-Men by Steve Foxe (2023)
issues_collected: Dark X-Men #1-5
synopsis: During Fall of X, Madelyne Pryor leads a team of morally ambiguous mutants including Gambit, Havok, and Gimmick against Orchis from the shadows. A street-level resistance story set against the anti-mutant crackdown.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Fall of X Vol. 1. Parallel: Uncanny Spider-Man, X-Men by Duggan Vol. 2. Leads to: Dead X-Men.

title: Jean Grey by Schultz (2023)
issues_collected: Jean Grey #1-4
synopsis: During Fall of X, Jean Grey goes underground and confronts her legacy as Phoenix and her relationship with the psychic plane. A character study exploring Jean's identity beyond her cosmic powers during the Orchis persecution.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Fall of X Vol. 1. Parallel: Dark X-Men, X-Men by Duggan Vol. 2. Leads to: Rise of the Powers of X.

title: Realm of X
issues_collected: Realm of X #1-4
synopsis: Mutants stranded in Vanaheim after Judgment Day must survive in a hostile Asgardian realm. Dani Moonstar, Magik, Marrow, Dust, and others forge alliances with Norse mythology. A Fall of X survival tale.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Judgment Day. Parallel: Fall of X titles. Leads to: Fall of House of X.

title: Dead X-Men by Steve Foxe
issues_collected: Dead X-Men #1-4
synopsis: Resurrected mutants travel through Moira MacTaggert's past lives to stop the existential threat revealed in Powers of X. Cannonball, Prodigy, Dazzler, Frenzy, and Jubilee hop between timelines in a crucial tie-in to the Krakoa finale.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: House of X/Powers of X, Fall of X Vol. 1. Leads to: Rise of the Powers of X. Parallel: Fall of House of X.

title: Resurrection of Magneto
issues_collected: Resurrection of Magneto #1-4
synopsis: Magneto died during the Hellfire Gala massacre and now Storm journeys into the afterlife to bring him back. A meditation on legacy, death, and what Magneto means to mutantkind. Essential for understanding the Fall of X endgame.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: X-Men Red by Ewing Vol. 2, Fall of X. Leads to: Rise of the Powers of X. Parallel: Fall of House of X.

title: Rogue & Gambit by Kelly Thompson
issues_collected: Rogue & Gambit #1-5
synopsis: Rogue and Gambit go undercover at a couples retreat that's actually a mutant power-draining trap. Their relationship baggage gets weaponized against them. A fun romance-adventure that relaunched their relationship for the Krakoa era.
connection_notes: Leads to: Mr. & Mrs. X by Thompson. Sets up Rogue/Gambit marriage in X-Men Gold #30.

title: Mr. & Mrs. X by Kelly Thompson
issues_collected: Mr. & Mrs. X #1-12
synopsis: Newlyweds Rogue and Gambit honeymoon through cosmic adventures involving the Shi'ar, Deadpool, and a power-absorbing baby. Thompson writes the definitive modern Rogue/Gambit dynamic with humor and heart.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Rogue & Gambit by Thompson. Leads to: Excalibur by Howard (Krakoa era). Parallel: X-Men Gold.

title: Betsy Braddock: Captain Britain
issues_collected: Betsy Braddock: Captain Britain #1-5
synopsis: Betsy Braddock claims the Captain Britain mantle permanently, defending the Starlight Citadel and Otherworld. Continues threads from Excalibur and Knights of X as Betsy faces Morgan Le Fay and interdimensional threats.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Knights of X by Howard. Parallel: Trials of X titles. Leads to: Fall of X.

title: Marauders by Orlando Vol. 2
issues_collected: Marauders (2022) #7-12
synopsis: Kitty Pryde's Marauders continue sailing into danger, dealing with anti-mutant threats on the high seas. The team confronts Orchis precursors and defends Krakoa's interests abroad as tensions build toward the Hellfire Gala.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Marauders by Duggan Vol. 1. Parallel: X-Men by Duggan Vol. 1. Leads to: Hellfire Gala 2023.

title: X-Men by Gerry Duggan Vol. 2
synopsis: The flagship X-Men team faces escalating Orchis threats. Firestar joins the team as a mole, Synch and Talon's relationship deepens, and the road to the catastrophic Hellfire Gala 2023 begins. Duggan builds toward the Fall of X.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: X-Men by Duggan Vol. 1. Leads to: X-Men: Hellfire Gala 2023, Fall of X. Parallel: Immortal X-Men by Gillen.

title: X-Men by Jed MacKay (2024)
synopsis: The From the Ashes flagship. Cyclops leads a new X-Men team from a base in Alaska, rebuilding trust with humanity after Krakoa's fall. The team faces new threats while dealing with the fallout of the mutant nation's collapse.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Rise of the Powers of X. Parallel: Uncanny X-Men by Simone, Exceptional X-Men. Part of From the Ashes relaunch.

title: Uncanny X-Men by Gail Simone (2024)
issues_collected: Uncanny X-Men (2024) #1-6
synopsis: Rogue leads a squad of X-Men in the Louisiana bayou, protecting a new mutant community. Simone introduces new mutant characters while weaving in classic team dynamics. A Southern Gothic take on the X-Men in the From the Ashes era.
connection_notes: Parallel: X-Men by MacKay, Exceptional X-Men. Part of From the Ashes relaunch. Prerequisite: Rise of the Powers of X.

title: X-Force by Geoffrey Thorne (2024)
synopsis: Forge leads a new X-Force as a mutant black-ops team in the post-Krakoa landscape. Without resurrection protocols, every mission carries real stakes. The team operates from the shadows to protect mutantkind.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: X-Force by Percy. Part of From the Ashes relaunch. Parallel: X-Men by MacKay.

title: X-Factor by Mark Russell (2024)
synopsis: Havok leads a government-sanctioned mutant team in the From the Ashes era. Russell brings his trademark satirical edge to mutant politics, exploring what happens when X-Men become civil servants accountable to human bureaucracy.
connection_notes: Part of From the Ashes relaunch. Parallel: X-Men by MacKay, Uncanny X-Men by Simone.

title: Dazzler by Jason Loo (2024)
issues_collected: Dazzler #1-4
synopsis: Alison Blaire returns to her music career in the post-Krakoa world, juggling mutant identity with pop stardom. A fun, music-infused mini-series that explores Dazzler's unique position as a publicly out mutant entertainer.
connection_notes: Part of From the Ashes relaunch. Parallel: other From the Ashes titles.

title: X-Men: Before the Fall
issues_collected: X-Men: Before the Fall - Sinister Four #1, Heralds of Apocalypse #1, Sons of X #1, Mutant First Strike #1
synopsis: Four one-shots bridging Sins of Sinister to the Hellfire Gala 2023 massacre. Sinister plots, Apocalypse prepares, and the stage is set for Orchis to strike. Key connective tissue for the Fall of X.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Sins of Sinister. Leads to: X-Men: Hellfire Gala 2023. Bridges the gap between Sins of Sinister and Fall of X.

title: X-Men: Hellfire Gala 2022
issues_collected: X-Men: Hellfire Gala (2022) #1, plus tie-in issues from X-Men, Marauders, and others
synopsis: The second annual Hellfire Gala. Krakoa terraforms Mars/Arakko, a new X-Men team is elected, and mutantkind flexes its power before the world. Leads directly into Judgment Day as the Eternals take notice.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: X-Men by Duggan Vol. 1. Leads to: Judgment Day (A.X.E.). Parallel: Immortal X-Men, X-Men Red.

title: X-Men: Hellfire Gala 2023
issues_collected: X-Men: Hellfire Gala (2023) #1, Free Comic Book Day 2023: Avengers/X-Men #1
synopsis: THE turning point of the Krakoa era. Orchis springs its trap at the third Hellfire Gala, killing mutants and exiling the X-Men through Krakoan gates to unknown locations. Magneto falls. The Fall of X begins here.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: X-Men by Duggan Vol. 2, Before the Fall. Leads to: ALL Fall of X titles. THE inciting incident for Fall of X.

title: New Mutants: Lethal Legion
issues_collected: New Mutants: Lethal Legion #1-5
synopsis: During Fall of X, scattered New Mutants form an unlikely alliance with villains to survive Orchis persecution. Escapist, Cerebella, and other new characters join classic members in a desperate resistance operation.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Fall of X. Parallel: other Fall of X titles.

title: Gambit by Chris Claremont (2022)
synopsis: Claremont returns to write Gambit in a Krakoa-era solo adventure. Remy LeBeau investigates a mystery in New Orleans tied to his thieves guild past, blending his Cajun roots with mutant nation politics.
connection_notes: Parallel: Krakoa-era titles. Claremont's return to X-Men characters.

title: Weapon X-Men
issues_collected: Weapon X-Men #1-4
synopsis: Spinning out of X Lives of Wolverine, a team of multiversal Wolverines assembles to fight a threat across realities. Features variants of Logan from alternate timelines teaming up in a multiverse-spanning adventure.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: X Lives/Deaths of Wolverine. Parallel: Krakoa-era titles.

title: Children of the Vault (2023)
issues_collected: Children of the Vault #1-4
synopsis: During Fall of X, the Children of the Vault — post-humans evolving at accelerated rates inside a time-dilated space — emerge as a third faction beyond humans and mutants. Ties into long-running Vault threads from Hickman's X-Men.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: X-Men by Hickman (Vault storyline). Parallel: Fall of X titles.

title: Ms. Marvel: The New Mutant
issues_collected: Ms. Marvel: The New Mutant #1-4
synopsis: After being resurrected by the X-Men during Fall of X, Kamala Khan discovers she's actually a mutant — an Inhuman/mutant hybrid. Co-written by Iman Vellani (MCU's Ms. Marvel), Kamala navigates her new identity among the X-Men.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Fall of X, Ms. Marvel by Wilson. Leads to: X-Men by MacKay (2024). Bridges Ms. Marvel into the X-Men line.

title: Wolverine: Blood Hunt
issues_collected: Wolverine: Blood Hunt #1-4
synopsis: During Blood Hunt's vampire invasion, Wolverine faces a supernatural threat that his healing factor can't handle. Logan fights through vampire-infested territory in a horror-action tie-in to the main Blood Hunt event.
connection_notes: Tie-in to: Blood Hunt. Parallel: Blood Hunt Companion titles.

title: X-Terminators by Leah Williams
issues_collected: X-Terminators #1-5
synopsis: Jubilee, Dazzler, Boom-Boom, and Wolverine (Laura) have a wild night out that turns into a vampire-fighting adventure. A fun, irreverent Krakoa-era romp that's pure entertainment with razor-sharp humor.
connection_notes: Parallel: Krakoa-era titles. Self-contained fun.

title: Dark X-Men by Steve Foxe (2024 - From the Ashes)
issues_collected: Dark X-Men (2024) #1-5
synopsis: In the From the Ashes era, Madelyne Pryor and her team of outcast mutants continue operating in the moral gray zone. Following up on the Fall of X Dark X-Men, the team exists outside both human and mutant society.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Dark X-Men by Foxe (2023). Part of From the Ashes relaunch. Parallel: X-Men by MacKay.

title: Wolverine: Madripoor Knights
issues_collected: Wolverine: Madripoor Knights #1-5
synopsis: Claremont returns to Madripoor for a Wolverine and Captain America team-up set during the classic era. A period piece featuring Logan as Patch in the criminal underworld of Madripoor alongside Steve Rogers.
connection_notes: Flashback story. References: UXM Claremont Omnibus Vol. 3 (Madripoor era). Standalone adventure.

title: Venom by Al Ewing & Ram V (2021)
synopsis: Following Cates' run, Ewing and Ram V split the book between Eddie Brock (lost in time as a symbiote god) and Dylan Brock (the new Venom on Earth). Expands symbiote mythology into cosmic horror territory with the Garden of Time.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Venom by Cates Omnibus, King in Black. Leads to: Venom War. Parallel: Carnage by Ram V.

title: Carnage by Ram V (2023)
synopsis: Carnage evolves beyond Cletus Kasady into something cosmic and terrifying. Ram V brings horror-literary ambition to symbiote lore, connecting Carnage to the Eventide and building toward Venom War. A surprisingly cerebral take on Marvel's most violent character.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: King in Black. Leads to: Venom War. Parallel: Venom by Ewing/Ram V.

title: Miles Morales: Spider-Man by Cody Ziglar
issues_collected: Miles Morales: Spider-Man (2022) #1-12
synopsis: Miles Morales starts fresh in Brooklyn, facing Rabble and her villainous network while juggling college life. Ziglar brings hip-hop energy and generational conflict to Miles, establishing him firmly as his own Spider-Man beyond Peter Parker's shadow.
connection_notes: Parallel: ASM by Wells. Leads to: Gang War tie-ins. Continues Miles' 616 journey post-Ultimate Universe.

title: Doctor Strange by Jed MacKay (2023)
issues_collected: Doctor Strange (2023) #1-10
synopsis: Stephen Strange returns from death, rebuilding his practice as Sorcerer Supreme. MacKay crafts a definitive modern Strange run, culminating in the events that lead to Blood Hunt and Strange's ultimate sacrifice against the vampire invasion.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Death of Doctor Strange. Leads to: Blood Hunt. Parallel: Scarlet Witch by Orlando.

title: Strange by Jed MacKay (2022)
synopsis: After Death of Doctor Strange, Clea takes over as Sorcerer Supreme. MacKay writes Clea's journey to prove herself worthy of the title while dealing with threats from the Dark Dimension and Strange's lingering absence.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Death of Doctor Strange. Leads to: Doctor Strange by MacKay (2023). Features Clea as Sorcerer Supreme.

title: Captain America: Symbol of Truth by Nnedi Okorafor
issues_collected: Captain America: Symbol of Truth #1-12
synopsis: Sam Wilson as Captain America tackles international threats including Wakandan politics, the White Wolf, and a global conspiracy involving Vibranium trafficking. Okorafor brings an Afrofuturist lens to Sam's Captain America.
connection_notes: Parallel: Captain America: Sentinel of Liberty. Leads to: Captain America: Cold War crossover.

title: Iron Man by Christopher Cantwell Complete Collection
issues_collected: Iron Man (2020) #1-25, Iron Man Annual #1
synopsis: Tony Stark strips his life back to basics: no corporate empire, no billion-dollar suits. Cantwell deconstructs Stark's addiction to power and technology. Features Korvac as the main antagonist, cosmic-level threats, and Tony confronting mortality.
connection_notes: Standalone modern Iron Man. Leads into post-2023 Iron Man status quo.

title: Shang-Chi by Gene Luen Yang (2021)
issues_collected: Shang-Chi (2021) #1-12
synopsis: Shang-Chi inherits leadership of the Five Weapons Society, his father's secret organization. Yang reinvents Shang-Chi's mythos, giving him a family of martial-arts siblings and removing the Fu Manchu baggage. Timed with the MCU film.
connection_notes: Leads to: Shang-Chi and the Ten Rings. Modern reinvention of the character.

title: Ghost Rider by Benjamin Percy (2022)
issues_collected: Ghost Rider (2022) #1-12
synopsis: Johnny Blaze returns as Ghost Rider in a horror-infused road trip across America. Percy writes Spirit of Vengeance as a terrifying force, with Blaze fighting demonic corruption spreading through small-town America. Dark, atmospheric supernatural Marvel.
connection_notes: Parallel: Avengers by Aaron (supernatural elements). Standalone Ghost Rider horror.

title: Punisher by Jason Aaron (2022)
issues_collected: Punisher (2022) #1-13
synopsis: Frank Castle becomes the Fist of the Beast, the Hand's ultimate weapon and high slayer. Aaron reimagines Punisher through a supernatural lens, giving Frank an ancient demonic war machine. Controversial but ambitious — Frank trades his skull for the Hand.
connection_notes: Standalone reinvention. Controversial status quo change for Frank Castle. Leads to restoration of classic Punisher.

title: Death of Doctor Strange by Jed MacKay
issues_collected: Death of Doctor Strange #1-5
synopsis: Stephen Strange is murdered, and a younger version of himself from the past must solve his own murder while Earth's magical defenses collapse. MacKay crafts a magical mystery that reshapes the Sorcerer Supreme role and leads to Clea taking the mantle.
connection_notes: Leads to: Strange by MacKay (Clea as Sorcerer Supreme). Prerequisite for understanding Blood Hunt's magical landscape.

title: Darkhold: Pages from the Book of Sins (2021)
issues_collected: Darkhold Alpha #1, Darkhold: Iron Man #1, Darkhold: Blade #1, Darkhold: Wasp #1, Darkhold: Spider-Man #1, Darkhold: Black Bolt #1, Darkhold Omega #1
synopsis: The Scarlet Witch assembles heroes to read the Darkhold and enter a corrupted reality. Each issue reimagines a hero through a horror lens. Orlando expands Wanda's magical mythology and sets up Scarlet Witch threads.
connection_notes: Parallel: Scarlet Witch by Orlando. References: Doctor Strange mystical corner of Marvel.

title: Dark Web by Zeb Wells
issues_collected: Dark Web #1, Amazing Spider-Man (2022) #14-18, Dark Web: X-Men #1-3, Dark Web: Ms. Marvel #1-2, Venom (2021) #14-15, Dark Web Finale #1
synopsis: Ben Reilly (now Chasm) and Madelyne Pryor (Goblin Queen) team up to unleash Limbo's demons on New York, pitting Spider-Man and the X-Men against dark clones and demonic forces. A Spider-Man/X-Men crossover event.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: ASM by Wells. Parallel: X-Men Krakoa-era titles. Spider-Man/X-Men crossover.

title: Spider-Boy by Dan Slott
issues_collected: Spider-Boy #1-10
synopsis: Bailey Briggs, a teenage spider-hero everyone forgot existed due to a magical anomaly, re-emerges in the Marvel Universe. Slott introduces a new legacy character connected to Peter Parker's Spider-Man through reality-warping mystery.
connection_notes: Spins out of: ASM by Wells. New character introduction. Parallel: Amazing Spider-Man ongoing.

title: Gold Goblin by Christopher Cantwell
issues_collected: Gold Goblin #1-5
synopsis: Norman Osborn, cleansed of sin by the Queen Goblin serum in ASM, tries to become a hero as the Gold Goblin. Cantwell explores whether redemption is possible for one of Marvel's greatest villains. A character study of Osborn's guilt.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: ASM by Spencer (Sin Eater arc). Parallel: ASM by Wells. Norman Osborn redemption arc.

title: Spectacular Spider-Man (2024)
issues_collected: Spectacular Spider-Man (2024) #1-6
synopsis: Greg Weisman, creator of the beloved Spectacular Spider-Man animated series, brings his storytelling sensibility to comics. A street-level Peter Parker story emphasizing his supporting cast, science background, and classic rogues gallery.
connection_notes: Parallel: Amazing Spider-Man ongoing. Standalone Peter Parker title.

title: Luke Cage: City of Fire by Ho Che Anderson
issues_collected: Luke Cage: City of Fire #1-3
synopsis: A prestige format Luke Cage story exploring systemic racism and police violence in New York through the lens of Marvel's bulletproof hero. Anderson brings the visual style of his Martin Luther King biography to a superhero narrative.
connection_notes: Standalone prestige series. Thematic connection to Luke Cage: Hero for Hire legacy.

title: Captain Marvel by Alyssa Wong
issues_collected: Captain Marvel (2023) #1-12
synopsis: Carol Danvers faces a new Nega-Band crisis and her complicated Kree heritage. Wong brings Carol into conflict with a corrupted Binary force while exploring her relationship with Yuna Yang, a young woman with a mysterious connection to the Kree.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Captain Marvel by Thompson. Parallel: Avengers titles. Continues Carol's cosmic legacy.

title: Thor by Torunn Gronbekk
synopsis: Thor deals with the aftermath of the God of Hammers saga and faces new Asgardian threats. Gronbekk continues the All-Father Thor status quo, bridging the gap between Aaron's epic and the current Immortal Thor by Ewing.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Thor by Aaron. Leads to: Immortal Thor by Ewing. Bridges Thor eras.

title: Avengers Inc. by Jed MacKay
issues_collected: Avengers Inc. #1-5
synopsis: Wasp (Janet Van Dyne) and Victor Shade (a reconstructed Vision) run a private investigation firm solving Avengers-level mysteries. MacKay crafts a noir detective series within the Marvel Universe, reintroducing classic villains through a mystery lens.
connection_notes: Leads to: Avengers by MacKay flagship. Sets up MacKay's Avengers era.

title: Timeless by Jed MacKay
issues_collected: Timeless #1 (2021), Timeless #1 (2022), Timeless #1 (2023)
synopsis: Annual specials where Kang the Conqueror surveys the timestream, previewing Marvel's upcoming storylines. Each issue seeds future events and introduces concepts like the Missing Moment and Myrddin. MacKay's blueprint for Marvel's future.
connection_notes: Seeds: Blood Hunt, One World Under Doom, Avengers by MacKay. Annual event preview specials.

title: Alien by Phillip Kennedy Johnson
synopsis: Marvel's take on the Alien franchise. A retired Bishop-model synthetic and a former Colonial Marine face a Xenomorph outbreak on a remote facility. Johnson brings horror pacing and body-horror dread to Marvel's newly acquired property.
connection_notes: Standalone (Alien franchise, not connected to main Marvel Universe). Marvel's licensed property.

title: Predator vs. Wolverine
issues_collected: Predator vs. Wolverine #1-4
synopsis: A Predator has been hunting Wolverine across decades — from Weapon X to Madripoor to Krakoa. Percy weaves through Logan's entire history as the ultimate prey faces the ultimate hunter in a timeline-spanning battle.
connection_notes: References: Wolverine's entire history. Standalone crossover between Marvel's licensed properties and mainline characters.

title: Spine-Tingling Spider-Man
issues_collected: Spine-Tingling Spider-Man #0-4
synopsis: A horror-genre Spider-Man story where Peter Parker is trapped in increasingly nightmarish scenarios. Ferreyra's atmospheric art and Ahmed's suspenseful writing create a uniquely creepy take on Spider-Man, blending psychological horror with web-slinging.
connection_notes: Standalone horror Spider-Man. Parallel: ASM by Wells.

title: Symbiote Spider-Man by Peter David
issues_collected: Symbiote Spider-Man #1-5, Symbiote Spider-Man: Alien Reality #1-5
synopsis: Set during the black suit era (ASM #252-300), Peter David fills in untold stories of Spider-Man wearing the alien symbiote. Features encounters with Mysterio, Hobgoblin, and a reality-warping adventure with the alien costume before Peter learned its true nature.
connection_notes: Flashback: Set during ASM Omnibus Vol. 4 era (black suit period). References: Secret Wars 1984 (where Spider-Man gets the symbiote).

title: Amazing Spider-Man by Zeb Wells Vol. 3
issues_collected: Amazing Spider-Man (2022) #26-37
synopsis: The controversial 'death of Ms. Marvel' in issue #26, followed by Gang War setup and the revelation of what Peter did during the missing six months. Wells' run reaches its most divisive and consequential chapters as Peter's world crumbles.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: ASM by Wells Vol. 2. Leads to: Gang War, Ms. Marvel: The New Mutant (Kamala's resurrection). Parallel: Spider-Boy by Slott.

title: Uncanny Spider-Man by Si Spurrier
issues_collected: Uncanny Spider-Man #1-5
synopsis: During Fall of X, Nightcrawler disguises himself as Spider-Man to operate in New York while mutants are hunted by Orchis. Kurt Wagner brings his swashbuckling spirit and Catholic guilt to web-slinging, protecting both humans and mutants in hiding.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Legion of X by Spurrier, Fall of X. Parallel: Dark X-Men (2023), Jean Grey (2023). Part of Fall of X.

title: Tales to Astonish Omnibus Vol. 2
issues_collected: Tales to Astonish #70-101, Incredible Hulk #102
synopsis: Sub-Mariner and Hulk split-feature stories. Namor battles Krang for the Atlantean throne and encounters Dorma's tragic love story. Hulk faces the Leader and the Abomination's first appearance (#90). Transitions into Incredible Hulk #102.
connection_notes: Leads to: Incredible Hulk Omnibus, Sub-Mariner Omnibus. Parallel: Avengers ongoing.

title: Devil Dinosaur by Jack Kirby Complete Collection
issues_collected: Devil Dinosaur #1-9
synopsis: Kirby's wild prehistoric adventure starring Devil Dinosaur and his ape-like companion Moon-Boy. Pure Kirby imagination unleashed in a prehistoric Marvel setting. Later revisited in Moon Girl and Devil Dinosaur.
connection_notes: Parallel: Kirby's late 70s Marvel work. References: Moon Girl and Devil Dinosaur modern series.

title: Deathlok: The Complete Collection (Original)
issues_collected: Astonishing Tales #25-36, Captain America #286-288
synopsis: The original cyborg anti-hero. Luther Manning is killed and resurrected as Deathlok in a dystopian future. One of Marvel's earliest dark sci-fi concepts, predating the cyberpunk genre. Includes Captain America crossover (#286-288).
connection_notes: Parallel: Bronze Age Marvel experimentation. References: Later Deathlok series in the 90s.

title: Marvel Presents: Guardians of the Galaxy
issues_collected: Marvel Super-Heroes #18, Marvel Presents #3-12, Defenders #26-29
synopsis: The original Guardians of the Galaxy from the 31st century: Vance Astro, Martinex, Charlie-27, Yondu, and Starhawk. Their fight against the Badoon oppression in a far-future Marvel Universe. Not the modern team but their predecessors.
connection_notes: Leads to: Guardians of the Galaxy (1990) series. References: Modern GotG encounters the originals in DNA era.

title: Brother Voodoo Complete Collection
issues_collected: Strange Tales #169-173, Tales of the Zombie #6, #10, Marvel Team-Up #24
synopsis: Jericho Drumm becomes Brother Voodoo, Haitian mystic and one of Marvel's earliest Black heroes. Battles supernatural threats using voodoo magic and the spirit of his dead brother Daniel. Later becomes Doctor Voodoo, Sorcerer Supreme.
connection_notes: References: New Avengers (Bendis) where Drumm becomes Sorcerer Supreme. Parallel: Marvel horror line expansion.

title: Omega the Unknown Complete
issues_collected: Omega the Unknown #1-10, Defenders #76-77
synopsis: One of Marvel's most unconventional 70s series. A mysterious alien warrior and a 12-year-old boy share an inexplicable psychic link. Cancelled before resolution; concluded in Defenders #76-77. Jonathan Lethem later revisited the concept in 2007.
connection_notes: Parallel: Gerber's experimental Marvel work (Man-Thing, Howard the Duck). References: Lethem's 2007 revival.

title: Black Goliath Complete Collection
issues_collected: Black Goliath #1-5, Power Man #24-25, Thing #1, Champions #11-12
synopsis: Bill Foster, former lab assistant to Hank Pym, becomes Black Goliath using Pym Particles. A pioneering Black superhero series that was short-lived but historically important. Foster's death in Civil War (#4) decades later became a major controversy.
connection_notes: Parallel: Luke Cage, Black Panther expanding Marvel diversity. References: Civil War #4 (death), Champions ongoing.

title: Jack of Hearts Complete Collection
issues_collected: Deadly Hands of Kung Fu #22-23, Marvel Premiere #44, Jack of Hearts #1-4, Marvel Two-in-One #48
synopsis: Jack Hart gains explosive Zero Energy powers from alien technology. Half-human, half-Contraxian, his body is constantly building toward detonation. A tragic cosmic figure who later joins the Avengers before a sacrificial death in Avengers (1998) #76.
connection_notes: References: Avengers (Busiek/Johns) era where Jack of Hearts joins. Leads to: Avengers Disassembled (posthumous role).

title: Champions Classic Complete
issues_collected: Champions #1-17, Avengers #163, Super-Villain Team-Up #14, Iron Man Annual #4
synopsis: Marvel's LA-based team: Angel, Iceman, Hercules, Black Widow, and Ghost Rider. An oddball lineup that never quite gelled but produced fun Bronze Age adventures. Short-lived but beloved for its quirky charm and unlikely team dynamics.
connection_notes: Parallel: X-Men ongoing (Angel/Iceman absent). References: Champions (Waid) modern revival uses same name, different team.

title: Marvel Two-in-One Omnibus Vol. 2
issues_collected: Marvel Two-in-One #51-100, Annual #5-7
synopsis: The Thing teams up with the entire Marvel Universe in the second half of this long-running series. Notable for the Project Pegasus Saga (#53-58), Annual #7 featuring the Champion of the Universe, and the series finale (#100) with Ben Grimm vs. Ben Grimm.
connection_notes: Parallel: FF ongoing, Secret Wars (1984). References: Marvel Two-in-One Omnibus Vol. 1.

title: Ka-Zar the Savage Complete Collection
issues_collected: Ka-Zar the Savage #1-34
synopsis: Ka-Zar and Shanna the She-Devil in the Savage Land. Surprisingly sophisticated storytelling for an early 80s adventure comic, with Bruce Jones bringing the same mature sensibility he'd later bring to Incredible Hulk. A hidden gem of the era.
connection_notes: Parallel: X-Men visit Savage Land periodically. References: Ka-Zar (Waid) 1997 revival.

title: Marvel Saga: The Official History
issues_collected: Marvel Saga: The Official History of the Marvel Universe #1-25
synopsis: Marvel's official attempt to weave a coherent chronological narrative from FF #1 through the mid-80s, using reprinted panels and new connecting text. An invaluable reference for understanding how Marvel's editors saw their own continuity at the time.
connection_notes: References: All major Silver and Bronze Age Marvel comics. Parallel: Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe.

title: Not Brand Echh Complete Collection
issues_collected: Not Brand Echh #1-13
synopsis: Marvel's official parody comic, poking fun at their own characters and DC's. Forbush-Man, Charlie America, and the Fantastical Four. Silly, irreverent, and a window into Marvel's playful self-awareness during the Silver Age.
connection_notes: Parallel: All Silver Age Marvel. References: Forbush-Man returns in Nextwave and other meta-comics.

title: Patsy Walker: Hellcat Omnibus
issues_collected: Miss America Magazine #2, Patsy Walker #1-20, Girls' Life #1-6, Patsy and Hedy #1-10
synopsis: Pre-superhero Patsy Walker romance comics from the Golden and Silver Ages. The girl-next-door who would eventually become Hellcat, Avenger, and Defender. Fascinating historical context for how Marvel's oldest characters evolved into the superhero universe.
connection_notes: Leads to: Patsy becomes Hellcat in Avengers #144 (1975). References: She-Hulk, Defenders, Hellcat (modern).

title: Warriors Three Complete Collection
issues_collected: Thor: Blood Oath #1-6, Warriors Three #1-4, Thor: Tales of Asgard
synopsis: Fandral, Hogun, and Volstagg star in their own adventures. Blood Oath sends them on a mythological quest. The Warriors Three miniseries explores their origins. A celebration of Thor's most entertaining supporting cast.
connection_notes: Parallel: Thor ongoing. References: Simonson Thor run, Aaron's Thor.

title: Rawhide Kid Western Omnibus
issues_collected: Rawhide Kid #17-35
synopsis: Marvel's premier western hero, drawn by Kirby. Johnny Bart is the fastest gun in the West, falsely accused of murder. Pure Kirby action in a frontier setting, representing Marvel's pre-superhero roots alongside romance and monster comics.
connection_notes: Parallel: Other Atlas/Marvel western titles. References: Avengers #142-143 (time travel to Old West).

title: Doc Savage: The Marvel Years
issues_collected: Doc Savage #1-8, Giant-Size Doc Savage #1
synopsis: Marvel's licensed adaptation of the Man of Bronze, the proto-superhero pulp adventurer. Clark Savage Jr. and his Fabulous Five battle villains in 1930s settings. A short-lived but historically interesting crossover between pulp and superhero traditions.
connection_notes: Parallel: Marvel's licensed properties era (Conan, Godzilla). References: Pulp adventure genre roots of superheroes.

title: What If? Classic Vol. 1
synopsis: The Watcher presents alternate realities: What if Spider-Man joined the FF? What if the Hulk had Bruce Banner's brain? What if the Avengers had never been? The original 1977 series that explored Marvel's most tantalizing alternate histories.
connection_notes: Parallel: All mainstream Marvel continuity. References: What If? (1989) Vol. 2, multiverse concepts in Hickman's work.

title: Marvel Premiere Classic Collection
issues_collected: Marvel Premiere #1-14 (Warlock, Dr. Strange, Iron Fist origins)
synopsis: Marvel's try-out book launched major characters. Features Adam Warlock's cosmic evolution (#1-2), Doctor Strange's Shuma-Gorath saga (#3-14 partial), and more. The proving ground where Bronze Age Marvel experimented with new directions.
connection_notes: Leads to: Warlock by Starlin, Iron Fist Omnibus, Doctor Strange Omnibus. Parallel: Marvel Spotlight.

title: Marvel Super-Heroes Classic Collection
issues_collected: Marvel Super-Heroes #12-20
synopsis: Another Marvel try-out title featuring Captain Marvel (Mar-Vell) debut (#12-13), first Guardians of the Galaxy (#18), Ka-Zar, and Black Knight stories. Key first appearances that spawned ongoing series throughout the Bronze Age.
connection_notes: Leads to: Captain Marvel Omnibus, Guardians of the Galaxy (original). References: Mar-Vell becomes central cosmic figure.

title: Tomb of Dracula Omnibus Vol. 3
issues_collected: Tomb of Dracula #50-70, Tomb of Dracula Magazine #1-6
synopsis: The epic conclusion of Marvel's greatest horror series. Blade's final confrontation with Dracula, the climax of the Quincy Harker storyline, and the black-and-white magazine continuation. Colan's art reaches its atmospheric peak in the magazine format.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Tomb of Dracula Omnibus Vol. 1-2. References: Blood Hunt (2024) revives Dracula mythology.

title: Shogun Warriors Complete Collection
issues_collected: Shogun Warriors #1-20
synopsis: Giant robot action in the Marvel Universe! Based on the Mattel toy line, three pilots command massive robots (Raydeen, Combatra, Dangard Ace) to defend Earth from alien threats. Features crossovers with the Fantastic Four and Avengers.
connection_notes: Parallel: Marvel licensed properties (Micronauts, ROM). References: FF crossover issues.

title: Team America / US 1 Complete Collection
issues_collected: Team America #1-12, US 1 #1-12
synopsis: Two of Marvel's most wonderfully absurd licensed titles. Team America features daredevil motorcyclists with a psychic collective identity, while US 1 stars a trucker with a CB radio skull plate who fights aliens. Peak early-80s Marvel weirdness.
connection_notes: Parallel: Marvel's licensed property boom. References: Team America's Dark Rider concept connects to New Mutants.

title: Marvel Spotlight Omnibus
issues_collected: Marvel Spotlight #1-33 (Ghost Rider, Werewolf by Night, Son of Satan, Deathlok)
synopsis: Marvel's horror/supernatural try-out title. Launches Ghost Rider (#5-12), Werewolf by Night (#2-4), Son of Satan (#12-24), and other features. The birthplace of Marvel's horror renaissance in the early 1970s after the Comics Code loosened.
connection_notes: Leads to: Ghost Rider Omnibus, Werewolf by Night Complete. Parallel: Tomb of Dracula, Man-Thing.

title: Invaders Omnibus Vol. 2
issues_collected: Invaders #24-41, Annual #1, Invaders Giant-Size #1, What If? #4
synopsis: Continuation of Marvel's WWII super-team: Captain America, Human Torch (original), Sub-Mariner, Bucky, and Toro. The Blue Bullet, Baron Blood's return, and the Teutonic Knight. Roy Thomas lovingly fills in Marvel's WWII history.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Invaders Omnibus Vol. 1. References: Captain America history, Bucky/Winter Soldier backstory.

title: Super-Villain Team-Up Complete Collection
issues_collected: Super-Villain Team-Up #1-17, Giant-Size Super-Villain Team-Up #1-2
synopsis: Doctor Doom and Sub-Mariner's uneasy alliance anchors this unique series. Doom and Namor clash, cooperate, and betray each other repeatedly. Features the Red Skull, the Hate-Monger, and the Shroud. Essential Doom characterization between FF appearances.
connection_notes: Parallel: FF ongoing, Avengers. References: Doom's character arc, Champions crossover (#14).

title: Omega Men by Gerber Complete (Marvel)
issues_collected: Void Indigo #1-2, Foolkiller #1-10, Gerber's Defenders #20-25
synopsis: Steve Gerber's uncollected Marvel oddities: the ultra-violent Void Indigo (cancelled after 2 issues for graphic content), the original Foolkiller in a psychological thriller, and Gerber's reality-bending Defenders run featuring the Headmen and Nebulon.
connection_notes: Parallel: Gerber's Howard the Duck, Man-Thing. References: Foolkiller concept revisited by later writers.

title: Essential Man-Thing Vol. 2
issues_collected: Man-Thing #12-22, Marvel Two-in-One #1, Monsters Unleashed #5, Rampaging Hulk #7
synopsis: The conclusion of Gerber's Man-Thing run, featuring the Song-Cry of the Living Dead Man, the Kid's Night Out issue, and the series finale. Gerber's most experimental Marvel writing, blending horror with social commentary and surreal metafiction.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Man-Thing Omnibus (Vol. 1 material). Parallel: Howard the Duck spins off from this series.

title: Red Sonja: The Marvel Years Omnibus
issues_collected: Red Sonja (1977) #1-15, Marvel Feature #1-7 (Red Sonja), Conan the Barbarian #23-24, #44, #48, #115
synopsis: The She-Devil with a Sword in her Marvel incarnation. Spun out of Conan, Red Sonja carved her own path in the Hyborian Age. Frank Thorne's definitive art made her an iconic figure. Includes her Conan crossover appearances and solo Marvel Feature run.
connection_notes: Parallel: Conan Omnibus. References: Red Sonja license later moved to Dynamite.

title: Thunderbolts by Jeff Parker Complete Collection
issues_collected: Thunderbolts #138-174
synopsis: Supervillains on a government leash doing black ops. Luke Cage runs the team (Ghost, Moonstone, Juggernaut, Crossbones, Man-Thing) through the Heroic Age. Time-travel arc sends the team through Marvel history. One of the most consistently entertaining Marvel runs of the era.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Thunderbolts by Ellis/Diggle. Leads to: Dark Avengers relaunch. Parallel: Avengers Academy.

title: Cable by Swierczynski Complete Collection
synopsis: Cable on the run through time protecting baby Hope Summers from Bishop. Post-Messiah Complex, Cable raises the mutant messiah across dangerous futures while Bishop relentlessly pursues them. The chase spans centuries and defines Hope's character.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: X-Men Messiah Complex. Leads to: X-Men Messiah War, X-Men Second Coming. Parallel: X-Force (Kyle/Yost).

title: Winter Soldier by Brubaker Complete
issues_collected: Winter Soldier #1-14
synopsis: Bucky Barnes as a black ops spy in his own solo series. He and Black Widow hunt sleeper agents from his Winter Soldier past. Features the reactivation of other Soviet super-soldiers and a devastating personal betrayal. Brubaker's final chapter of his Bucky saga.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Captain America by Brubaker. Parallel: Avengers ongoing. References: MCU Winter Soldier film adapted elements.

title: Captain America & Bucky by Brubaker
issues_collected: Captain America and Bucky #620-628
synopsis: WWII flashbacks retelling the Cap-Bucky partnership with gorgeous Chris Samnee art. Fills in previously untold stories from the war years and shows how Bucky was more than a sidekick. A beautiful companion piece to Brubaker's main Captain America run.
connection_notes: Parallel: Captain America by Brubaker. References: Invaders, Winter Soldier backstory.

title: Bucky Barnes: The Winter Soldier
issues_collected: Bucky Barnes: The Winter Soldier #1-11
synopsis: Bucky as the Man on the Wall, inheriting Nick Fury Sr.'s role as Earth's secret cosmic defender after Original Sin. Psychedelic, experimental art by Marco Rudy transforms a spy thriller into cosmic abstraction. Divisive but visually stunning.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Original Sin event. Parallel: All-New Captain America (Sam Wilson).

title: Spider-Girl (May Parker) Complete Collection Vol. 1
issues_collected: What If? (1989) #105, Spider-Girl #1-30
synopsis: May 'Mayday' Parker, daughter of Peter and MJ, inherits spider-powers in an alternate future (MC2 Universe). Born from a What If? one-shot, the series was saved from cancellation multiple times by devoted fans. Classic Spider-Man storytelling with a next-gen twist.
connection_notes: Parallel: MC2 Universe (A-Next, J2, Fantastic Five). References: Spider-Verse includes May Parker.

title: Spider-Girl (May Parker) Complete Collection Vol. 2
issues_collected: Spider-Girl #31-60
synopsis: May Parker's adventures continue as she juggles high school, her parents' fears, and an expanding rogues gallery. Green Goblin legacy, Hobgoblin, and the Buzz. The MC2 Universe deepens with more connections to classic Marvel character descendants.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Spider-Girl Vol. 1. Parallel: MC2 titles. Leads to: Amazing Spider-Girl relaunch.

title: The Order by Matt Fraction
issues_collected: The Order #1-10
synopsis: California's Initiative team of celebrity heroes powered by Hank Pym technology. A clever mix of superhero action and Hollywood satire, cut short at 10 issues. Features Fraction's trademark wit and sharp character work before his Invincible Iron Man breakthrough.
