connection_notes: Prerequisite: Civil War, Initiative concept. Parallel: Avengers: The Initiative. References: Fraction's later Iron Man run.

title: Wisdom by Paul Cornell
issues_collected: Wisdom #1-6, New Excalibur #1-3
synopsis: Pete Wisdom runs MI13, Britain's supernatural defense agency. Fairies invade, Skrulls scheme, and British mythology collides with Marvel continuity. A dry-witted predecessor to Cornell's acclaimed Captain Britain and MI13 series.
connection_notes: Leads to: Captain Britain and MI13. References: Excalibur, Pete Wisdom from X-Force.

title: Gravity Complete Collection
issues_collected: Gravity #1-5, Beyond! #1-6
synopsis: Small-town kid Greg Willis moves to NYC with gravity powers and tries to be a hero. A charming street-level debut followed by Beyond!, where he's trapped on Battleworld with B-list heroes. McDuffie's Beyond! is a Secret Wars homage that gives minor characters their due.
connection_notes: References: Secret Wars (1984) concept. Parallel: Young Avengers, Runaways (new generation heroes).

title: Arana: Heart of the Spider Complete
issues_collected: Arana: Heart of the Spider #1-12
synopsis: Anya Corazon, a Latina teen in Brooklyn, gains spider-powers through a mystical spider society. One of Marvel's earliest Latina headliners. Anya later takes the Spider-Girl name and appears in Spider-Verse and the wider Spider-Family.
connection_notes: References: Spider-Verse, Young Allies. Leads to: Spider-Girl (Anya) and Spider-Island appearance.

title: Silk Complete Collection Vol. 2
synopsis: Cindy Moon's ANAD Marvel series. Silk works undercover for SHIELD inside Black Cat's criminal empire while searching for her missing family. Features her rivalry with Black Cat, Clone Conspiracy tie-in, and defining her identity beyond her Spider-Man connection.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Silk Vol. 1 (Thompson). Parallel: Amazing Spider-Man ongoing. References: Clone Conspiracy event.

title: Scarlet Spider (2012) by Yost Vol. 2
issues_collected: Scarlet Spider (2012) #13-25
synopsis: Kaine's Houston adventures reach their explosive conclusion. He battles the Wolves of War, teams with Wolverine and the New Warriors, and confronts the demon Shathra. Kaine's struggle between his violent nature and heroic aspirations drives to a powerful finale.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Scarlet Spider (Yost) Vol. 1. Leads to: New Warriors (2014). References: Superior Spider-Man crossover.

title: Nova by Loveness (2024)
synopsis: Richard Rider returns as Nova in a new solo series exploring his trauma from the Cancerverse and his place in an expanding cosmic Marvel. Fresh cosmic adventures that honor the DnA legacy while pushing Rider into new emotional territory.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Guardians of the Galaxy (DnA), Annihilation. Parallel: Current cosmic Marvel titles.

title: Guardians of the Galaxy by Al Ewing
issues_collected: Guardians of the Galaxy (2020) #1-18
synopsis: The Guardians face Olympian gods, Dormammu, and the corrupted Olympus. Ewing ties the team into his larger cosmic narrative including Immortal Hulk and his Defenders work. Features Star-Lord, Rocket, Groot, Nova, Quasar, Moondragon, and Marvel Boy.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: GotG by DnA (thematic). Parallel: Ewing's Immortal Hulk, S.W.O.R.D. Leads to: Last Annihilation crossover.

title: S.H.I.E.L.D. by Hickman Complete
synopsis: SHIELD has existed since ancient Egypt. Leonardo da Vinci, Galileo, Newton, Tesla, and Howard Stark as agents across history defending Earth from Galactus, the Brood, and Celestials. Hickman reimagines SHIELD as a millennia-old secret society of genius protectors.
connection_notes: Parallel: Hickman's FF, Secret Warriors. References: Night Machine (Nikola Tesla) connects to his larger Marvel narrative.

title: Young Allies Complete Collection
issues_collected: Young Allies (2010) #1-6, Firestar #1-4, Onslaught Unleashed #1-4
synopsis: Young heroes Firestar, Gravity, Toro, Arana, and Nomad (Rikki Barnes) team up against a new Bastards of Evil. Short-lived but connects several young hero threads. Includes Firestar's solo mini and the Onslaught Unleashed sequel in the Negative Zone.
connection_notes: References: Gravity, Arana solo series. Parallel: Young Avengers, Avengers Academy.

title: MC2 Universe Collection
issues_collected: A-Next #1-12, J2 #1-12, Fantastic Five #1-5, Wild Thing #1-5
synopsis: The alternate future MC2 Universe beyond Spider-Girl. A-Next (next-gen Avengers with American Dream and Stinger), J2 (Juggernaut's son), Fantastic Five (with a grown-up Franklin Richards), and Wild Thing (Wolverine's daughter). Classic Marvel storytelling for the next generation.
connection_notes: Parallel: Spider-Girl ongoing. References: All classic Marvel character legacies.

title: Dark Reign: Hawkeye
issues_collected: Dark Reign: Hawkeye #1-5, New Avengers #56
synopsis: Bullseye wearing the Hawkeye costume as a Dark Avenger. Norman Osborn barely keeps him leashed as Bullseye commits increasingly public violence while maintaining his heroic facade. A tense psychological thriller about a serial killer pretending to be a hero.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Dark Avengers by Bendis. Parallel: Dark Reign crossover. References: Bullseye's Daredevil history.

title: Heroic Age: Complete Collection
issues_collected: Enter the Heroic Age #1, Age of Heroes #1-4, Avengers (2010) #1-6
synopsis: Post-Siege, the Marvel Universe enters a new hopeful era. Steve Rogers is back, the Registration Act is repealed, and multiple Avengers teams form. The opening Avengers arc features Kang and time-breaking. A fresh start after years of Dark Reign and Civil War division.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Siege. Leads to: Avengers by Bendis (Heroic Age), Fear Itself. Parallel: FF by Hickman, Secret Avengers.

title: Spider-Island Omnibus
issues_collected: Amazing Spider-Man #666-673, Venom #6-8, Spider-Island: Deadly Foes, various tie-ins
synopsis: The Jackal gives all of Manhattan spider-powers, then mutates them into giant spiders. The Queen is behind it all. Mary Jane gets powers, Anti-Venom cures the virus, and Peter must sacrifice the thing that makes him unique to save everyone. Slott's biggest Spider-Man event.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: ASM by Slott (Big Time era). Parallel: Venom by Remender. References: Clone Saga Jackal legacy.

title: Fear Itself: The Fearless
issues_collected: Fear Itself: The Fearless #1-12
synopsis: Aftermath of Fear Itself. Valkyrie races Sin (daughter of Red Skull) to collect the scattered hammers of the Worthy before they fall into wrong hands. A globe-trotting sequel that ties up Fear Itself loose ends and redefines Valkyrie's role in the Marvel Universe.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Fear Itself. Parallel: Avengers ongoing. References: Leads into Defenders by Fraction.

title: Miracleman Omnibus
issues_collected: Miracleman #1-16, plus Marvelman material
synopsis: Alan Moore's revolutionary superhero deconstruction. Kid Marvelman becomes one of comics' most terrifying villains. The Birth (#1-8), Red King Syndrome (#9-11), and Olympus (#12-16) redefine what superhero stories can be.
connection_notes: Parallel: Watchmen in influence. Leads to: Miracleman by Gaiman (The Golden Age). Influences all modern deconstruction.

title: Marvels: Eye of the Camera
issues_collected: Marvels: Eye of the Camera #1-6
synopsis: Sequel to Marvels. Phil Sheldon faces his own mortality while documenting the Marvel Universe through the Bronze Age. Covers events from the Kree-Skrull War through the rise of mutant fear.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Marvels. Parallel: Covers events from Avengers Kree-Skrull War through X-Men era.

title: Spider-Man: Reign
issues_collected: Spider-Man: Reign #1-4
synopsis: Dark Knight Returns for Spider-Man. An elderly Peter Parker in a dystopian New York must become Spider-Man one last time. Controversial, visually stunning, and emotionally devastating.
connection_notes: Standalone future story. Leads to: Spider-Man: Reign 2. Parallel: Dark Knight Returns influence.

title: Silver Surfer: The Best Defense
issues_collected: Defenders: The Best Defense one-shots (Namor, Silver Surfer, Hulk, Doctor Strange, Defenders)
synopsis: Each original Defender gets a standalone one-shot before reuniting. Silver Surfer faces cosmic oblivion, Hulk confronts inner demons, Namor defends Atlantis, and Strange battles mystical threats.
connection_notes: Parallel: Immortal Hulk ongoing. Leads to: Defenders (Ewing). References classic Defenders team.

title: Fantastic Four: 1234
issues_collected: Fantastic Four: 1234 #1-4
synopsis: Marvel Knights prestige miniseries. Doom psychologically dismantles the FF by exploiting each member's deepest insecurities. Morrison distills the team to their essentials. Jae Lee's art is haunting.
connection_notes: Standalone. Parallel: Marvel Knights era reinvention. References FF #5 (Doom debut) and core FF mythology.

title: Marvel: The End
issues_collected: Marvel: The End #1-6
synopsis: Starlin's cosmic swan song. Thanos absorbs the Heart of the Universe and becomes omnipotent, surpassing even the Living Tribunal. The entire Marvel Universe hangs in the balance of Thanos's final choice.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Warlock by Starlin, Infinity Gauntlet. Parallel: Starlin cosmic saga conclusion. References all prior Thanos stories.

title: The Last Avengers Story
issues_collected: The Last Avengers Story #1-2
synopsis: An alternate future where the Avengers have disbanded and aged. Hank Pym must reassemble the team one last time against Ultron and Kang. A dark, elegiac farewell to Earth's Mightiest Heroes.
connection_notes: Standalone alternate future. Parallel: What If...? tradition. References Avengers core mythology.

title: Squadron Supreme: Death of a Universe
issues_collected: Squadron Supreme: Death of a Universe GN
synopsis: Sequel to the landmark Squadron Supreme maxi-series. The Nth Man threatens to consume the Squadron's entire universe. The team makes the ultimate sacrifice to save their reality.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Squadron Supreme maxi-series. Leads to: Squadron members appearing in Avengers (Quasar era). Parallel: DC's Justice League analogue.

title: Avengers: Rage of Ultron
issues_collected: Avengers: Rage of Ultron OGN
synopsis: Original graphic novel. Ultron returns and merges with Hank Pym in a horrifying fusion. The Avengers face their greatest Ultron threat as Pym's consciousness battles the machine from within.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Uncanny Avengers by Remender. Leads to: Pym/Ultron status quo in later Avengers. References Ultron's complete history.

title: Thanos: The Infinity Siblings/Ending/Conflict Trilogy
issues_collected: Thanos: The Infinity Siblings, The Infinity Ending, The Infinity Conflict OGNs
synopsis: Starlin's final Thanos trilogy in OGN format. Thanos and Adam Warlock confront temporal paradoxes, alternate selves, and the ultimate fate of the universe. A capstone to Starlin's decades-long cosmic saga.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Warlock by Starlin, Infinity Gauntlet, Marvel: The End. Final chapter of Starlin's Thanos arc.

title: Marvels Snapshots
issues_collected: Marvels Snapshots: Sub-Mariner, X-Men, Spider-Man, Avengers, Captain America, Fantastic Four, Civil War
synopsis: Anthology series in the tradition of Marvels, showing major Marvel events through the eyes of ordinary people. Each issue spotlights a different era and hero through a grounded, human perspective.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Marvels. Parallel: Covers events across all Marvel eras. Standalone anthology.

title: Heroes Reborn (2021)
issues_collected: Heroes Reborn (2021) #1-7, plus companion one-shots
synopsis: Mephisto reshapes reality so the Avengers never formed and the Squadron Supreme are Earth's premier heroes. Blade is the only one who remembers the truth and must restore the real timeline.
connection_notes: Part of Aaron's Avengers run. Prerequisite: Avengers by Aaron. References Squadron Supreme, Mephisto's machinations across Aaron's saga.

title: Black Panther: Panther's Quest
issues_collected: Marvel Comics Presents #13-37
synopsis: T'Challa's mother is alive and held captive in apartheid South Africa. McGregor returns to the character he defined in the 1970s for an epic serialized adventure that confronts real-world racial injustice head-on.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Black Panther by McGregor (Jungle Action). Standalone arc. Parallel: late 1980s Marvel socially conscious storytelling.

title: Daredevil by Chip Zdarsky: To Heaven Through Hell Vol. 3
issues_collected: Daredevil (2019) #26-36
synopsis: The Elektra-as-Daredevil arc culminates. Matt Murdock is in prison. Wilson Fisk consolidates power. The stage is set for the explosive Devil's Reign event as every thread Zdarsky has been building reaches critical mass.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: DD Zdarsky Omnibus Vol. 1-2. Leads to: Devil's Reign. Part of Zdarsky's complete DD saga.

title: Spider-Man: Family Business
issues_collected: Amazing Spider-Man: Family Business OGN
synopsis: A mysterious woman claims to be Peter Parker's sister. A globe-trotting spy thriller ensues involving the CIA, Kingpin, and family secrets. Dell'Otto's painted art is gorgeous throughout.
connection_notes: Standalone OGN. References Peter's parents (Richard and Mary Parker, agents of SHIELD). No lasting continuity impact.

title: Avengers: Endless Wartime
issues_collected: Avengers: Endless Wartime OGN
synopsis: First Marvel original graphic novel in the modern OGN initiative. Thor and Captain America's past collide when Norse drones and WWII weapons resurface. The Avengers face a threat born from both mythology and modern warfare.
connection_notes: Standalone OGN. Parallel: MCU-era Avengers lineup. No major continuity ties.

title: New Avengers: Illuminati Complete
issues_collected: New Avengers: Illuminati #1-5, New Avengers: Illuminati one-shot (2006)
synopsis: The secret history of Marvel's Illuminati — Iron Man, Reed Richards, Black Bolt, Namor, Professor X, Doctor Strange — who have been secretly guiding events since the Kree-Skrull War. Reveals they sent Hulk into space (Planet Hulk setup) and possess the Infinity Gems.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: New Avengers Omnibus Vol. 1. Leads to: Secret Invasion, World War Hulk. Critical Bendis-era connective tissue.

title: Marvel Graphic Novel Collection Vol. 2
issues_collected: Marvel Graphic Novel #4 (New Mutants), #5 (X-Men: God Loves, Man Kills), #22 (Amazing Spider-Man: Hooky), etc.
synopsis: Collection of Marvel's early graphic novel line. Includes the origin of the New Mutants (GN #4), the landmark God Loves, Man Kills (GN #5), and other prestige format stories from the 1980s.
connection_notes: Contains New Mutants origin (leads to New Mutants ongoing). God Loves, Man Kills is a standalone X-Men essential.

title: Marvel Masterworks: The X-Men Vol. 1
issues_collected: X-Men #1-10
synopsis: The original X-Men debut. Professor X, Cyclops, Beast, Angel, Iceman, and Marvel Girl vs. Magneto (#1), the Vanisher (#2), the Blob (#3), Brotherhood of Evil Mutants (#4-7), and Unus the Untouchable (#8).
connection_notes: Leads to: Marvel Masterworks X-Men Vol. 2. Parallel: FF, ASM ongoing. Magneto debut is foundational for all X-Men stories.

title: Marvel Masterworks: The X-Men Vol. 2
synopsis: The Stranger debuts (#11). Juggernaut first appearance (#12-13). The Sentinels are introduced (#14-16) — the mutant-hunting robots become X-Men's defining threat. Mimic joins briefly (#19).
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Masterworks X-Men Vol. 1. Leads to: Masterworks X-Men Vol. 3. Sentinels debut here powers decades of X-Men stories.

title: Marvel Masterworks: The Avengers Vol. 3
issues_collected: Avengers #21-30
synopsis: Cap's Kooky Quartet era continues. Power Man (#21-22), Kang returns (#23-24), Doctor Doom teams with Attuma (#25). The Collector debuts (#28). Swordsman and the Beetle attack (#29-30).
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Avengers Omnibus Vol. 1. Leads to: Masterworks Avengers Vol. 4. Collector debut seeds future cosmic stories.

title: Marvel Masterworks: The Avengers Vol. 4
issues_collected: Avengers #31-40
synopsis: Sons of the Serpent racist organization debut (#32-33). Living Laser (#34-35). Ultroids (#36-37). Hercules joins (#38-40). The team expands as the Avengers tackle social issues alongside cosmic threats.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Masterworks Avengers Vol. 3. Leads to: Masterworks Avengers Vol. 5. Hercules joining becomes long-term team fixture.

title: Marvel Masterworks: The Mighty Thor Vol. 1
issues_collected: Journey into Mystery #83-100
synopsis: Thor debuts in Journey into Mystery #83. Donald Blake finds the enchanted walking stick. Loki first appearance (#85). Radioactive Man (#93). Includes Tales of Asgard backup stories establishing Norse mythology.
connection_notes: Leads to: Masterworks Thor Vol. 2, Thor Omnibus Vol. 1. Parallel: Early Marvel universe building. Loki debut is foundational.

title: Marvel Masterworks: The Mighty Thor Vol. 2
issues_collected: Journey into Mystery #101-110, Thor #111-120
synopsis: The Enchantress and Executioner debut (#103). Balder the Brave. The Absorbing Man first appearance (#114-115). Destroyer armor (#118). Kirby's cosmic scope expands as Asgard becomes fully realized.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Masterworks Thor Vol. 1. Leads to: Thor Lee/Kirby Omnibus Vol. 1. Absorbing Man and Destroyer become recurring threats.

title: Marvel Masterworks: Iron Man Vol. 1
issues_collected: Tales of Suspense #39-58
synopsis: Tony Stark's origin in captivity (#39). The armor evolves from grey to gold to red-and-gold. Mandarin debut (#50). Black Widow first appearance (#52). Hawkeye debut as villain (#57). Crimson Dynamo, Titanium Man established.
connection_notes: Leads to: Tales of Suspense Omnibus, Iron Man Omnibus. Parallel: Captain America backup stories begin in TOS #59. Black Widow and Hawkeye later become Avengers.

title: Marvel Masterworks: Captain America Vol. 1
issues_collected: Tales of Suspense #59-81
synopsis: Cap's solo feature begins in Tales of Suspense backup stories. WWII flashbacks with Bucky. Red Skull returns (#65-68). Batroc (#75-76). Kirby draws definitive action sequences. The Super-Adaptoid (#82).
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Avengers #4 (Cap revival). Leads to: Captain America Omnibus Vol. 1. Parallel: Iron Man stories in same issues.

title: Marvel Masterworks: Daredevil Vol. 1
issues_collected: Daredevil #1-11
synopsis: Matt Murdock's origin — blinded by radioactive waste, gains radar sense. Foggy Nelson and Karen Page established. Electro (#2), Owl (#3), Purple Man (#4), and Stilt-Man (#8) debut. Wally Wood redesigns the red costume (#7).
connection_notes: Leads to: Masterworks Daredevil Vol. 2, Daredevil Omnibus Vol. 1. Parallel: Early Marvel universe building. Purple Man becomes major villain decades later (Jessica Jones).

title: Marvel Masterworks: Doctor Strange Vol. 1
issues_collected: Strange Tales #110-111, #114-141
synopsis: Doctor Strange's origin and early adventures. The Ditko-drawn mystical dimension is unlike anything else in comics. Dormammu debut (#126). Baron Mordo established as nemesis. The Eternity Saga (#130-146) introduces the cosmic entity Eternity.
connection_notes: Leads to: Doctor Strange Omnibus Vol. 1. Parallel: Ditko also drawing ASM simultaneously. Eternity concept becomes foundational to Marvel cosmology.

title: Marvel Masterworks: Silver Surfer Vol. 1
issues_collected: Silver Surfer #1-6, plus Fantastic Four Annual #5
synopsis: Norrin Radd's origin fully told. Trapped on Earth by Galactus's barrier, the Surfer encounters humanity's worst and best. Mephisto tempts him (#3). The Stranger tests him. Lee's most philosophical writing paired with Buscema's cosmic grandeur.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: FF Omnibus Vol. 2 (Galactus Trilogy). Leads to: Silver Surfer Omnibus Vol. 1. Parallel: Expansion-era cosmic scope.

title: Marvel Masterworks: Amazing Spider-Man Vol. 4
issues_collected: Amazing Spider-Man #31-40
synopsis: THE definitive Spider-Man stretch. Master Planner Saga (#31-33) — Peter lifts the machinery to save Aunt May, the single greatest Spider-Man scene. Gwen Stacy and Harry Osborn debut (#31). Ditko's final issues, culminating in the Green Goblin reveal (#39-40).
connection_notes: Prerequisite: ASM Omnibus Vol. 1. Leads to: ASM Omnibus Vol. 2 (Romita era). The Master Planner lift is Spider-Man's defining moment.

title: Marvel Masterworks: Fantastic Four Vol. 4
issues_collected: Fantastic Four #31-40, Annual #2
synopsis: Mole Man returns (#31). Invincible Man (#32). Sub-Mariner and Sue Storm tension. Frightful Four debut (#36) — Wizard, Sandman, Paste-Pot Pete, Medusa. Dragon Man (#35). Doctor Doom returns in #39-40 with Daredevil crossover.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: FF Omnibus Vol. 1. Overlaps with FF Omnibus Vol. 2. Leads to: Inhumans introduction in FF #44-47.

title: Marvel Masterworks: The Incredible Hulk Vol. 1
issues_collected: Incredible Hulk #1-6, Tales to Astonish #60-67
synopsis: Bruce Banner's gamma bomb origin. The original grey Hulk quickly becomes green. The series is cancelled after only 6 issues but Hulk moves to Tales to Astonish. Rick Jones, Betty Ross, and General Thunderbolt Ross established.
connection_notes: Leads to: Incredible Hulk Omnibus. Parallel: Hulk appears in Avengers #1-2 before leaving. Early Hulk is Marvel's most unstable character concept.

title: Marvel Masterworks: Sub-Mariner Vol. 1
issues_collected: Sub-Mariner #1-14, plus material from Tales to Astonish #70-76
synopsis: Namor gets his own series. Atlantis under threat from surface world and undersea rivals. Tiger Shark and Attuma attack. Lady Dorma romance. Namor navigates being king, anti-hero, and reluctant ally to the surface world.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: FF #4 (Namor's Silver Age return). Parallel: Expansion-era character solo launches. Leads to: Defenders formation.

title: Fantastic Four by Ryan North Vol. 3
issues_collected: Fantastic Four (2022) #13-18
synopsis: North's run continues with inventive, science-forward storytelling. The FF face escalating threats that require Reed's intellect and the whole family's heart. Ties into the broader Marvel landscape leading into Blood Hunt.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: FF by Ryan North Vol. 1-2. Leads to: FF 2025 relaunch. Parallel: Blood Hunt era.

title: Immortal Thor by Al Ewing Vol. 2
issues_collected: Immortal Thor #7-12
synopsis: Ewing deepens his mythological exploration. Thor confronts the Utgard gods — beings from the space outside stories. The nature of Norse mythology as narrative is questioned. Toranos and the storm of all storms threaten everything.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Immortal Thor Vol. 1. Leads to: One World Under Doom tie-ins. Part of Ewing's broader Marvel cosmology project.

title: Amazing Spider-Man by Zeb Wells Vol. 4
issues_collected: Amazing Spider-Man (2022) #32-43
synopsis: The Gang War event erupts across New York as crime lords battle for territory. Spider-Man is caught in the middle. The consequences of Wells's controversial run continue to unfold as Peter faces the fallout of his worst decisions.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: ASM Zeb Wells Vol. 1-3. Leads to: ASM relaunch. Parallel: Gang War crossover event.

title: Uncanny X-Men by Gail Simone Vol. 2
issues_collected: Uncanny X-Men (2024) #7-12
synopsis: Simone's Uncanny run deepens. Rogue leads a team in the Louisiana bayou. The Human/Mutant coexistence is tested by new threats. Simone brings her signature character work and emotional depth to the X-Men franchise.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Uncanny X-Men by Simone Vol. 1. Parallel: X-Men by MacKay, Exceptional X-Men. From the Ashes era.

title: Wolverine by Saladin Ahmed Vol. 2
issues_collected: Wolverine (2024) #7-12
synopsis: Logan continues his post-Krakoa journey. Nightclub owner by night, Wolverine by necessity. Ahmed explores Logan's attempt at a normal life while his violent past refuses to stay buried.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Wolverine by Ahmed Vol. 1. Parallel: From the Ashes X-line. References Krakoa-era events.

title: Spider-Man: Shadow of the Green Goblin
issues_collected: Spider-Man: Shadow of the Green Goblin #1-4
synopsis: A hidden chapter in early Spider-Man history. Set between ASM #37-39, this miniseries explores Norman Osborn's descent into the Green Goblin persona and introduces a new character connected to Peter's past.
connection_notes: Set during ASM Omnibus Vol. 1 era. Parallel: Retroactive continuity addition. References Norman Osborn's original Green Goblin arc.

title: Deadpool by Cody Ziglar
issues_collected: Deadpool (2024) #1-6
synopsis: Deadpool launches a new era. Wade Wilson is broke, unloved, and hunted by a new Death Grip organization. Ziglar brings sharp humor and genuine pathos to the Merc with a Mouth.
connection_notes: Standalone launch. Parallel: Blood Hunt era Marvel. Accessible new reader entry point for Deadpool.

title: Fantastic Four: Full Circle II
issues_collected: Fantastic Four: Full Circle II OGN
synopsis: Alex Ross returns to the FF for a second prestige OGN. Ross's fully painted art brings the First Family to life in a story that celebrates the cosmic wonder and family bonds at the heart of the Fantastic Four.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: FF: Full Circle. Standalone prestige OGN. Parallel: Ross's ongoing Marvel legacy work.

title: Daredevil: Gang War
issues_collected: Daredevil: Gang War #1-4, Gang War tie-in material
synopsis: Daredevil's tie-in to the Gang War crossover event. Matt Murdock navigates the violent power vacuum in New York's underworld as crime lords battle for supremacy in Hell's Kitchen.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Gang War event, DD Zdarsky run. Parallel: ASM Gang War. Crossover tie-in material.

title: Predator: The Last Hunt
issues_collected: Predator (2023) #1-6
synopsis: Marvel's Predator license launches. A Yautja hunter stalks prey in the far future. Brisson brings horror and sci-fi action to the iconic alien hunter franchise under the Marvel banner.
connection_notes: Standalone. Part of Marvel's licensed properties (Alien, Predator). No 616 continuity ties.

title: Alien: Thaw
issues_collected: Alien: Thaw #1-4
synopsis: A Weyland-Yutani research station in the Arctic thaws something ancient and deadly. Xenomorph horror meets isolated thriller. Marvel continues to expand the Alien franchise with standalone terror.
connection_notes: Standalone. Part of Marvel's Alien line. No 616 continuity ties. Parallel: Alien by Shalvey ongoing.

title: Star Wars: Darth Vader by Greg Pak Omnibus
issues_collected: Star Wars: Darth Vader (2020) #1-40
synopsis: Set between Empire Strikes Back and Return of the Jedi. Vader hunts for Luke, confronts his past as Anakin, and navigates Emperor Palpatine's punishment. Pak delivers the definitive Vader story in comics — rage, loss, and twisted love.
connection_notes: Standalone Star Wars continuity. Marvel-published but not 616. The best Vader comic run. Parallel: Star Wars main series by Soule.

title: War of the Realms Companion Omnibus
issues_collected: War of the Realms tie-ins: Giant-Man, Punisher, New Agents of Atlas, Journey into Mystery, Strikeforce, War Scrolls, plus Asgardians of the Galaxy
synopsis: Complete tie-in material for War of the Realms. Heroes across the Marvel Universe battle Malekith's invasion of Midgard. Includes Spider-Man, Punisher, New Agents of Atlas, and Asgardian-focused stories.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: War of the Realms. Companion material expanding the event. References Thor by Aaron mythology.

title: Absolute Carnage Omnibus
issues_collected: Absolute Carnage #1-5, plus tie-ins (Scream, Separation Anxiety, Miles Morales, etc.)
synopsis: Cletus Kasady is resurrected by the symbiote god Knull and hunts every person who ever bonded with a symbiote to harvest their codices. Venom and Spider-Man must stop him before Knull awakens. Dark, horrifying, and pivotal to Cates's Venom saga.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Venom by Cates. Leads to: King in Black. Parallel: Ties into every symbiote character's history.

title: Death of Wolverine Complete Collection
issues_collected: Death of Wolverine #1-4, Wolverine (2014) #8-12, Life After Logan, Logan Legacy #1-7, Weapon X Program #1-5
synopsis: Logan loses his healing factor and faces his mortality. When his enemies learn he's vulnerable, everyone comes for him. Wolverine makes his last stand, encased in adamantium. Plus the aftermath as the Marvel Universe mourns.
connection_notes: Leads to: Old Man Logan, X-23 as Wolverine, Hunt for Wolverine. Prerequisite: Wolverine ongoing. Major status quo change until Return of Wolverine.

title: Avengers & X-Men: AXIS Companion
issues_collected: AXIS: Revolutions #1-4, AXIS: Carnage #1-3, AXIS: Hobgoblin #1-3, Magneto tie-ins
synopsis: Tie-in material for the AXIS event. Heroes become villains and villains become heroes due to the Red Skull's inversion spell. Carnage becomes a hero, Hobgoblin goes straight, and Magneto confronts his inverted morality.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: AXIS event. Companion tie-in material. Leads to: Superior Iron Man, inverted Sabretooth status quo.

title: Original Sin Companion
issues_collected: Original Sin tie-ins: Hulk vs. Iron Man #1-4, Thor & Loki #1-5, Original Sins #1-5
synopsis: The Watcher's secrets revealed impact heroes across the Marvel Universe. Tony Stark's role in Hulk's origin. Thor learns he has a sister (Angela from Spawn). Nick Fury's dark history as the 'Man on the Wall' exposed.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Original Sin. Leads to: Angela in Marvel continuity, Nick Fury as the Unseen. Reveals reshape multiple character histories.

title: Age of X Complete
issues_collected: Age of X: Alpha, X-Men Legacy #245-247, New Mutants #22-24, Age of X: Universe #1-2
synopsis: An alternate reality where mutants are under siege in Fortress X. Legacy (Rogue) begins to question their world's reality. A clever puzzle-box story that recontextualizes familiar X-Men in a war-torn setting. The truth is more disturbing than the illusion.
connection_notes: Standalone alternate reality event. Parallel: X-Men Legacy by Carey. References all major X-Men characters in new roles.

title: Annihilators Complete
issues_collected: Annihilators #1-4, Annihilators: Earthfall #1-4
synopsis: The most powerful cosmic heroes — Silver Surfer, Gladiator, Quasar, Beta Ray Bill, Ronan — form a super-team as Star-Lord requested. They face the Universal Church of Truth and then bring cosmic threats to Earth. Plus Rocket Raccoon and Groot backup stories.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Thanos Imperative, GotG by DnA. Coda to the DnA cosmic saga. Leads to: Marvel NOW! cosmic relaunch.

title: Realm of Kings Companion
issues_collected: Realm of Kings: Inhumans #1-5, Realm of Kings: Imperial Guard #1-5, Realm of Kings one-shot
synopsis: After War of Kings, a massive fault in space-time — the Fault — opens. The Inhumans rule the Kree Empire as Black Bolt's sacrifice reverberates. The Imperial Guard investigates the Fault, discovering the Cancerverse on the other side.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: War of Kings. Leads to: Thanos Imperative. Parallel: Realm of Kings main event. Part of DnA's cosmic saga.

title: Silver Surfer by Steve Englehart Omnibus Vol. 2
issues_collected: Silver Surfer (1987) #20-38
synopsis: Englehart's Surfer run reaches its cosmic peak. The Surfer confronts the Elders of the Universe, navigates Kree-Skrull entanglements, and faces the In-Betweener. Thanos returns in issue #34, setting the stage for the Infinity Gauntlet.
connection_notes: Leads to: Thanos Quest, Infinity Gauntlet Omnibus. Parallel: Avengers ongoing.

title: Captain Marvel (Mar-Vell) Omnibus
issues_collected: Marvel Super-Heroes #12-13, Captain Marvel (1968) #1-21
synopsis: The original Captain Marvel, Kree warrior Mar-Vell, debuts as a spy on Earth and evolves into a cosmic hero. First appearance in Marvel Super-Heroes #12. Introduces Yon-Rogg, Carol Danvers (pre-powers), and the Supreme Intelligence.
connection_notes: Leads to: Captain Marvel by Starlin, Avengers Kree-Skrull War. Parallel: FF cosmic storylines.

title: Strange Tales Omnibus Vol. 2
issues_collected: Strange Tales #135-168
synopsis: Split book featuring Nick Fury, Agent of SHIELD and Doctor Strange. Steranko revolutionizes page layouts on Fury. Strange battles Dormammu and the Dread Dimension. Establishes SHIELD as a major Marvel institution.
connection_notes: Leads to: Nick Fury Steranko Complete, Doctor Strange Omnibus Vol. 1. Parallel: FF, Avengers.

title: Doctor Strange Omnibus Vol. 2 (Englehart & Colan)
issues_collected: Doctor Strange (1974) #1-29, Annual #1
synopsis: Englehart and Colan redefine Strange for the 1970s. Features the epic battle against Silver Dagger (#1-5), deeper exploration of the Vishanti, and Clea as Strange's apprentice and lover. Psychedelic, literary cosmic horror.
connection_notes: Follows: Doctor Strange Lee/Ditko. Leads to: Doctor Strange Omnibus Vol. 3. Parallel: Defenders.

title: Sub-Mariner Omnibus Vol. 2
issues_collected: Sub-Mariner (1968) #26-50
synopsis: Namor's solo series continues as he battles surface-world threats and defends Atlantis. Features the Atlantis/Lemuria war, Tiger Shark's vendetta, and Namor's complicated relationship with the surface world. Introduces Namorita.
connection_notes: Follows: Sub-Mariner Omnibus. Parallel: Avengers, Defenders. Leads to: Defenders Omnibus Vol. 1.

title: Incredible Hulk Epic Collection: The Hulk Must Die
issues_collected: Incredible Hulk (1968) #118-137
synopsis: Trimpe's iconic Hulk run continues with the Hulk vs. Sub-Mariner (#118), the debut of the Bi-Beast (#169), and classic Hulk-as-wanderer stories. Features the Inhumans crossover and Leader's schemes.
connection_notes: Follows: Incredible Hulk Omnibus Vol. 3 (Trimpe). Parallel: Avengers, Defenders. Leads to: Hulk Peter David Omnibus.

title: Captain America Omnibus Vol. 3 (Silver Age)
issues_collected: Captain America (1968) #114-136
synopsis: Cap in the late Silver Age. Features the iconic Falcon partnership beginning (#117), Red Skull's Cosmic Cube saga, and Cap questioning his role in a changing America. Gene Colan's moody art defines the era.
connection_notes: Follows: Captain America Omnibus Vol. 2. Leads to: Captain America Englehart Omnibus. Parallel: Avengers.

title: Avengers Epic Collection: Behold... the Vision
issues_collected: Avengers #57-76
synopsis: The Vision debuts (#57), Yellowjacket saga begins (#59-60), and the Avengers face the Squadron Sinister. Thomas expands the team's cosmic scope. Ultron becomes a recurring nemesis. Vision and Scarlet Witch romance begins.
connection_notes: Follows: Avengers Omnibus Vol. 2 (Thomas). Leads to: Avengers Kree-Skrull War. Parallel: FF ongoing.

title: Spider-Man 2099 Complete Collection Vol. 2
issues_collected: Spider-Man 2099 #26-46, Special #1
synopsis: Miguel O'Hara's future Spider-Man saga continues. The Venom 2099 arc, Goblin 2099 identity reveal, and the growing corporate dystopia of Alchemax. Peter David deepens the 2099 universe's political landscape.
connection_notes: Follows: Spider-Man 2099 Omnibus Vol. 1. Parallel: 2099 universe titles. Leads to: 2099 crossover events.

title: Thunderstrike Complete Collection
issues_collected: Thunderstrike #1-24
synopsis: Eric Masterson wields the enchanted mace as Thunderstrike after losing the Thor mantle. A working-class everyman hero dealing with Asgardian threats and personal life. Ends with his heroic sacrifice in #24.
connection_notes: Follows: Thor (1966) #432-459. Parallel: Avengers 90s era. Referenced in: Thunderstrike (2010) legacy.

title: War Machine Classic Complete Collection
issues_collected: War Machine #1-25
synopsis: James Rhodes steps out of Iron Man's shadow with his own series. Rhodey faces international arms dealers, alien technology, and questions about military interventionism. Features the Variable Threat Response Battle Suit.
connection_notes: Follows: Iron Man #284-289 (Rhodes becomes War Machine). Parallel: Iron Man 90s series. Leads to: War Machine Pak.

title: Venom: Separation Anxiety Complete
issues_collected: Venom: Separation Anxiety #1-4, Venom: Along Came a Spider #1-4
synopsis: The five Life Foundation symbiotes (Scream, Riot, Lasher, Phage, Agony) hunt Brock for answers about controlling their bonds. Followed by Scarlet Spider crossover where the symbiote nearly bonds to Ben Reilly.
connection_notes: Follows: Venom Lethal Protector. Parallel: Clone Saga era Spider-Man. Referenced in: Absolute Carnage.

title: X-Force Omnibus Vol. 2
issues_collected: X-Force #26-50, Annual #3
synopsis: X-Force matures beyond Liefeld's vision. Nicieza develops Cannonball's leadership, Siryn's recovery, and Boomer's growth. Features the Nimrod/Reignfire saga and the team moving beyond Cable's militant approach.
connection_notes: Follows: X-Force Omnibus Vol. 1. Parallel: X-Men Age of Apocalypse. Leads to: X-Force under Jeph Loeb/Adam Pollina.

title: X-Man Complete Collection Vol. 2
synopsis: Nate Grey, the Age of Apocalypse's Omega-level mutant, struggles to find purpose in the main 616 universe. His powers destabilize reality as he confronts Madelyne Pryor and dark alternate futures.
connection_notes: Follows: X-Man Complete Vol. 1. Parallel: X-Men post-Onslaught. Referenced in: Uncanny X-Men (2018) Rosenberg.

title: Avengers Epic Collection: The Gatherers Strike!
issues_collected: Avengers #343-366
synopsis: The Gatherers saga — Proctor and his multiversal Avengers hunt down 616 counterparts. Black Knight's obsidian blade curse deepens. Sersi goes mad. Features the controversial Wasp transformation and Crystal joining the team.
connection_notes: Follows: Avengers Stern Omnibus. Parallel: X-Men crossover era. Leads to: Avengers Crossing.

title: Thunderbolts by Busiek Complete Collection Vol. 3
issues_collected: Thunderbolts #51-75
synopsis: Nicieza takes the reins as Baron Zemo returns to manipulate his former team. Graviton becomes a cosmic-level threat. The team's redemption arc deepens as Songbird emerges as a true leader.
connection_notes: Follows: Thunderbolts Busiek Omnibus Vol. 2. Leads to: New Thunderbolts Omnibus. Parallel: Avengers (1998).

title: Quicksilver Complete Collection
issues_collected: Quicksilver #1-13
synopsis: Pietro Maximoff gets a solo series, working with the High Evolutionary while the Avengers are in the Heroes Reborn pocket universe. Explores his fractured relationship with Crystal and the Inhumans.
connection_notes: Parallel: Heroes Reborn 1996 Omnibus. Leads to: Avengers Busiek/Perez Vol. 1. Ties into: Siege of Wundagore.

title: Heroes Reborn: Avengers Complete
issues_collected: Avengers (1996) #1-13
synopsis: The Avengers reimagined in the Heroes Reborn pocket universe after Onslaught. A controversial experiment farming Marvel's flagship to Image founders. Liefeld departs mid-run; Valentino finishes. Mixed reception but commercially successful.
connection_notes: Follows: Onslaught Omnibus. Leads to: Heroes Reborn Return Omnibus. Parallel: Heroes Reborn FF, Cap, Iron Man.

title: Heroes Reborn: Captain America Complete
issues_collected: Captain America (1996) #1-13
synopsis: Cap reimagined in the pocket universe — SHIELD agent Steve Rogers rediscovers his patriotic calling. Liefeld's bombastic style. Robinson takes over mid-run with a more grounded approach before Heroes Return.
connection_notes: Follows: Onslaught Omnibus. Parallel: Heroes Reborn Avengers, FF, Iron Man. Leads to: Cap Waid/Garney.

title: Ka-Zar by Mark Waid Complete Vol. 2
issues_collected: Ka-Zar (1997) #15-27, Annual #1
synopsis: The conclusion of Waid's underrated Ka-Zar run. Kevin Plunder faces Thanos in the Savage Land, navigates urban New York with Shanna, and confronts the eternal tension between civilization and wilderness.
connection_notes: Follows: Ka-Zar Waid. Parallel: late 90s Marvel landscape. Standalone story.

title: Daredevil by Charles Soule Complete Collection
issues_collected: Daredevil (2015) #1-28, Daredevil (2017) #595-612
synopsis: Soule — a real-life attorney — brings legal authenticity to Matt Murdock's return to secret identity. Introduces Blindspot as a new sidekick, restores the mystery of Daredevil. Culminates in the Mayor Fisk saga (#595-612).
connection_notes: Follows: DD Waid Omnibus. Leads to: DD Zdarsky Omnibus Vol. 1. Parallel: Civil War II.

title: Captain America by Mark Waid (2017) Complete
issues_collected: Captain America (2017) #695-704
synopsis: Waid and Samnee reunite for a back-to-basics Cap after the Secret Empire controversy. Steve Rogers rebuilds trust with America on a road trip across the nation. Clean, optimistic superheroics as a palate cleanser.
connection_notes: Follows: Secret Empire. Leads to: Cap Coates. Parallel: All-New All-Different Marvel.

title: Captain America: Sentinel of Liberty (2022) Complete
issues_collected: Captain America: Sentinel of Liberty #1-13
synopsis: Steve Rogers uncovers the Outer Circle, a secret society that has manipulated the shield's legacy since World War II. Bucky becomes the Revolution. Recontextualizes the entire history of the Captain America mantle.
connection_notes: Parallel: Cap Symbol of Truth. Leads to: Cold War crossover. Ties into: Captain America by Brubaker legacy.

title: Fantastic Four by Dan Slott Omnibus Vol. 2
issues_collected: Fantastic Four (2018) #25-46, Reckoning War Alpha #1
synopsis: The Reckoning War saga — an ancient alien species predating the Watchers returns to reclaim the universe. Slott pays off plot threads from his entire run. Features Franklin losing his powers and the FF defending reality itself.
connection_notes: Follows: FF Slott Omnibus Vol. 1. Leads to: FF Ryan North. Parallel: Dawn of Krakoa era.

title: Wolverine by Benjamin Percy Vol. 3
issues_collected: Wolverine (2020) #26-37
synopsis: Logan confronts the Beast's increasingly amoral black-ops operations in X-Force while investigating Orchis infiltration. The rift between Wolverine and Beast widens into the key moral conflict of the Krakoa era.
connection_notes: Follows: Wolverine Percy Vol. 2. Parallel: X-Force Percy Omnibus Vol. 1. Leads to: Fall of X.

title: Magnificent Ms. Marvel by Saladin Ahmed
issues_collected: Magnificent Ms. Marvel #1-18
synopsis: Kamala Khan gets a Kree battle suit, faces the alien Stormranger AI, and confronts the death of a loved one. Ahmed deepens Kamala's Muslim-American identity and explores the cost of heroism on family.
connection_notes: Follows: Ms. Marvel Wilson Vol. 3. Leads to: Ms. Marvel Iman Vellani, Ms. Marvel New Mutant. Parallel: Champions.

title: Black Cat by Jed MacKay Complete Collection
issues_collected: Black Cat (2019) #1-12, Black Cat (2020) #1-10, Black Cat Annual #1
synopsis: Felicia Hardy assembles her own heist crew and steals from the Marvel Universe's most dangerous villains. Ties into the King in Black event. MacKay writes a charming Ocean's Eleven-style caper across the MU.
connection_notes: Parallel: ASM Nick Spencer, King in Black. Leads to: Iron Cat. Ties into: Avengers Inc MacKay.

title: Runaways by Rainbow Rowell Complete Collection
issues_collected: Runaways (2017) #1-38
synopsis: The Runaways reunite as adults, dealing with the emotional fallout of Gert's resurrection and the challenge of maintaining found-family bonds in adulthood. Rowell brings literary depth and emotional honesty to Marvel's best teen team.
connection_notes: Follows: Runaways BKV Vol. 2. Parallel: Champions Waid. Standalone but references original BKV continuity.

title: Power Man and Iron Fist by David Walker Complete
issues_collected: Power Man and Iron Fist (2016) #1-15, Civil War II tie-in
synopsis: Luke Cage and Danny Rand back together with kinetic, hip-hop-influenced art by Sanford Greene. They chase the Supersoul Stone through Harlem's criminal underworld. A love letter to classic 70s team-up comics updated for modern sensibilities.
connection_notes: Follows: Luke Cage Walker, Power Man Iron Fist 2016. Parallel: Civil War II. Standalone fun.

title: Venom by Al Ewing Complete Collection
synopsis: Eddie Brock ascends to become the King in Black, then explores the Symbiote multiverse as a cosmic entity. Ram V co-writes Dylan Brock's parallel journey. Builds on Cates' mythology with Ewing's signature cosmic ambition.
connection_notes: Follows: Venom Cates Omnibus, King in Black. Leads to: Venom War. Parallel: Carnage Ram V 2023.

title: Thor by Donny Cates Omnibus
synopsis: Thor becomes All-Father and Herald of Galactus simultaneously. Features the Black Winter saga, God of Hammers, and the Hulk vs. Thor rematch in Banner of War. Thor wields the full Odinforce but struggles with the burden of omnipotence.
connection_notes: Follows: Mighty Thor Aaron Vol. 2. Leads to: Immortal Thor Ewing. Parallel: Hulk (2021), King in Black.

title: Hellcat by Nicieza & DeMatteis Complete
issues_collected: Hellcat #1-3, Patsy Walker: Hellstorm #1-4
synopsis: Patsy Walker escapes from Hell and reclaims her Hellcat identity. A short but significant series that resurrects the character after her death in Defenders and sets up her return to active hero duty.
connection_notes: Follows: Defenders Omnibus Vol. 3. Leads to: Avengers Busiek/Perez (Hellcat joins). Parallel: Heroes Return era.

title: Ghost-Spider by Seanan McGuire
issues_collected: Ghost-Spider #1-10, Spider-Gwen: Ghost-Spider #1-10
synopsis: Gwen Stacy of Earth-65 enrolls at ESU in the 616 universe, balancing college life with interdimensional heroics. Faces the Jackal and Man-Wolf while navigating being a literal stranger in a strange land.
connection_notes: Follows: Spider-Gwen Ghost-Spider. Parallel: Miles Morales Spider-Man. Ties into: Spider-Verse events.

title: Gwenpool Strikes Back
issues_collected: Gwenpool Strikes Back #1-5
synopsis: Gwen Poole fights to remain relevant in the Marvel Universe — literally, as her fourth-wall-breaking powers let her see she's being written out of continuity. A meta-comic about the nature of fictional existence.
connection_notes: Follows: Gwenpool Omnibus. Standalone meta-comedy. References: entire Marvel publishing line.

title: Silk (2022) by Pak Complete
synopsis: Cindy Moon balances her reporter day job with spider-heroics in New York. Faces a new threat linked to her time in the bunker while exploring her Korean-American heritage and reconnecting with family.
connection_notes: Follows: Silk Thompson, Silk Vol. 2 Pak. Parallel: ASM Nick Spencer era. Standalone Spider-family title.

title: Web of Spider-Man Omnibus Vol. 1
issues_collected: Web of Spider-Man #1-30, Annual #1-2
synopsis: The third Spider-Man title launches. Features the landmark alien costume departure (#1), Vulturions, the Rose saga, and Spider-Man navigating the post-Secret Wars landscape. A key book for 80s Spidey completionists.
connection_notes: Parallel: ASM Omnibus Vol. 5, Spectacular Spider-Man. Follows: Secret Wars 1984. Ties into: Kraven's Last Hunt (#31-32).

title: War of Kings Companion
issues_collected: War of Kings: Darkhawk #1-2, War of Kings: Warriors #1-2, War of Kings: Ascension #1-4
synopsis: Tie-in stories expanding the War of Kings cosmic conflict. Darkhawk discovers his armor's Fraternity of Raptors origins. Gladiator, Crystal, and the Shi'ar Imperial Guard face divided loyalties.
connection_notes: Parallel: War of Kings Omnibus. Follows: Annihilation Conquest. Leads to: Realm of Kings.

title: Realm of Kings Omnibus
issues_collected: Realm of Kings #1, Realm of Kings: Imperial Guard #1-5, Realm of Kings: Inhumans #1-5, Realm of Kings: Son of Hulk #1-4
synopsis: After the War of Kings tears a hole in spacetime called the Fault, the cosmic Marvel universe faces Lovecraftian horrors from the Cancerverse. The Imperial Guard, Inhumans, and Guardians investigate the rift.
connection_notes: Follows: War of Kings Omnibus. Leads to: Thanos Imperative. Parallel: GotG DnA Omnibus.

title: Infinity Wars by Gerry Duggan
issues_collected: Infinity Wars #1-6, Infinity Wars Prime #1
synopsis: Gamora becomes Requiem and steals all six Infinity Stones, then folds the universe in half — literally combining heroes into merged beings (Iron Hammer, Arachknight). Duggan's cosmic event with a Gamora-centric villain turn.
connection_notes: Follows: Infinity Countdown. Parallel: ANAD era. Leads to: Infinity Watch. References: Infinity Gauntlet legacy.

title: Secret Empire Companion
issues_collected: Secret Empire: Brave New World #1-5, Secret Empire: Underground #1, Captain America #25
synopsis: Tie-in stories from Hydra-ruled America during Secret Empire. Heroes go underground, civilians resist, and the Marvel Universe lives under Steve Rogers' fascist regime. Contextual stories that deepen the main event.
connection_notes: Parallel: Secret Empire. Follows: Captain America by Spencer. Leads to: Cap Waid 2017.

title: Chaos War Complete
issues_collected: Chaos War #1-5, Chaos War tie-ins
synopsis: Amadeus Cho and Hercules battle the Chaos King (Amatsu-Mikaboshi) who threatens to destroy all of reality. Dead heroes return temporarily. Culminates Pak and Van Lente's entire Hercules saga from Incredible Hercules.
connection_notes: Follows: Incredible Hercules Complete Vol. 2. Parallel: Heroic Age. References: Ares' death in Siege.

title: Fear Itself Companion
issues_collected: Fear Itself: The Home Front #1-7, Fear Itself: Youth in Revolt #1-6, Fear Itself: The Deep #1-4
synopsis: Ground-level stories during the Serpent's war on Earth. Speedball and the Initiative face civilian panic. Namor and Dr. Strange protect the oceans. Young heroes rally without Avengers support.
connection_notes: Parallel: Fear Itself. Follows: Heroic Age Complete. Leads to: Avengers vs. X-Men setup.

title: Empyre Companion
issues_collected: Empyre: X-Men #1-4, Empyre: Avengers #1-3, Lords of Empyre: Emperor Hulkling #1
synopsis: Tie-ins to the Kree-Skrull alliance under Emperor Hulkling. X-Men defend Krakoa from Cotati invasion. Avengers support the intergalactic alliance. Features the mutant resurrection protocols in action during wartime.
connection_notes: Parallel: Empyre main event. Follows: Incoming! #1. Ties into: Dawn of Krakoa era.

title: Nextwave: Agents of H.A.T.E. Complete Collection
issues_collected: Nextwave: Agents of H.A.T.E. #1-12
synopsis: A gleefully anarchic satire of superhero comics. Monica Rambeau, Machine Man, Boom-Boom, Elsa Bloodstone, and The Captain fight Unusual Weapons of Mass Destruction for the Beyond Corporation. Pure comic book joy.
connection_notes: Standalone masterpiece. Referenced in: Mighty Avengers (Monica), Agents of Wakanda. Cult classic status.

title: Darkhawk Classic Complete Collection
issues_collected: Darkhawk #1-25
synopsis: Teen Chris Powell finds an alien amulet that transforms him into the armored Darkhawk. A Spider-Man-adjacent street-level hero dealing with his father's criminal connections and the mystery of the amulet's Fraternity of Raptors origins.
connection_notes: Parallel: New Warriors, Spider-Man 90s. Ties into: War of Kings (Darkhawk resurgence). Leads to: Darkhawk Classic Vol. 2.

title: Speedball Complete Collection
issues_collected: Speedball #1-10, New Warriors (1990) #1 origin pages
synopsis: Robbie Baldwin gains kinetic energy powers from a dimensional rift and becomes the bouncing hero Speedball. Ditko's final significant Marvel creation — a lighthearted, fun series before Baldwin's darker Penance transformation post-Civil War.
connection_notes: Leads to: New Warriors Classic Omnibus Vol. 1, Civil War (Stamford incident). Pre-dates: Penance transformation.

title: Sentry by Paul Jenkins Complete
issues_collected: Sentry #1-5, Sentry/Fantastic Four #1, Sentry/Spider-Man #1, Sentry/X-Men #1, Sentry/Hulk #1, Sentry vs. the Void #1
synopsis: Robert Reynolds remembers he is the Sentry — a forgotten hero with the power of a million exploding suns. But his existence also created the Void. A brilliant deconstruction of superhero mythology and mental illness, sold with a real-world hoax that it was a lost Stan Lee character.
connection_notes: Leads to: New Avengers Omnibus Vol. 1 (Sentry joins), Siege (Sentry's fall). Standalone origin but essential for Bendis era.

title: Iron Man by Busiek & Chen Complete
synopsis: Tony Stark returns from the Heroes Reborn pocket universe and rebuilds his life. Busiek restores classic Iron Man storytelling with the Mandarin, Whiplash, and corporate espionage. The definitive post-Heroes Return Iron Man.
connection_notes: Follows: Heroes Reborn Iron Man. Parallel: Avengers Busiek/Perez. Leads to: Iron Man Extremis.

title: New X-Men: Academy X Complete Vol. 2
synopsis: Post-Decimation devastation hits the Xavier School. Only 27 students retain powers. The Purifiers massacre depowered students on the bus. Introduces X-23 to the team. The darkest era of Xavier's school.
connection_notes: Follows: New X-Men Academy X Omnibus. Parallel: House of M aftermath. Leads to: X-Men Messiah Complex.

title: Avengers Epic Collection: Under Siege (Extended)
issues_collected: Avengers #270-285
synopsis: The definitive Avengers story. Baron Zemo assembles the Masters of Evil and systematically destroys everything the Avengers hold dear — they invade the Mansion, beat Hercules nearly to death, and break Jarvis. Captain America's darkest hour before his triumph.
connection_notes: Peak of Stern's Avengers run. Leads to: Avengers Stern Omnibus continuation. Parallel: X-Men Mutant Massacre.

title: Incredible Hulk by John Byrne & Peter David Omnibus
issues_collected: Incredible Hulk #314-330
synopsis: Byrne separates Banner and Hulk, then Peter David takes over and begins the most acclaimed Hulk run ever. McFarlane's dynamic art transforms the book. Features the Grey Hulk's return and Joe Fixit persona emerging.
connection_notes: Leads to: Hulk Peter David Omnibus Vol. 1. Parallel: Secret Wars II aftermath. Follows: Incredible Hulk Omnibus Vol. 5.

title: X-Force/X-Statix by Peter Milligan & Mike Allred Omnibus
issues_collected: X-Force #116-129, X-Statix #1-26, Dead Girl #1-5, Wolverine/Doop #1-2, X-Statix Presents: Dead Girl #1-5
synopsis: One of the most radical reinventions in X-Men history. Peter Milligan and Mike Allred take over X-Force with #116 (2001) and transform it from a paramilitary mutant squad into a satirical commentary on celebrity culture, reality TV, and commodified heroism. The original team is killed off in the first issue. The new team — Guy Smith (Mr. Sensitive/Orphan), U-Go Girl, the Anarchist, Doop, Dead Girl, Venus Dee Milo — are fame-obsessed mutants who treat superheroics as a media spectacle. Characters die frequently and permanently. The series was so different Marvel renamed it X-Statix with #1 (2002). The Diana Princess of Wales controversy (changed to a fictional pop star) showed how boundary-pushing the book was. Allred's pop-art style perfectly complements Milligan's acidic writing. Won multiple Eisner nominations. One of the most critically acclaimed Marvel series of the 2000s.
connection_notes: Standalone reinvention of X-Force. Parallel: New X-Men by Morrison (both radically reimagining the X-line simultaneously). Spiritual predecessor to modern satirical superhero comics. Dead Girl miniseries is an epilogue.

title: Uncanny X-Men by Kieron Gillen Omnibus
issues_collected: S.W.O.R.D. #1-5, Uncanny X-Men #534.1-544, X-Men: Regenesis #1, Uncanny X-Men (2012) #1-20, AvX: Consequences #1-5
synopsis: Kieron Gillen's Uncanny X-Men run bridges the Utopia era to post-AvX, covering one of the most turbulent periods in X-Men history. Begins with S.W.O.R.D. (the Sentient World Observation and Response Department) before taking over Uncanny X-Men during Schism. Cyclops forms his Extinction Team — a lineup designed to handle extinction-level threats and show the world that mutants are necessary. Features Sinister's London, the Phoenix Five's rise and fall during AvX, and the devastating AvX: Consequences where Cyclops sits in prison having killed Professor Xavier. Gillen excels at characterizing Cyclops's transformation from boy scout to revolutionary, Magneto's conflicted loyalty, and Sinister's gleeful villainy. Essential reading for understanding how Cyclops went from X-Men leader to 'mutant Malcolm X' — a transformation that directly informs the Krakoa era.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: X-Men Schism. Parallel: Wolverine and the X-Men by Jason Aaron (the other side of Schism). Leads to: All-New X-Men by Bendis, Uncanny X-Men by Bendis. AvX: Consequences sets up everything post-AvX.

title: Captain America by Ed Brubaker Omnibus Vol. 4
issues_collected: Captain America #602-619, Captain America: Who Will Wield the Shield? #1, Steve Rogers: Super-Soldier #1-4, Captain America (2011) #1-10
synopsis: The concluding volume of Ed Brubaker's landmark Captain America run. The Trial of Captain America puts Bucky Barnes on trial for his crimes as the Winter Soldier, with the world watching. Steve Rogers returns to the shield after Siege. Brubaker explores the fallout of everything he built — Bucky's redemption arc reaches its conclusion, Sin (Red Skull's daughter) becomes the new Red Skull, and Fear Itself tie-ins set up Bucky's apparent death. The final issues (Captain America 2011 #1-10) see Steve grappling with a new Hydra conspiracy and the Madbomb. Brubaker's run ends as it began — with espionage, moral complexity, and the question of what Captain America means to a changed world. Completes one of the greatest single-author superhero runs of the 21st century.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Captain America by Brubaker Omnibus Vol. 1-3. Parallel: Avengers by Bendis (Heroic Age). Leads to: Captain America by Rick Remender.

title: Spider-Man: Brand New Day Omnibus Vol. 2
issues_collected: Amazing Spider-Man #584-611, Annual #36, Amazing Spider-Man Extra! #1-3
synopsis: The second volume of the thrice-monthly Amazing Spider-Man era following One More Day. The rotating creative team (Guggenheim, Waid, Kelly, Slott, Van Lente) continues Peter Parker's post-marriage adventures. Major arcs include 'Character Assassination' (revealing the Spider-Tracer Killer), 'New Ways to Die' continuation, and the buildup to 'The Gauntlet' which systematically upgrades Spider-Man's classic rogues gallery. Menace is revealed as Lily Hollister. Harry Osborn's return deepens. The 'election' storyline runs through multiple issues. Sets the stage for 'The Gauntlet' and 'Grim Hunt' in Vol. 3. The Brand New Day era proved that a thrice-monthly Spider-Man book could sustain quality across multiple writers.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Brand New Day Omnibus Vol. 1. Leads to: Brand New Day Omnibus Vol. 3 (The Gauntlet/Grim Hunt, upcoming June 2026). Parallel: Dark Reign tie-ins.

title: Black Panther by Ta-Nehisi Coates Omnibus
issues_collected: Black Panther (2016) #1-18, #166-172, Black Panther (2018) #1-25
synopsis: National Book Award winner and MacArthur Fellow Ta-Nehisi Coates brings literary ambition to Wakanda in the most acclaimed Black Panther run since Christopher Priest. 'A Nation Under Our Feet' (2016) begins with a Wakandan revolution: the Dora Milaje splinter into the rebel group the Midnight Angels, a terrorist named Tetu challenges T'Challa's monarchy, and the Crew (Storm, Luke Cage, Misty Knight, Manifold) rallies to Wakanda's defense. Coates interrogates the fundamental tension of a superhero king — can monarchy be just? The second series, 'The Intergalactic Empire of Wakanda' (2018), catapults T'Challa into space where he discovers a vast Wakandan empire built on slavery and conquest. Memory-wiped and enslaved, T'Challa must rediscover himself while confronting what Wakanda could become without its ideals. The run ends by reaffirming that Wakanda's strength comes from its people, not its king.
connection_notes: Parallel: Civil War II, Secret Empire. Coates's run was influenced by Priest's Black Panther (read first for full context). Leads to: Black Panther by John Ridley, Black Panther by Eve L. Ewing.

title: Web of Spider-Man Omnibus Vol. 2
issues_collected: Web of Spider-Man #35-72, Annual #4-6
synopsis: The second volume of Spider-Man's third ongoing title, covering the late 1980s through the early Acts of Vengeance era. Gerry Conway returns to Spider-Man writing and Alex Saviuk provides consistent art. Features Cosmic Spider-Man (Acts of Vengeance tie-in, where Spidey gains Captain Universe powers), the Chameleon conspiracy, Tombstone as a recurring threat, and tie-ins to major events including Inferno and Atlantis Attacks. The book served as the 'street-level' Spider-Man title while Amazing handled the bigger stories and Spectacular covered the noir angle. Includes the Annuals that crossed over with other Spider-Man titles. Essential for completists tracking the full Spider-Man experience of this era.
connection_notes: Parallel: Amazing Spider-Man by Michelinie/McFarlane, Spectacular Spider-Man. Ties into: Inferno, Acts of Vengeance, Atlantis Attacks.

title: X-Men: Road to Onslaught Omnibus
issues_collected: X-Men Prime #1, Uncanny X-Men #322-328, Annual '95, X-Men (1991) #42-47, Annual '95, X-Men Unlimited #8-9, Sabretooth Special #1, Wolverine/Gambit: Victims #1-4, Starjammers #1-4
synopsis: The critical bridge between Age of Apocalypse and Onslaught. After reality resets following Legion's failed assassination, the X-Men return to a changed world. Onslaught's shadow grows as Xavier becomes increasingly erratic — hints that something is deeply wrong with the Professor. Joe Madureira's manga-influenced art on Uncanny X-Men defines the visual style of mid-90s Marvel. Features the post-AoA status quo: the Phalanx aftermath, Sabretooth's uneasy presence at the mansion, Gambit's dark secrets, and Wolverine's regression after losing his adamantium. X-Men Prime reestablishes the status quo after AoA. Published 2024, this omnibus fills the previously uncollected gap between two of the biggest X-Men events of the decade.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: X-Men: Age of Apocalypse Omnibus. Leads to: X-Men: Onslaught Omnibus. Key bridge that was previously uncollected.

title: Spider-Man: Clone Saga Omnibus Vol. 3
issues_collected: Amazing Spider-Man #410-418, Spider-Man #67-75, Spectacular Spider-Man #233-241, New Warriors #67-75, Spider-Man Unlimited #11-14
synopsis: The Clone Saga reaches its most controversial phase. Peter Parker is told he's the clone and Ben Reilly is the 'real' Spider-Man — a creative decision driven by editorial mandates that alienated a generation of readers. Peter and MJ leave New York. Ben becomes Spider-Man with a redesigned costume. The Jackal returns. Kaine's role deepens. Judas Traveller and Scrier manipulate events from the shadows. Meanwhile, the New Warriors cross over as the Scarlet Spider joins their ranks. The storyline was originally meant to end here but was extended due to strong initial sales, leading to the editorial chaos that defines the saga's reputation. Despite the controversy, individual issues contain strong character work, particularly Ben Reilly's struggle to forge his own identity.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Clone Saga Omnibus Vol. 1-2. Leads to: Clone Saga conclusion (Norman Osborn's return, Ben Reilly's death). Parallel: other 1996 Spider-Man crossovers.

title: Giant-Size Marvel Omnibus
issues_collected: Giant-Size X-Men #1, Giant-Size Defenders #1-5, Giant-Size Avengers #1-4, Giant-Size Spider-Man #1, 4-5, Giant-Size Dracula #2-5, Giant-Size Man-Thing #1-5, Giant-Size Werewolf #2-5, Giant-Size Fantastic Four #2-6, Giant-Size Chillers #1-3, Giant-Size Creatures #1, Giant-Size Super-Heroes #1, Giant-Size Super-Stars #1, Giant-Size Super-Villain Team-Up #1-2
synopsis: The complete Giant-Size initiative from 1974-1975, Marvel's experiment with quarterly oversized comics. Most famously includes Giant-Size X-Men #1 — the single most important issue of the 1970s, which introduced the All-New, All-Different X-Men (Wolverine, Storm, Colossus, Nightcrawler, Thunderbird, Banshee) and relaunched a cancelled title into Marvel's flagship franchise. Beyond the X-Men, this omnibus collects the Giant-Size editions of Defenders (featuring the Headmen, Guardians of the Galaxy from the 31st century), Avengers (including the Vision/Scarlet Witch wedding in Giant-Size Avengers #4), Spider-Man, Fantastic Four, and the horror titles. A comprehensive snapshot of Marvel's Bronze Age ambition in oversized format.
connection_notes: Giant-Size X-Men #1 also collected in UXM Omnibus Vol. 1. This omnibus provides the broader Giant-Size context. Key Vision/Scarlet Witch wedding in GS Avengers #4.

title: X-Men: The Messiah Trilogy Omnibus
issues_collected: X-Men: Messiah Complex crossover, Cable (2008) #1-12, X-Force (2008) #1-11, X-Men: Messiah War crossover, New Mutants (2009) #1-4, X-Force (2008) #21-28, Uncanny X-Men #523-525, X-Men Legacy #235-237, New Mutants #12-14, X-Factor #204-206, X-Men: Second Coming #1-2
synopsis: The complete X-Men Messiah saga collected for the first time in a single omnibus. After House of M decimated mutantkind ('No more mutants'), the birth of Hope Summers — the first new mutant — triggers a war for the future. Messiah Complex (2007): Multiple factions (X-Men, Purifiers, Marauders, Predator X) fight for the mutant baby. Cable escapes into the future with her. Messiah War (2009): X-Force pursues Cable and Hope through a dystopian future ruled by Stryfe, with Bishop as the relentless hunter trying to kill Hope. Second Coming (2010): Cable and a teenage Hope return to the present for a final stand. Bastion's Human Council launches a genocidal assault. Nightcrawler dies saving Hope. Cable sacrifices himself. Hope manifests the Phoenix Force and reignites the mutant gene. The trilogy is the backbone of X-Men continuity from 2007-2010 and the direct precursor to Avengers vs. X-Men. Upcoming June 2026 release.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: House of M, Decimation. Leads to: Avengers vs. X-Men, Hope's role in the Phoenix saga. Individual events previously available separately (Messiah CompleX, Messiah War, Second Coming are in our database). This omnibus collects all three plus connecting issues for the first time.

title: Avengers Forever by Jason Aaron Omnibus
issues_collected: Avengers Forever (2021) #1-15, Avengers Assemble: Alpha #1, Avengers Assemble: Omega #1, Free Comic Book Day 2022: Avengers/X-Men #1
synopsis: The conclusion of Jason Aaron's seven-year Avengers epic. Avengers Forever follows a multiversal team of Avengers — led by Robbie Reyes (Ghost Rider) and Tony Stark from a ruined timeline — as they battle the Multiversal Masters of Evil across infinite realities. Each issue spotlights a different Earth's Avengers: a prehistoric Wakanda, a Wild West with Avenger Kid Colt, a world where everyone is Doom. The Avengers Assemble event brings every thread together: the prehistoric Avengers from 1,000,000 BC, the current team, and the multiversal squad unite to fight Mephisto's ultimate gambit. Aaron's run began with Avengers #1 (2018) and this omnibus provides the multiversal companion series and the grand finale. Not required for Krakoa understanding but completes the Aaron Avengers saga.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Avengers by Jason Aaron Omnibus Vol. 1 (and ideally Vol. 2). Parallel: Krakoa-era X-Men, Eternals by Gillen. Connects to: A.X.E. Judgment Day (crossover between Aaron's Avengers, Gillen's Eternals, and Krakoa X-Men).

title: Marvel Masterworks: Dazzler Vol. 1
issues_collected: X-Men (1963) #130-131; Amazing Spider-Man (1963) #203; and Dazzler (1981) #1-13
synopsis: Alison Blaire takes center stage as Marvel's disco diva with mutant light powers. Her first appearances in X-Men #130-131 and Amazing Spider-Man #203 lead into her self-titled series, where issues #1-13 establish Dazzler's struggles balancing superhero life with her singing career. This collection captures the character's distinctive late-70s/early-80s flavor, including early appearances by supporting cast and the Enchantress as a recurring threat. A fascinating time capsule of Marvel's attempt at a multimedia franchise.
connection_notes: Leads to: Marvel Masterworks Dazzler Vol. 2. Connects to: X-Men runs of this era for context on her mutant status. The character later becomes more significant in X-Men titles of the mid-80s.

title: Marvels 25th Anniversary
issues_collected: Marvels Annotated (2019) #1-4; Marvels Epilogue (2019) #1; and Marvels 25th Tribute Variants
synopsis: Kurt Busiek and Alex Ross's landmark 1994 miniseries gets the deluxe treatment with fully annotated reprints of all four issues plus the 2019 epilogue. Marvels redefined superhero comics by presenting Marvel history through photographer Phil Sheldon's eyes, from the Human Torch's 1939 debut through Gwen Stacy's death. This edition includes extensive historical notes and the tribute variant covers celebrating the series' quarter-century impact on the medium.
connection_notes: The original Marvels is essential reading, but this anniversary edition is primarily for collectors wanting the annotated version and bonus material. Best read after familiarity with major Marvel milestones from 1939-1973.

title: Captain America By Ta-Nehisi Coates Vol. 1
issues_collected: Captain America (2018) #1-12
synopsis: Acclaimed author Ta-Nehisi Coates brings literary gravitas to Steve Rogers in issues #1-12, exploring Captain America's role in a fractured America. The run examines themes of idealism versus cynicism as Cap faces both the Power Elite conspiracy and his own doubts about whether his ideals still matter. Leinil Francis Yu's art grounds the philosophical examination in visceral action. Coates crafts a thoughtful meditation on what Captain America means in the 21st century.
connection_notes: Follows: Secret Empire aftermath. Leads to: Captain America by Coates Vol. 2-3. This run works as a standalone examination of Cap's values, though context from Secret Empire adds weight to Steve's struggles.

title: Astonishing X-Men By Whedon & Cassaday Omnibus John Cassaday X-Men Reading Cover
issues_collected: Astonishing X-Men (2004) #1-24 and Giant-Size Astonishing X-Men (2008) #1
synopsis: Joss Whedon and John Cassaday deliver one of the definitive X-Men runs in Astonishing #1-24 and Giant-Size #1. The "Gifted" arc reintroduces Kitty Pryde and a mutant cure, "Dangerous" reveals the Danger Room's sentience, "Torn" features Emma Frost's betrayal and Cassandra Nova's return, and "Unstoppable" sends the team into space to stop a planet-destroying bullet. Whedon perfectly balances character work, humor, and epic stakes while Cassaday's cinematic art defines modern X-Men aesthetics.
connection_notes: Follows: New X-Men by Morrison (referenced heavily). Leads to: Astonishing X-Men continues under different creators. One of the most accessible and acclaimed X-Men runs, often recommended as a starting point for new readers.

title: Marvel Masterworks: Avengers Vol. 20
issues_collected: Avengers (1963) #203-216 and Annual (1967) #10,and material from Marvel Super Action (1977) #35-37
synopsis: Jim Shooter and David Michelinie's early-80s Avengers stretch includes issues #203-216 and Annual #10. This volume features the Court-Martial of Yellowjacket storyline (#213-214) addressing Hank Pym's personal crisis, and Annual #10 introduces Rogue in her villainous debut as she permanently absorbs Ms. Marvel's powers. The run bridges the team-up era into more character-driven storytelling while establishing several long-term plot threads.
connection_notes: Leads to: Marvel Masterworks Avengers Vol. 21. Annual #10 is significant for Rogue and Carol Danvers' histories. The Yellowjacket court-martial is referenced in later Avengers runs dealing with team accountability.

title: Amazing Fantasy Omnibus HC
issues_collected: AMAZING ADVENTURES (1961) 1-6, AMAZING ADULT FANTASY (1961) 7-14, AMAZING FANTASY (1961) 15
synopsis: Before there was Marvel, there were the pre-superhero monster and sci-fi anthologies. Amazing Adventures #1-6 and Amazing Adult Fantasy #7-14 showcase Stan Lee and Steve Ditko's atmospheric twist-ending stories before Amazing Fantasy #15 changes everything with Spider-Man's first appearance. These tales reveal the creative DNA that would inform Marvel's superhero revolution—Ditko's otherworldly imagination and Lee's everyman narratives converging toward something unprecedented.
connection_notes: Leads to: Amazing Spider-Man Omnibus Vol. 1. Essential for understanding Marvel's pre-superhero identity and how Spider-Man emerged from this storytelling tradition. The Ditko short stories here influence his later Spider-Man work.

title: Morbius Living Vampire Omnibus HC
issues_collected: AMAZING SPIDER-MAN (1963) #101-102; MARVEL TEAM-UP (1972) #3-4; FEAR #20-31; GIANT-SIZE SUPER-HEROES #1; MARVEL PREMIERE #28; MARVEL TWO-IN-ONE (1974) #15; PETER PARKER, THE SPECTACULAR SPIDER-MAN (1976) #6-8 and #38; SAVAGE SHE-HULK #9-12; and material from GIANT-SIZE WEREWOLF #4; VAMPIRE TALES #1-5, #7-8 and #10-11; and MARVEL PREVIEW #8.
synopsis: Dr. Michael Morbius, the Living Vampire, debuts in Amazing Spider-Man #101-102 as Marvel tests the Comics Code's loosening grip on horror. This omnibus collects his complete 1970s appearances including his solo series in Fear #20-31, Marvel Premiere #28, and team-ups across the Marvel Universe. The black-and-white Vampire Tales magazine stories showcase more mature storytelling. A comprehensive look at Marvel's tragic vampire scientist navigating superhero and horror genres simultaneously.
connection_notes: First appearance connects to: Amazing Spider-Man runs of early 70s. Contemporary with: Tomb of Dracula and Werewolf by Night in Marvel's horror expansion. Morbius later becomes significant in Midnight Sons and Spider-Man storylines.

title: Infinity Gauntlet Marvel Select HC
issues_collected: INFINITY GAUNTLET (1991) #1-6
synopsis: Jim Starlin's cosmic opus redefined Marvel event comics as Thanos acquires the Infinity Gems and achieves godhood in issues #1-6. With a snap, half the universe dies, forcing Earth's heroes and cosmic entities into an impossible battle against omnipotence. George Pérez and Ron Lim deliver spectacular cosmic action while Starlin explores themes of power, love, and death through Thanos's doomed courtship of Death herself. The template for modern Marvel events.
connection_notes: Follows: Silver Surfer by Starlin (Thanos Quest). Leads to: Infinity War, Infinity Crusade. Essential context for MCU Infinity War/Endgame. This Marvel Select reprint contains just the main series; omnibus editions include more context.

title: Mmw Spectacular Spider-Man HC Vol. 03
issues_collected: THE SPECTACULAR SPIDER-MAN (1976) #32-42 & ANNUAL (1979) #1, THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN ANNUAL (1964) 13 and FANTASTIC FOUR (1961) #218
synopsis: Spectacular Spider-Man #32-42 and both annuals continue Roger Stern and Bill Mantlo's contributions to Spidey's second ongoing series. This volume features the conclusion of the Iguana saga, Doctor Octopus appearances, and street-level Spider-Man action that complements the Amazing title. The annuals provide team-ups and expanded stories. Solid late-70s/early-80s Spider-Man that fills out the era between major Amazing Spider-Man storylines.
connection_notes: Leads to: Marvel Masterworks Spectacular Spider-Man Vol. 4. Runs concurrent with: Amazing Spider-Man Masterworks of the same era. These Spectacular issues offer additional Spider-Man stories for fans wanting complete 1970s-80s coverage.

title: Timelys Sub-Mariner Everett Post-War Omnibus HC
issues_collected: SUB-MARINER COMICS 21-24, 26-30, 32-42; NAMORA 1-3; MARVEL MYSTERY COMICS 84-86, 90-91; HUMAN TORCH 28, 30, 37-38; BLONDE PHANTOM 17; YOUNG MEN 24-28; MEN'S ADVENTURES 28
synopsis: Bill Everett returns to his signature creation in this comprehensive collection of post-war Sub-Mariner stories from 1946-1955. Sub-Mariner Comics #21-42, Namora's early solo appearances, and crossovers across the Timely line showcase Namor's transition from WWII hero to Cold War adventurer. Everett's artwork defines the character's visual identity while these stories capture Timely's evolution toward Atlas and eventually Marvel Comics. Essential for Golden Age completists and Namor historians.
connection_notes: Follows: Timely's Golden Age Sub-Mariner collections. Connects to: Namor's Silver Age revival in Fantastic Four #4. These post-war stories fill the gap between WWII Namor and his 1960s return, showing the character's sustained popularity.

title: Immortal Hulk Vol. 2
issues_collected: Immortal Hulk #11-20
synopsis: Al Ewing and Joe Bennett's horror-infused Hulk saga deepens as Banner confronts the Shadow Base organization and the true nature of his immortality. Issues #11-20 expand the Green Door mythology, introduce the monstrous Xemnu, and feature the shocking "Hulk in Hell" arc where Banner faces the One Below All. This volume pushes the body horror and cosmic dread to new extremes while exploring what it means to be unable to die.
connection_notes: Leads to: Immortal Hulk Vol. 3. Requires: Immortal Hulk Vol. 1 for essential setup of the Green Door concept and Banner's resurrection.

title: Miles Morales Ultimate Spider-Man Omnibus HC
issues_collected: ULTIMATE COMICS SPIDER-MAN 1-28, 16.1; SPIDER-MEN 1-5; CATACLYSM: ULTIMATE SPIDER-MAN 1-3; ULTIMATE SPIDER-MAN 200; MILES MORALES: ULTIMATE SPIDER-MAN 1-12; MATERIAL FROM ULTIMATE FALLOUT 4
synopsis: Brian Michael Bendis creates Marvel's new Spider-Man in the wake of Peter Parker's death in the Ultimate Universe. This omnibus collects Miles Morales' complete journey from his origin in Ultimate Fallout #4 through his establishment as the Ultimate Universe's Spider-Man across multiple series. Includes the crossover Spider-Men where Miles meets the 616 Peter Parker, and chronicles Miles' development from uncertain teenager to hero during the Cataclysm event.
connection_notes: Follows: Death of Spider-Man. Leads to: Secret Wars (2015) which brings Miles into the main Marvel Universe. Essential for understanding Miles Morales before his 616 integration.

title: Amazing Spider-Man: Full Circle
issues_collected: Amazing Spider-Man: Full Circle #1
synopsis: A unique experimental anthology celebrating Spider-Man's legacy through a single-issue relay race format. Top creators including Jonathan Hickman, Al Ewing, and Gerry Duggan each contribute a short chapter that flows into the next, creating one continuous adventure. This innovative storytelling approach showcases Spider-Man's versatility and Marvel's creative bench depth in a love letter to the character.
connection_notes: Standalone celebration requiring no prior reading. A curio for Spider-Man completists and those interested in experimental comic formats.

title: Runaways Pride & Joy Marvel Select HC
issues_collected: RUNAWAYS (2003) #1-6
synopsis: Brian K. Vaughan and Adrian Alphona introduce a brilliant concept: what if your parents were super-villains? Issues #1-6 follow six Los Angeles teenagers who discover their parents are the Pride, a criminal cabal secretly controlling the city. This character-driven origin story establishes the core team dynamics and shocking parental betrayals that define the series while showcasing Vaughan's gift for teen dialogue.
connection_notes: Leads to: Runaways by Brian K. Vaughan & Adrian Alphona Omnibus (complete run). A perfect entry point requiring no Marvel Universe knowledge, later connects to larger Marvel continuity.

title: Uncanny X-Men Omnibus HC Vol. 01
issues_collected: GIANT-SIZE X-MEN 1, X-MEN (1963) 94-131, ANNUAL (1970) 3
