title: Star Wars Legends Epic Collection: The Original Marvel Years Vol. 5 TP
issues_collected: STAR WARS (1977) #74-88, STAR WARS ANNUAL (1979) 33; STAR WARS: RETURN OF THE JEDI #1-4
synopsis: The original Marvel run continues through Return of the Jedi and beyond. Star Wars #74-88 bridges post-Empire storytelling with the theatrical adaptation, as Duffy, Michelinie, and others navigate Luke's journey to Jedi Knight. Includes Annual #3 and the complete Return of the Jedi #1-4 adaptation. The series increasingly struggles with continuity as it attempts to tell new stories while awaiting the final film's release, resulting in uneven but historically significant material from Marvel's first Star Wars era.
connection_notes: Continues from: Original Marvel Years Vol. 4. This volume marks the transition to post-ROTJ storytelling in the original 1977-1986 Marvel continuity, essential for completists of the original run.

title: Star Wars: Darth Vader By Charles Soule Omnibus HC Camuncoli Cover
issues_collected: DARTH VADER (2017) #1-25 and ANNUAL #2
synopsis: Charles Soule chronicles Vader's transformation from broken Anakin to the Empire's supreme enforcer immediately after Revenge of the Sith. Darth Vader (2017) #1-25 depicts his construction of the red lightsaber (bleeding a Jedi's kyber crystal), his castle on Mustafar, and his hunt for Force artifacts. Soule captures Vader at his most vulnerable yet terrifying, exploring how Palpatine molded his shattered apprentice. Annual #2 and Giuseppe Camuncoli's art define this as the definitive Vader origin in Disney canon.
connection_notes: Set between: Revenge of the Sith and Rogue One. Complements: Kieron Gillen's Darth Vader (2015) set after A New Hope. Essential reading for understanding Vader's mindset and the Empire's dark side machinery.

title: Star Wars: Darth Vader By Charles Soule Omnibus HC Deodato Cover

title: Star Wars Legends: Rise Of The Sith Omnibus HC Bachs Cover
issues_collected: STAR WARS: JEDI ? THE DARK SIDE #1-5; STAR WARS: QUI-GON & OBI-WAN ? THE AURORIENT EXPRESS #1-2; STAR WARS: QUI-GON & OBI-WAN ? THE PHANTOM MENACE #1/2 and #1-4; STAR WARS: EPISODE I ? ANAKIN SKYWALKER, QUEEN AMIDALA, QUI-GON JINN and OBI-WAN KENOBI and material from STAR WARS TALES #1, #3, #5, #7, #9-10, #13-14, #20 and #24
synopsis: The prequel era comes to Dark Horse comics in this comprehensive omnibus spanning the events before and during The Phantom Menace. Star Wars: Jedi - The Dark Side #1-5 explores Qui-Gon Jinn's moral conflicts, while the Qui-Gon & Obi-Wan miniseries (#1-2, #1-3) showcase their master-apprentice dynamic. Star Wars (1998) #0-6 and the Darth Maul miniseries #1-4 delve into the Sith's return to power. The Episode I adaptation (#1-4) and character one-shots round out this era, supplemented by key tales from the anthology series. This is Dark Horse's definitive exploration of the Republic's twilight years.
connection_notes: Essential reading for fans of the prequel era and Qui-Gon Jinn. Leads to: Star Wars Legends Epic Collections covering the Clone Wars era. The Jedi Council: Acts of War series connects to broader Republic-era storytelling.

title: Star Wars Legends Epic Collection: Legacy Vol. 4 TPB
issues_collected: STAR WARS: LEGACY (2013) #1-18 and material from STAR WARS TALES #19 and STAR WARS VISIONARIES
synopsis: The concluding volume of Dark Horse's far-future Legacy saga, collecting Star Wars: Legacy (2013) #1-18. Set over 130 years after A New Hope, this series follows Ania Solo's adventures in a galaxy where the Sith have been defeated but new threats emerge. The collection includes supplemental material from Star Wars Tales #19 and Star Wars Visionaries that provide additional context to the Legacy era. This volume wraps up storylines from the second Legacy series, focusing on a new generation of heroes and the One Sith's lingering influence.
connection_notes: Requires: Star Wars Legends Epic Collection: Legacy Vols. 1-3 for full context of the Legacy era and the original Cade Skywalker series. This is the finale of Dark Horse's extended future timeline.

title: Star Wars: Darth Vader By Gillen & Larroca Omnibus HC Alex Ross Cover
issues_collected: DARTH VADER (2015) #1-25 and ANNUAL #1, STAR WARS: VADER DOWN and STAR WARS (2015) #13-14
synopsis: Kieron Gillen and Salvador Larroca's acclaimed run reveals Vader's machinations between A New Hope and The Empire Strikes Back. Issues #1-25 follow Vader's secret quest to build his own power base, introducing the breakout character Doctor Aphra and her homicidal droids. The Vader Down crossover (including Star Wars #13-14) delivers a massive confrontation between Vader and the entire Rebel fleet. Annual #1 explores Vader's twisted relationship with his past. This is the definitive modern take on Darth Vader, exploring his cunning and tragedy with unprecedented depth.
connection_notes: Runs concurrent with Star Wars by Jason Aaron Omnibus. The Vader Down crossover requires both series. Leads to: Star Wars: Doctor Aphra series. Essential for understanding Marvel's post-ANH era.

issues_collected: DARTH VADER (2015) #1-25 and ANNUAL #1, STAR WARS: VADER DOWN and STAR WARS (2015) #13-14

title: Star Wars By Jason Aaron Omnibus HC Brooks Cover
issues_collected: STAR WARS (2015) #1-37, STAR WARS: VADER DOWN, DARTH VADER (2015) #13-15, STAR WARS: THE SCREAMING CITADEL, STAR WARS: DOCTOR APHRA (2016) #7-8 and STAR WARS ANNUAL (2015) #1-3
synopsis: Jason Aaron's complete flagship run launching Marvel's modern Star Wars era, covering issues #1-37 and all crossovers. The series opens immediately after A New Hope, following Luke, Leia, and Han as they strike against the Empire while dealing with Vader's pursuit. Major arcs include the Vader Down crossover and The Screaming Citadel (with Doctor Aphra #7-8), plus three annuals exploring character backstories. Aaron balances classic adventure with new mythology, expanding the gap between Episodes IV and V. This omnibus represents Marvel's fresh take on the original trilogy heroes.
connection_notes: Pairs with Darth Vader by Gillen & Larroca Omnibus—both series interweave heavily through crossovers. Leads to: Kieron Gillen's Star Wars run. The Screaming Citadel requires Doctor Aphra context.

Out of the Wilderness (2011) 1-5, Star Wars: Darth Vader and the Ghost Prison (2012) 1-5
synopsis: Dark Horse's exploration of the Empire's rise during the dark years of the Jedi Purge. Republic #78-80 bridges the Clone Wars to Order 66's aftermath, while the Purge series (#1 and one-shots) showcases Vader hunting surviving Jedi. Dark Times #1-17 and its sequel arcs follow Jedi survivors navigating Imperial occupation. Darth Vader and the Lost Command #1-5 and Ghost Prison #1-5 present two distinct Vader miniseries exploring his early Imperial service. This omnibus captures the galaxy's transformation into totalitarian darkness and the cost of survival under Imperial rule.
connection_notes: Follows: Star Wars Legends Epic Collections covering the Clone Wars. Dark Times is considered one of Dark Horse's finest Star Wars series. Essential for understanding the Jedi Purge beyond Revenge of the Sith.

title: Star Wars Legends: The Empire Omnibus Vol. 1 HC Wilkins Cover
issues_collected: Star Wars: Republic (2002) 78-80, Star Wars: Purge (2005) 1, Star Wars: Purge ? Seconds to Die (2009) 1, Star Wars: Purge ? The Hidden Blade (2010) 1, Star Wars: Purge ? The Tyrant?s Fist (2012) 1-2, Star Wars: Darth Vader and the Lost Command (2011) 1-5, Star Wars: Dark Times (2006) 1-17, Star Wars: Dark Times ? Blue Harvest (2009) 0, Star Wars: Dark Times ? Out of the Wilderness (2011) 1-5, Star Wars: Darth Vader and the Ghost Prison (2012) 1-5
synopsis: Dark Horse's exploration of the Empire's rise during the dark years of the Jedi Purge. Republic #78-80 bridges the Clone Wars to Order 66's aftermath, while the Purge series (#1 and one-shots) showcases Vader hunting surviving Jedi. Dark Times #1-17 and its sequel arcs follow Jedi survivors navigating Imperial occupation. Darth Vader and the Lost Command #1-5 and Ghost Prison #1-5 present two distinct Vader miniseries exploring his early Imperial service. This omnibus captures the galaxy's transformation into totalitarian darkness and the cost of survival under Imperial rule.
connection_notes: Follows: Star Wars Legends Epic Collections covering the Clone Wars. Dark Times is considered one of Dark Horse's finest Star Wars series. Essential for understanding the Jedi Purge beyond Revenge of the Sith.

title: Star Wars By Jason Aaron Omnibus HC Cassaday Cover
issues_collected: STAR WARS (2015) #1-37, STAR WARS: VADER DOWN, DARTH VADER (2015) #13-15, STAR WARS: THE SCREAMING CITADEL, STAR WARS: DOCTOR APHRA (2016) #7-8 and STAR WARS ANNUAL (2015) #1-3
synopsis: Jason Aaron's complete flagship run launching Marvel's modern Star Wars era, covering issues #1-37 and all crossovers. The series opens immediately after A New Hope, following Luke, Leia, and Han as they strike against the Empire while dealing with Vader's pursuit. Major arcs include the Vader Down crossover and The Screaming Citadel (with Doctor Aphra #7-8), plus three annuals exploring character backstories. Aaron balances classic adventure with new mythology, expanding the gap between Episodes IV and V. This omnibus represents Marvel's fresh take on the original trilogy heroes.
connection_notes: Pairs with Darth Vader by Gillen & Larroca Omnibus—both series interweave heavily through crossovers. Leads to: Kieron Gillen's Star Wars run. The Screaming Citadel requires Doctor Aphra context.

title: Star Wars Legends Epic Collection: Tales Of The Jedi Vol. 2 TPB
issues_collected: STAR WARS: TALES OF THE JEDI — THE GOLDEN AGE OF THE SITH #0-5, STAR WARS: TALES OF THE JEDI — THE FALL OF THE SITH EMPIRE #1-5, STAR WARS: TALES OF THE JEDI #1-5 and STAR WARS: TALES OF THE JEDI - THE FREEDON NADD UPRISING #1-2
synopsis: Journey 5,000 years before the Skywalker saga to the ancient Sith Empire. This collection spans three pivotal miniseries: The Golden Age of the Sith #0-5 chronicles the original Sith Lords' dominion, The Fall of the Sith Empire #1-5 depicts their catastrophic defeat, and The Freedon Nadd Uprising #1-2 shows the dark legacy's resurgence on Onderon. Tom Veitch and Kevin J. Anderson craft the mythology that defines Sith history throughout Star Wars lore. Essential worldbuilding for Old Republic era fans.
connection_notes: Continues from: Tales of the Jedi Epic Collection Vol. 1. Leads to: Tales of the Jedi Epic Collection Vol. 3. This era inspired BioWare's Knights of the Old Republic games and establishes Sith mythology referenced throughout Legends continuity.

title: Star Wars Legends Epic Collection: The Clone Wars Vol. 4 TPB
issues_collected: FREE COMIC BOOK DAY 2005: STAR WARS, STAR WARS: DARTH MAUL — SON OF DATHOMIR #1-4, STAR WARS: REPUBLIC #74-77 and #81-83, STAR WARS: EPISODE III — REVENGE OF THE SITH #1-4, STAR WARS: TAG & BINK II #2 and material from STAR WARS VISIONARIES and STAR WARS TALES #4
synopsis: The Clone Wars reach their apocalyptic conclusion. This volume collects the final Republic issues (#74-77, #81-83) depicting Order 66's execution, the official adaptation of Revenge of the Sith #1-4, and the surprising Darth Maul: Son of Dathomir #1-4 based on unproduced Clone Wars TV scripts. Tag & Bink provide comic relief while Star Wars Visionaries offers alternate visions of the saga. A scattershot but historically significant collection bridging the prequel era's end.
connection_notes: Continues from: Clone Wars Epic Collection Vol. 3. Son of Dathomir adapts lost Clone Wars Season 6 episodes and connects to The Clone Wars animated series. The Revenge of the Sith adaptation bridges to The Empire Vol. 1 Epic Collection.

title: Star Wars Legends Epic Collection: The Empire Vol. 7 TPB
issues_collected: STAR WARS: BLOOD TIES #1-4, STAR WARS: BLOOD TIES - BOBA FETT IS DEAD #1-4, STAR WARS: EMPIRE #1-4, STAR WARS: UNDERWORLD - THE YAVIN VASSILIKA #1-5, FREE COMIC BOOK DAY: STAR WARS 2013 and material from STAR WARS TALES #1-2, #6 and #16.
synopsis: A Boba Fett-centric anthology spanning the original trilogy era. The Blood Ties miniseries (#1-4 and Boba Fett is Dead #1-4) by Tom Taylor explores family connections and bounty hunter rivalries. Empire #1-4 offers character vignettes, while Underworld: The Yavin Vassilika #1-5 delivers pulpy heist action with Mike Kennedy's noir-influenced writing. Star Wars Tales shorts round out this collection focused on the galaxy's criminal underworld and the galaxy's most infamous bounty hunter.
connection_notes: Part of the Empire era chronology between A New Hope and Return of the Jedi. Blood Ties stories connect to Legacy era comics. Best read alongside Empire Epic Collection Vol. 1-6 for complete original trilogy era coverage.

title: Star Wars Legends Epic Collection: The New Republic Vol. 6 TPB
issues_collected: STAR WARS: CRIMSON EMPIRE #0-6, STAR WARS BOUNTY HUNTERS - KENIX KIL, STAR WARS: CRIMSON EMPIRE II - COUNCIL OF BLOOD #1-6, STAR WARS: CRIMSON EMPIRE III - EMPIRE LOST #1-6 and material from DARK HORSE EXTRA #21-24 and DARK HORSE PRESENTS (2011) #1.
synopsis: The complete Crimson Empire saga follows Kir Kanos, the last Imperial Royal Guard, through his quest for vengeance after the Emperor's death. Crimson Empire #0-6 by Mike Richardson and Randy Stradley establishes this fan-favorite character, Council of Blood #1-6 expands his mythology, and Empire Lost #1-6 concludes his arc decades later. Paul Gulacy's distinctive art defines this stylish, samurai-influenced corner of the post-Endor galaxy. A self-contained epic about loyalty and honor.
connection_notes: Set during the New Republic era, approximately 11-17 years after Return of the Jedi. Runs parallel to but separate from the main New Republic storylines in X-Wing and Thrawn trilogy adaptations. Kenix Kil one-shot provides additional bounty hunter context.

title: Star Wars Legends Epic Collection: The Rebellion Vol. 5 TPB
issues_collected: STAR WARS: SPLINTER OF THE MIND'S EYE #1-4, STAR WARS: SHADOW STALKER, STAR WARS: REBEL HEIST #1-4, STAR WARS: A VALENTINE STORY, CLASSIC STAR WARS: THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK #1-2, STAR WARS: TAG AND BINK ARE DEAD #2 and material from STAR WARS TALES #4-6, #15-17 and #20.
synopsis: A grab bag of Rebellion era stories spanning the original trilogy timeline. The highlight is Splinter of the Mind's Eye #1-4, adapting Alan Dean Foster's 1978 novel that almost became Star Wars sequel. Rebel Heist #1-4 offers perspectives on the core heroes, while Classic Star Wars: Empire Strikes Back #1-2 adapts Archie Goodwin's newspaper strips. Tag and Bink provide parody, and Star Wars Tales anthology shorts fill gaps. An eclectic but unfocused collection for completists seeking every Rebellion story.
connection_notes: Splinter of the Mind's Eye is a fascinating alternate timeline written before Empire Strikes Back existed. These stories slot into various points between A New Hope and Return of the Jedi. Best for readers who've exhausted mainline Rebellion Epic Collections Vol. 1-4.

title: Star Wars: War Of The Bounty Hunters Omnibus HC Mcniven Cover
issues_collected: STAR WARS: WAR OF THE BOUNTY HUNTERS ALPHA; STAR WARS: WAR OF THE BOUNTY HUNTERS #1-5; STAR WARS: WAR OF THE BOUNTY HUNTERS - JABBA THE HUTT, 4-LOM & ZUCKUSS, BOUSHH and IG-88; STAR WARS (2020) #13-18; STAR WARS: BOUNTY HUNTERS #12-17; STAR WARS: DARTH VADER (2020) #12-17 and STAR WARS: DOCTOR APHRA (2020) #10-15.
synopsis: Marvel's ambitious 2021 crossover event fills the gap between Empire Strikes Back and Return of the Jedi. When Boba Fett loses Han Solo in carbonite to crime lord Lady Qi'ra, all factions converge for a massive power play. The Alpha one-shot and War of the Bounty Hunters #1-5 by Charles Soule anchor this galaxy-spanning saga, while tie-ins from Star Wars, Bounty Hunters, Darth Vader, and Doctor Aphra #12-17 show every angle. Character one-shots spotlight key players in this game-changing story.
connection_notes: Essential reading for Marvel's 2020 Star Wars line. Leads directly to: Crimson Reign and Hidden Empire crossovers. Dramatically impacts ongoing storylines in all four main titles and reintroduces Qi'ra from Solo movie as major villain.

title: Star Wars: War Of The Bounty Hunters Omnibus HC Yu Cover
issues_collected: STAR WARS: WAR OF THE BOUNTY HUNTERS ALPHA; STAR WARS: WAR OF THE BOUNTY HUNTERS #1-5; STAR WARS: WAR OF THE BOUNTY HUNTERS - JABBA THE HUTT, 4-LOM & ZUCKUSS, BOUSHH and IG-88; STAR WARS (2020) #13-18; STAR WARS: BOUNTY HUNTERS #12-17; STAR WARS: DARTH VADER (2020) #12-17 and STAR WARS: DOCTOR APHRA (2020) #10-15.
synopsis: Marvel's ambitious 2021 crossover event fills the gap between Empire Strikes Back and Return of the Jedi. When Boba Fett loses Han Solo in carbonite to crime lord Lady Qi'ra, all factions converge for a massive power play. The Alpha one-shot and War of the Bounty Hunters #1-5 by Charles Soule anchor this galaxy-spanning saga, while tie-ins from Star Wars, Bounty Hunters, Darth Vader, and Doctor Aphra #12-17 show every angle. Character one-shots spotlight key players in this game-changing story.
connection_notes: Essential reading for Marvel's 2020 Star Wars line. Leads directly to: Crimson Reign and Hidden Empire crossovers. Dramatically impacts ongoing storylines in all four main titles and reintroduces Qi'ra from Solo movie as major villain.

title: Star Wars Legends: The New Republic Omnibus Vol. 1 HC Erskine Cover
issues_collected: STAR WARS: MARA JADE — BY THE EMPEROR’S HAND #0-6; STAR WARS: SHADOWS OF THE EMPIRE — EVOLUTION #1-5; STAR WARS: X-WING ROGUE LEADER #1-3; STAR WARS: X-WING ROGUE SQUADRON #1-35 and SPECIAL; STAR WARS HANDBOOK #1; and material from STAR WARS TALES #10, #12, #15 and #23
synopsis: The definitive X-Wing Rogue Squadron collection chronicles Wedge Antilles and his elite pilots through 35 issues plus special by Michael A. Stackpole, Mike Baron, and others. These post-Endor adventures balance military action with character development as the New Republic fights Imperial remnants. Also includes Mara Jade: By the Emperor's Hand #0-6 (Timothy Zahn's fan-favorite character gets her origin), Shadows of the Empire: Evolution #1-5 (Xizor's legacy), and X-Wing Rogue Leader #1-3. The backbone of early Legends New Republic continuity.
connection_notes: Essential New Republic era reading alongside Thrawn trilogy adaptations. Rogue Squadron runs parallel to the X-Wing novels by Stackpole and Aaron Allston. Mara Jade series bridges her appearances in Dark Empire and later New Republic stories. Leads to: New Republic Omnibus Vol. 2.

title: Star Wars Legends: The New Republic Omnibus Vol. 1 HC Lauffray Cover
issues_collected: STAR WARS: MARA JADE — BY THE EMPEROR’S HAND #0-6; STAR WARS: SHADOWS OF THE EMPIRE — EVOLUTION #1-5; STAR WARS: X-WING ROGUE LEADER #1-3; STAR WARS: X-WING ROGUE SQUADRON #1-35 and SPECIAL; STAR WARS HANDBOOK #1; and material from STAR WARS TALES #10, #12, #15 and #23
synopsis: The definitive X-Wing Rogue Squadron collection chronicles Wedge Antilles and his elite pilots through 35 issues plus special by Michael A. Stackpole, Mike Baron, and others. These post-Endor adventures balance military action with character development as the New Republic fights Imperial remnants. Also includes Mara Jade: By the Emperor's Hand #0-6 (Timothy Zahn's fan-favorite character gets her origin), Shadows of the Empire: Evolution #1-5 (Xizor's legacy), and X-Wing Rogue Leader #1-3. The backbone of early Legends New Republic continuity.
connection_notes: Essential New Republic era reading alongside Thrawn trilogy adaptations. Rogue Squadron runs parallel to the X-Wing novels by Stackpole and Aaron Allston. Mara Jade series bridges her appearances in Dark Empire and later New Republic stories. Leads to: New Republic Omnibus Vol. 2.

title: Star Wars: Doctor Aphra Omnibus Vol. 1 HC Reis Cover
issues_collected: STAR WARS: DOCTOR APHRA (2016) #1-40; STAR WARS: DOCTOR APHRA ANNUAL (2017) #1-3; DARTH VADER (2015) #3-4, 8, 21, 25; STAR WARS (2015) #13, 19 31-32; STAR WARS: THE SCREAMING CITADEL (2017) #1; and material from STAR WARS: EMPIRE ASCENDANT (2020) #1
synopsis: The complete saga of archaeology's most morally flexible doctor. Kieron Gillen and Si Spurrier's Doctor Aphra #1-40 follows the rogue archaeologist through deadly adventures, shifting allegiances, and her complicated relationship with Darth Vader. Launched from Vader (2015) #3-4 where she debuted, this omnibus collects her breakout as Marvel's first ongoing Star Wars protagonist, three annuals expanding her universe, and crossovers including The Screaming Citadel #1 team-up with Luke Skywalker. Aphra becomes one of modern Star Wars' most compelling original characters.
connection_notes: Spins out of Darth Vader (2015) Omnibus. Essential crossover chapters included from Star Wars (2015) and Vader series. Leads to: Doctor Aphra Omnibus Vol. 2 and War of the Bounty Hunters crossover. Gillen's run (#1-20) is particularly essential.

title: Star Wars: Doctor Aphra Omnibus Vol. 1 HC Witter Cover
issues_collected: STAR WARS: DOCTOR APHRA (2016) #1-40; STAR WARS: DOCTOR APHRA ANNUAL (2017) #1-3; DARTH VADER (2015) #3-4, 8, 21, 25; STAR WARS (2015) #13, 19 31-32; STAR WARS: THE SCREAMING CITADEL (2017) #1; and material from STAR WARS: EMPIRE ASCENDANT (2020) #1
synopsis: Kieron Gillen's breakout rogue archaeologist gets her own series after stealing the show in Darth Vader. This omnibus collects Doctor Aphra (2016) #1-40 plus key Vader crossovers from issues #3-4, 8, 21, 25, and The Screaming Citadel event (#1, Star Wars #31-32). Aphra navigates betrayal, ancient Jedi artifacts, and her complicated relationship with Vader while assembling her own crew of murderous droids and mercenaries. The complete first volume run establishes Aphra as one of the most morally ambiguous and entertaining characters in modern Star Wars comics.
connection_notes: Leads to: Doctor Aphra Omnibus Vol. 2. Essential reading after Darth Vader (2015) Omnibus. The Screaming Citadel crosses over with Star Wars (2015) #31-32.

title: Star Wars Legends Epic Collection: The Menace Revealed Vol. 3 TPB
issues_collected: STAR WARS (1998) #36-45, STAR WARS: JEDI QUEST #1-4, STAR WARS: JANGO FETT and STAR WARS: ZAM WESELL
synopsis: This collection spans the final years before Attack of the Clones with Star Wars (1998) #36-45, plus prequel-era one-shots focusing on bounty hunters Jango Fett and Zam Wesell, and the Jedi Quest miniseries following young Anakin and Obi-Wan. These stories fill in gaps during the Republic's waning days but lack the narrative cohesion of stronger Legends material. The bounty hunter one-shots provide background for Episode II characters without essential plot developments.
connection_notes: Continues from: The Menace Revealed Vol. 2. Part of the larger prequel-era Legends timeline but not critical to main storylines.

title: Star Wars Legends Epic Collection: The Old Republic Vol. 5 TPB
issues_collected: STAR WARS: KNIGHT ERRANT #1-5, STAR WARS: KNIGHT ERRANT - DELUGE #1-5, STAR WARS: KNIGHT ERRANT - ESCAPE #1-5, STAR WARS: JEDI VS. SITH #1-6 and material from STAR WARS TALES #16
synopsis: Set 1,000 years before the films during the New Sith Wars, this volume follows lone Jedi Kerra Holt through Knight Errant #1-5, Deluge #1-5, and Escape #1-5, plus the ancient Jedi vs. Sith miniseries depicting the origins of the Rule of Two. John Jackson Miller's Knight Errant stories showcase a Republic on the brink, with Kerra fighting Sith warlords in an era of darkness. The Jedi vs. Sith backup explores how Darth Bane reshaped Sith philosophy a millennium before the prequels.
connection_notes: Continues from: The Old Republic Vol. 4. For deep Old Republic era fans; chronologically bridges the gap between ancient Sith empires and the prequel trilogy.

title: Star Wars Legends: The Rebellion Omnibus Vol. 1 HC Benjamin Cover
issues_collected: STAR WARS: EMPIRE #7, #14 and #16-27; STAR WARS: VADER’S QUEST #1-4; STAR WARS (2013) #1-20; STAR WARS KIDS (1997) #1-11, #12 (A STORY) and #13-20 and STAR WARS 3-D #1-3
synopsis: A massive collection of Rebellion-era stories spanning Empire #7, 14, 16-27, Vader's Quest #1-4, Brian Wood's Star Wars (2013) #1-20, plus the all-ages Star Wars Kids series and Star Wars 3-D #1-3. Wood's run focuses on the core heroes between Episodes IV and V, while Empire delivers darker tales from Imperial perspectives. This omnibus provides extensive coverage of the classic trilogy period, though quality varies significantly between the adult-oriented series and all-ages material.
connection_notes: Brian Wood's Star Wars (2013) #1-20 is the highlight, leading to his later Dark Horse work. Empire stories connect to broader Legends timeline between films.

title: Star Wars Legends: The Rebellion Omnibus Vol. 1 HC Fleming Cover
issues_collected: STAR WARS: EMPIRE #7, #14 and #16-27; STAR WARS: VADER’S QUEST #1-4; STAR WARS (2013) #1-20; STAR WARS KIDS (1997) #1-11, #12 (A STORY) and #13-20 and STAR WARS 3-D #1-3
synopsis: A massive collection of Rebellion-era stories spanning Empire #7, 14, 16-27, Vader's Quest #1-4, Brian Wood's Star Wars (2013) #1-20, plus the all-ages Star Wars Kids series and Star Wars 3-D #1-3. Wood's run focuses on the core heroes between Episodes IV and V, while Empire delivers darker tales from Imperial perspectives. This omnibus provides extensive coverage of the classic trilogy period, though quality varies significantly between the adult-oriented series and all-ages material.
connection_notes: Brian Wood's Star Wars (2013) #1-20 is the highlight, leading to his later Dark Horse work. Empire stories connect to broader Legends timeline between films.

title: Star Wars Legends Epic Collection: The Original Marvel Years Vol. 6 TPB
issues_collected: STAR WARS (1977) #89-107 and STAR WARS (2019) #108
synopsis: The final stretch of Marvel's original 1977-1986 Star Wars run, collecting issues #89-107 plus the modern conclusion #108 from 2019. These late-era stories, published well after Return of the Jedi, struggle with diminishing returns as the series wound down. The 2019 issue #108 provides belated closure to plot threads left hanging when the series was cancelled. Primarily for completists wanting to finish Marvel's original Star Wars saga.
connection_notes: Continues from: Original Marvel Years Vol. 5. Concludes Marvel's 1977-1986 run. The 2019 #108 finale offers modern closure to decades-old storylines.

title: Star Wars Legends Epic Collection: Tales Of The Jedi Vol. 3 TPB
issues_collected: STAR WARS: TALES OF THE JEDI - DARK LORDS OF THE SITH #1-6, STAR WARS: TALES OF THE JEDI - THE SITH WAR #1-6, STAR WARS: TALES OF THE JEDI - REDEMPTION #1-5, and material from STAR WARS TALES #23 and DARK HORSE COMICS #7-9
synopsis: The dramatic conclusion of Kevin J. Anderson and Tom Veitch's Tales of the Jedi saga, collecting Dark Lords of the Sith #1-6, The Sith War #1-6, and Redemption #1-5. These stories chronicle Exar Kun and Ulic Qel-Droma's fall to the dark side, the devastating Sith War that nearly destroyed the Republic 4,000 years before the films, and Ulic's ultimate redemption. Essential reading for understanding the Old Republic era that inspired Knights of the Old Republic games.
connection_notes: Continues from: Tales of the Jedi Vol. 2. This trilogy (Dark Lords/Sith War/Redemption) is the strongest Tales of the Jedi material and directly inspired KOTOR lore.

title: Star Wars: Doctor Aphra Omnibus Vol. 2 HC
issues_collected: STAR WARS: DOCTOR APHRA (2020) #1-25
synopsis: Alyssa Wong takes over Doctor Aphra for 25 issues following the 2020 relaunch, collecting the complete second ongoing series. Aphra faces new archaeological mysteries, complex relationships, and the consequences of her past while navigating post-Empire Ascendant galaxy politics. Wong's run explores Aphra's emotional depth and trauma while maintaining the rogue's trademark wit and morally questionable choices. This volume continues Aphra's journey as one of Marvel's most complex Star Wars characters.
connection_notes: Continues from: Doctor Aphra Omnibus Vol. 1. Set after Empire Ascendant crossover. Wong's run takes Aphra in new directions while honoring Gillen's foundation.

title: Star Wars: Doctor Aphra Omnibus Vol. 2 HC Sway Cover
issues_collected: STAR WARS: DOCTOR APHRA (2020) #1-25
synopsis: Alyssa Wong takes over Doctor Aphra for 25 issues following the 2020 relaunch, collecting the complete second ongoing series. Aphra faces new archaeological mysteries, complex relationships, and the consequences of her past while navigating post-Empire Ascendant galaxy politics. Wong's run explores Aphra's emotional depth and trauma while maintaining the rogue's trademark wit and morally questionable choices. This volume continues Aphra's journey as one of Marvel's most complex Star Wars characters.
connection_notes: Continues from: Doctor Aphra Omnibus Vol. 1. Set after Empire Ascendant crossover. Wong's run takes Aphra in new directions while honoring Gillen's foundation.

title: Star Wars: The High Republic Phase I Omnibus HC
issues_collected: STAR WARS: THE HIGH REPUBLIC (2021) #1-15, STAR WARS: THE HIGH REPUBLIC - EYE OF THE STORM #1-2 and STAR WARS: THE HIGH REPUBLIC - TRAIL OF SHADOWS #1-5
synopsis: Marvel's High Republic initiative explores the Jedi Order's golden age 200 years before the prequels. This omnibus collects the main High Republic series #1-15, Eye of the Storm #1-2, and Trail of Shadows #1-5, chronicling the Jedi's battle against the nihilistic Nihil marauders and the mysterious Great Disaster. Cavan Scott's main series and Daniel José Older's Trail of Shadows detective story establish a bold new era distinct from prequel and sequel trilogies, with fresh characters and unexplored galactic threats.
connection_notes: First phase of Marvel's High Republic publishing initiative, coordinated with novels and YA books. Leads to: High Republic Phase II collections. Trail of Shadows provides essential mystery elements.

title: Star Wars: The High Republic Phase I Omnibus HC Anindito Cover
issues_collected: STAR WARS: THE HIGH REPUBLIC (2021) #1-15, STAR WARS: THE HIGH REPUBLIC - EYE OF THE STORM #1-2 and STAR WARS: THE HIGH REPUBLIC - TRAIL OF SHADOWS #1-5
synopsis: Marvel's ambitious expansion into the High Republic era begins with this omnibus collecting Cavan Scott's main series and key miniseries. Star Wars: The High Republic #1-15 follows the Jedi at their golden age peak, two centuries before the Skywalker saga, as they face the mysterious Nihil raiders and the devastating Great Disaster. Eye of the Storm #1-2 delves into Marchion Ro's backstory, while Trail of Shadows #1-5 offers a noir-tinged investigation into the darker corners of this era. This is essential reading for understanding Marvel's Phase I High Republic initiative.
connection_notes: Leads to: High Republic Phase II collections. Runs concurrent with IDW's High Republic Adventures. The multimedia initiative includes novels and comics across publishers, making this the core Marvel perspective on Phase I.

title: Star Wars Legends: The Empire Omnibus Vol. 2
issues_collected: STAR WARS: DARK TIMES - FIRE CARRIER #1-5, STAR WARS: DARK TIMES - A SPARK REMAINS #1-5, STAR WARS: DARTH VADER AND THE NINTH ASSASSIN #1-5, STAR WARS: DARTH VADER AND THE CRY OF SHADOWS #1-5, STAR WARS: DROIDS SPECIAL #1, STAR WARS: DROIDS (1994) #1-6, STAR WARS: DROIDS (1995) #1-8 and STAR WARS: THE PROTOCOL OFFENSIVE - plus material from STAR WARS VISIONARIES; STAR WARS TALES #11-12, #15 and #20; DARK HORSE PRESENTS ANNUAL '99; and STAR WARS GALAXY MAGAZINE #1
synopsis: This sprawling omnibus concludes the Legends Empire era with Dark Times: Fire Carrier #1-5 and A Spark Remains #1-5, following Jedi survivors in the post-Order 66 galaxy. Darth Vader and the Ninth Assassin #1-5 and Cry of Shadows #1-5 explore Vader's brutal early Imperial missions. The collection pivots with the complete 1994-95 Droids runs (#1-6, #1-8) focusing on C-3PO and R2-D2 adventures, plus scattered anthology material from Star Wars Tales and other sources. An eclectic mix of post-Revenge of the Sith darkness and lighthearted droid escapades.
connection_notes: Follows: The Empire Omnibus Vol. 1. The Dark Times material concludes that ongoing series. Droids content stands separately as '90s side stories with minimal continuity requirements.

title: Star Wars Legends: The Empire Omnibus Vol. 2 HC Plunkett Cover
issues_collected: STAR WARS: DARK TIMES - FIRE CARRIER #1-5, STAR WARS: DARK TIMES - A SPARK REMAINS #1-5, STAR WARS: DARTH VADER AND THE NINTH ASSASSIN #1-5, STAR WARS: DARTH VADER AND THE CRY OF SHADOWS #1-5, STAR WARS: DROIDS SPECIAL #1, STAR WARS: DROIDS (1994) #1-6, STAR WARS: DROIDS (1995) #1-8 and STAR WARS: THE PROTOCOL OFFENSIVE - plus material from STAR WARS VISIONARIES; STAR WARS TALES #11-12, #15 and #20; DARK HORSE PRESENTS ANNUAL '99; and STAR WARS GALAXY MAGAZINE #1
synopsis: This sprawling omnibus concludes the Legends Empire era with Dark Times: Fire Carrier #1-5 and A Spark Remains #1-5, following Jedi survivors in the post-Order 66 galaxy. Darth Vader and the Ninth Assassin #1-5 and Cry of Shadows #1-5 explore Vader's brutal early Imperial missions. The collection pivots with the complete 1994-95 Droids runs (#1-6, #1-8) focusing on C-3PO and R2-D2 adventures, plus scattered anthology material from Star Wars Tales and other sources. An eclectic mix of post-Revenge of the Sith darkness and lighthearted droid escapades.
connection_notes: Follows: The Empire Omnibus Vol. 1. The Dark Times material concludes that ongoing series. Droids content stands separately as '90s side stories with minimal continuity requirements.

title: Star Wars Legends Epic Collection: The Empire Vol. 8 TPB
issues_collected: STAR WARS: EMPIRE #5-6, #8-13 and #15; STAR WARS: X-WING ROGUE SQUADRON #1/2; STAR WARS: A NEW HOPE SPECIAL EDITION #1-4; STAR WARS: TAG & BINK ARE DEAD #1; and material from STAR WARS TALES #1, #6, #8-10, #12, #14, #16 and #19
synopsis: A catch-all collection spanning the Original Trilogy era with Empire #5-6, #8-13, #15 focusing on Imperial perspectives and Rebellion conflicts. A New Hope Special Edition #1-4 retells the first film, while X-Wing Rogue Squadron #1/2 spotlights the elite starfighter squadron. Tag & Bink Are Dead #1 offers comedic relief following two bumbling Rebels, and various Star Wars Tales entries provide anthology-style short stories. The episodic nature makes this a grab-bag of Empire-era material rather than a cohesive narrative.
connection_notes: Part of Epic Collection: The Empire series but skips around chronologically. Empire series issues continue the ongoing narrative from earlier volumes. Rogue Squadron material connects to their dedicated Epic Collections.

title: Star Wars Legends Epic Collection: The New Republic Vol. 7 TPB
issues_collected: STAR WARS: BOBA FETT - BOUNTY ON BAR-KOODA, WHEN THE FAT LADY SWINGS, MURDER MOST FOUL and AGENT OF DOOM, STAR WARS: JEDI ACADEMY - LEVIATHAN #1-4, STAR WARS: THE MIXED-UP DROID, STAR WARS: UNION #1-4, STAR WARS: CHEWBACCA #1-4 and material from STAR WARS TALES #19
synopsis: Post-Return of the Jedi stories collected from the late Legends era, headlined by four Boba Fett one-shots (Bounty on Bar-Kooda, When the Fat Lady Swings, Murder Most Foul, Agent of Doom) showcasing the bounty hunter's continued exploits. Jedi Academy: Leviathan #1-4 follows Luke's students facing ancient Sith threats, while Union #1-4 depicts Luke and Mara Jade's wedding ceremony. Chewbacca #1-4 provides a retrospective on the Wookiee's life following his controversial death in the novels. A mixed bag of character spotlights and continuity touchstones.
connection_notes: Part of The New Republic Epic Collection series following the Thrawn Trilogy era. Union requires knowledge of Mara Jade's journey from novels. Chewbacca miniseries serves as a memorial following Vector Prime novel events.

title: Star Wars: Darth Vader - Black, White & Red Treasury Edition
issues_collected: STAR WARS: DARTH VADER - BLACK, WHITE & RED #1-4.
synopsis: An oversized prestige format collection presenting Darth Vader stories in stark black, white, and red artwork from Star Wars: Darth Vader - Black, White & Red #1-4. This anthology showcases different creative teams offering varied interpretations of the Dark Lord in a visually striking limited palette reminiscent of Sin City. The Treasury Edition format emphasizes the dramatic artwork over narrative continuity, making this a showcase for artistic takes on Vader rather than essential story content.
connection_notes: Standalone anthology series requiring no specific reading order. Similar in concept to Marvel's various Black, White & Blood anthology series featuring different characters in monochromatic storytelling.

title: Star Wars Legends Epic Collection: The Menace Revealed Vol. 4 TPB
issues_collected: STAR WARS: THE BOUNTY HUNTERS - AURRA SING, STAR WARS: STARFIGHTER - CROSSBONES #1-3, FREE COMIC BOOK DAY 2002: STAR WARS, STAR WARS: REPUBLIC #46-48, STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES #1-4 and STAR WARS: HASBRO/TOYS 'R' US EXCLUSIVE #1-4 - plus material from DARK HORSE EXTRA #44-47; and STAR WARS TALES #2, #7, #14, #18, #20 and #24
synopsis: Bridging Phantom Menace and Attack of the Clones, this Epic Collection features Aurra Sing's spotlight in The Bounty Hunters, Starfighter: Crossbones #1-3's video game tie-in, and Republic #46-48 following Quinlan Vos during the Clone Wars buildup. Episode II: Attack of the Clones #1-4 adapts the film, while the Hasbro/Toys 'R' Us Exclusives #1-4 offer promotional tie-in material. Free Comic Book Day 2002 and various Star Wars Tales anthology entries round out this prequel-era hodgepodge. Completionists seeking every prequel-era story will appreciate the thoroughness.
connection_notes: Part of The Menace Revealed Epic Collection series spanning Episodes I-II. Republic issues continue the ongoing Quinlan Vos storyline. The film adaptation and promotional materials are redundant for most readers.

title: Star Wars Legends Epic Collection: Rise Of The Sith Vol. 1 TPB
issues_collected: STAR WARS: JEDI — THE DARK SIDE #1-5; STAR WARS: QUI-GON & OBI-WAN — THE AURORIENT EXPRESS #1-2; STAR WARS: QUI-GON & OBI-WAN — LAST STAND ON ORD MANTELL #1-3; STAR WARS: JEDI COUNCIL — ACTS OF WAR #1-4; and material from STAR WARS (1998) #4-6 and STAR WARS TALES #1, #3-5, #7, #9-10, #13-14 and #24
synopsis: Exploring the final years before The Phantom Menace, this collection leads with Jedi: The Dark Side #1-5, revealing Qui-Gon Jinn's traumatic mission that shaped his maverick philosophy. Two Qui-Gon & Obi-Wan miniseries (Aurorient Express #1-2, Last Stand on Ord Mantell #1-3) showcase the master-apprentice dynamic, while Jedi Council: Acts of War #1-4 depicts the Council navigating political intrigue. Star Wars (1998) #4-6 and scattered Tales entries provide additional prequel-era context. Essential for understanding Qui-Gon's characterization before Episode I.
connection_notes: First volume in Rise of the Sith Epic Collection series, leading to Menace Revealed collections. Jedi: The Dark Side is crucial backstory for Qui-Gon's philosophy in The Phantom Menace. Acts of War explores Mace Windu and Council politics.

title: Star Wars Legends Epic Collection: The Empire Vol. 1 TPB
issues_collected: STAR WARS: REPUBLIC #78-80, STAR WARS: PURGE, STAR WARS: PURGE — SECONDS TO DIE, STAR WARS: PURGE — THE HIDDEN BLADE, STAR WARS: PURGE — THE TYRANT’S FIST #1-2, STAR WARS: DARTH VADER AND THE LOST COMMAND #1-5 and STAR WARS: DARK TIMES #1-5
synopsis: Order 66's immediate aftermath dominates this collection, beginning with Republic #78-80's devastating Purge prologue. The Purge one-shot and its sequels (Seconds to Die, The Hidden Blade, The Tyrant's Fist #1-2) chronicle Vader's ruthless Jedi hunts across the galaxy. Darth Vader and the Lost Command #1-5 explores Vader's early Imperial missions and inner conflict, while Dark Times #1-5 launches the series following surviving Jedi navigating the Empire's rise. The darkest era of Star Wars Legends begins here with unrelenting tragedy and survival tales.
connection_notes: First volume in The Empire Epic Collection series, following Revenge of the Sith. Dark Times #1-5 begins the ongoing series continued in later volumes. Sets up the tone for all post-Order 66 Legends material.

title: Star Wars By Gillen & Pak Omnibus HC
issues_collected: STAR WARS (2015) #38-75, STAR WARS ANNUAL (2016) #4 and STAR WARS: EMPIRE ASCENDANT
synopsis: Kieron Gillen and Greg Pak's definitive run on Marvel's flagship Star Wars title, collecting issues #38-75 spanning the Empire Strikes Back to Return of the Jedi era. This omnibus chronicles the Rebellion's darkest hour following Hoth, featuring the "Ashes of Jedha" arc, Leia's leadership challenges, and the buildup to Endor. Annual #4 and Empire Ascendant provide essential connective tissue between storylines. Gillen and Pak masterfully balance action, character development, and continuity integration, making this the essential bridge between Episodes V and VI in Marvel canon.
connection_notes: Follows: Star Wars by Aaron Omnibus. Runs concurrent with Darth Vader (2017) series and various miniseries. Leads directly into Return of the Jedi events and post-Endor comics. Essential for understanding Marvel's Original Trilogy era.

title: Star Wars By Gillen & Pak Omnibus HC Marquez Cover
issues_collected: STAR WARS (2015) #38-75, STAR WARS ANNUAL (2016) #4 and STAR WARS: EMPIRE ASCENDANT
synopsis: Kieron Gillen and Greg Pak's acclaimed run (Star Wars #38-75) explores the Rebellion's darkest hours between The Empire Strikes Back and Return of the Jedi. The collection chronicles high-stakes missions, character-defining moments for Luke, Leia, and Han, and introduces memorable new corners of the galaxy far, far away. Annual #4 and Empire Ascendant provide essential connective tissue. This extended saga showcases why Marvel's 2015 Star Wars relaunch became a phenomenon, balancing blockbuster action with intimate character work.
connection_notes: Follows: Star Wars by Aaron Omnibus. This run bridges the original trilogy's final act with depth and ambition rarely seen in Star Wars comics. Essential for fans of the Rebellion era.

title: Star Wars Legends: The Rebellion Omnibus Vol. 2 HC
issues_collected: STAR WARS: RIVER OF CHAOS #1-4, STAR WARS: EMPIRE #28-40, STAR WARS: REBELLION #1-16, STAR WARS: BOBA FETT — OVERKILL, STAR WARS: BOBA FETT #1/2 and STAR WARS: SPLINTER OF THE MIND’S EYE #1-4 — plus material from STAR WARS: KNIGHTS OF THE OLD REPUBLIC/REBELLION #0; and STAR WARS TALES #3, #15, #17 and #21
synopsis: This sprawling omnibus collects Dark Horse's best Rebellion-era stories from the Legends timeline. Star Wars: Empire #28-40 and Rebellion #1-16 form the backbone, delivering gritty ground-level tales of the Galactic Civil War. River of Chaos #1-4 explores pre-A New Hope intrigue, while Splinter of the Mind's Eye #1-4 adapts Alan Dean Foster's influential 1978 novel. Boba Fett spotlights and Tales anthology selections round out this comprehensive look at the war against the Empire from multiple perspectives.
connection_notes: Leads to: Legends: The Rebellion Omnibus Vol. 3 (if it exists). Essential for understanding Dark Horse's decade-spanning vision of the Original Trilogy era. The Empire/Rebellion series are highlights of Legends continuity.

title: Star Wars Legends: The Rebellion Omnibus Vol. 2 HC Corroney Cover
issues_collected: STAR WARS: RIVER OF CHAOS #1-4, STAR WARS: EMPIRE #28-40, STAR WARS: REBELLION #1-16, STAR WARS: BOBA FETT — OVERKILL, STAR WARS: BOBA FETT #1/2 and STAR WARS: SPLINTER OF THE MIND’S EYE #1-4 — plus material from STAR WARS: KNIGHTS OF THE OLD REPUBLIC/REBELLION #0; and STAR WARS TALES #3, #15, #17 and #21
synopsis: This sprawling omnibus collects Dark Horse's best Rebellion-era stories from the Legends timeline. Star Wars: Empire #28-40 and Rebellion #1-16 form the backbone, delivering gritty ground-level tales of the Galactic Civil War. River of Chaos #1-4 explores pre-A New Hope intrigue, while Splinter of the Mind's Eye #1-4 adapts Alan Dean Foster's influential 1978 novel. Boba Fett spotlights and Tales anthology selections round out this comprehensive look at the war against the Empire from multiple perspectives.
connection_notes: Leads to: Legends: The Rebellion Omnibus Vol. 3 (if it exists). Essential for understanding Dark Horse's decade-spanning vision of the Original Trilogy era. The Empire/Rebellion series are highlights of Legends continuity.

title: Star Wars Legends Epic Collection: The Old Republic Vol. 1 TPB
issues_collected: STAR WARS: KNIGHTS OF THE OLD REPUBLIC #1-18 and material from STAR WARS: KNIGHTS OF THE OLD REPUBLIC/REBELLION #0
synopsis: John Jackson Miller's Knights of the Old Republic #1-18 launches one of Star Wars comics' most beloved runs, set thousands of years before the films. The series follows Zayne Carrick, a hapless Padawan framed for murdering his fellow students, as he evades Jedi Masters consumed by dark prophecy. Miller crafts a compelling murder mystery that expands into epic scope while maintaining focus on character. This trade paperback offers an accessible entry point to the acclaimed KOTOR comic universe.
connection_notes: Leads to: Knights of the Old Republic Epic Collection Vol. 2. Connects to the beloved KOTOR video games but tells its own story. Miller's full 50-issue run is highly regarded in Legends continuity.

title: Star Wars Legends: The New Republic Omnibus Vol. 2 HC
issues_collected: STAR WARS: THE JABBA TAPE; STAR WARS: HEIR TO THE EMPIRE #1-6; STAR WARS: DARK FORCE RISING #1-6; STAR WARS: THE LAST COMMAND #1-6; STAR WARS: DARK EMPIRE #1-6; STAR WARS: DARK EMPIRE II #1-6; STAR WARS: EMPIRE’S END #1-2; STAR WARS: BOBA FETT – TWIN ENGINES OF DESTRUCTION, BOUNTY ON BAR-KOODA, WHEN THE FAT LADY SWINGS, MURDER MOST FOUL and AGENT OF DOOM; STAR WARS HANDBOOK #3; and material from STAR WARS TALES #1, #3-5, #10, #14, #20 and #22
synopsis: The crown jewel of Legends continuity collected in one massive volume. Timothy Zahn's Heir to the Empire trilogy (#1-18 combined) resurrected Star Wars in 1991 and introduced Grand Admiral Thrawn, still one of the franchise's greatest villains. Tom Veitch's Dark Empire saga (#1-6, II #1-6, Empire's End #1-2) controversially brought back the Emperor but delivered stunning painted artwork. Multiple Boba Fett one-shots showcase the galaxy's most famous bounty hunter at his prime. This omnibus represents the foundation of the post-Return of the Jedi Expanded Universe.
connection_notes: Follows: The New Republic Omnibus Vol. 1. These stories defined Star Wars for a generation before the prequels. Thrawn's introduction here made him canon-worthy for Disney's revival.

title: Star Wars Legends: The New Republic Omnibus Vol. 2 HC Dorman Villains Cover
issues_collected: STAR WARS: THE JABBA TAPE; STAR WARS: HEIR TO THE EMPIRE #1-6; STAR WARS: DARK FORCE RISING #1-6; STAR WARS: THE LAST COMMAND #1-6; STAR WARS: DARK EMPIRE #1-6; STAR WARS: DARK EMPIRE II #1-6; STAR WARS: EMPIRE’S END #1-2; STAR WARS: BOBA FETT – TWIN ENGINES OF DESTRUCTION, BOUNTY ON BAR-KOODA, WHEN THE FAT LADY SWINGS, MURDER MOST FOUL and AGENT OF DOOM; STAR WARS HANDBOOK #3; and material from STAR WARS TALES #1, #3-5, #10, #14, #20 and #22
synopsis: The crown jewel of Legends continuity collected in one massive volume. Timothy Zahn's Heir to the Empire trilogy (#1-18 combined) resurrected Star Wars in 1991 and introduced Grand Admiral Thrawn, still one of the franchise's greatest villains. Tom Veitch's Dark Empire saga (#1-6, II #1-6, Empire's End #1-2) controversially brought back the Emperor but delivered stunning painted artwork. Multiple Boba Fett one-shots showcase the galaxy's most famous bounty hunter at his prime. This omnibus represents the foundation of the post-Return of the Jedi Expanded Universe.
connection_notes: Follows: The New Republic Omnibus Vol. 1. These stories defined Star Wars for a generation before the prequels. Thrawn's introduction here made him canon-worthy for Disney's revival.

title: Star Wars Legends: The Thrawn Trilogy TPB
issues_collected: STAR WARS: HEIR TO THE EMPIRE #1-6, STAR WARS: DARK FORCE RISING #1-6 and STAR WARS: THE LAST COMMAND #1-6
synopsis: Mike Baron and Olivier Vatine adapt Timothy Zahn's legendary novel trilogy that revitalized Star Wars in the early 1990s. Heir to the Empire #1-6, Dark Force Rising #1-6, and The Last Command #1-6 chronicle Grand Admiral Thrawn's brilliant campaign against the New Republic, Luke's discovery of Jedi Master C'baoth, and the introduction of Mara Jade. While the original novels remain definitive, these comic adaptations offer a streamlined visual experience of the Thrawn saga's essential beats.
connection_notes: Collected more comprehensively in The New Republic Omnibus Vol. 2. Best for readers who want just the Thrawn trilogy without Dark Empire and other material. The novels tell this story more completely.

title: Star Wars Legends: Tales Of The Jedi Omnibus HC
issues_collected: STAR WARS: DAWN OF THE JEDI - FORCE STORM (2012) #1-5, STAR WARS: DAWN OF THE JEDI - PRISONER OF BOGAN (2012) #1-5, STAR WARS: DAWN OF THE JEDI - FORCE WAR (2013) #1-5, STAR WARS: DAWN OF THE JEDI (2012) #0, STAR WARS: TALES OF THE JEDI - THE GOLDEN AGE OF THE SITH (1996) #0-5, STAR WARS: TALES OF THE JEDI - THE FALL OF THE SITH EMPIRE (1997) #1-5, STAR WARS: TALES OF THE JEDI (1993) #1-5, STAR WARS: TALES OF THE JEDI - THE FREEDON NADD UPRISING (1994) #1-2, STAR WARS: TALES OF THE JEDI - DARK LORDS OF THE SITH (1994) #1-6, STAR WARS: TALES OF THE JEDI - THE SITH WAR (1995) #1-6, STAR WARS: TALES OF THE JEDI - REDEMPTION (1998) #1-5, and material from STAR WARS TALES (1999) #23, DARK HORSE COMICS (1992) #7-9
synopsis: The complete ancient Jedi history from Dark Horse's Legends era, spanning 36,000 years of galactic history. John Ostrander and Jan Duursema's Dawn of the Jedi (Force Storm, Prisoner of Bogan, Force War) explores the Force's discovery on Tython. Tom Veitch and Kevin J. Anderson's Tales of the Jedi saga (Golden Age through Redemption) chronicles the Great Sith War and introduces Exar Kun, Ulic Qel-Droma, and Nomi Sunrider. These mythic stories established the Jedi/Sith conflict's ancient foundations and influenced The Old Republic era across all media.
connection_notes: Connects to: Knights of the Old Republic Epic Collections (set centuries later). Essential reading for understanding the deep lore of Jedi and Sith history that influenced prequel-era storytelling.

title: Star Wars Legends: Tales Of The Jedi Omnibus HC Dorman Cover
issues_collected: STAR WARS: DAWN OF THE JEDI - FORCE STORM #1-5, STAR WARS: DAWN OF THE JEDI - PRISONER OF BOGAN #1-5, STAR WARS: DAWN OF THE JEDI - FORCE WAR #1-5, STAR WARS: DAWN OF THE JEDI #0, STAR WARS: TALES OF THE JEDI - THE GOLDEN AGE OF THE SITH #0-5, STAR WARS: TALES OF THE JEDI - THE FALL OF THE SITH EMPIRE #1-5, STAR WARS: TALES OF THE JEDI #1-5, STAR WARS: TALES OF THE JEDI - THE FREEDON NADD UPRISING #1-2, STAR WARS: TALES OF THE JEDI - DARK LORDS OF THE SITH #1-6, STAR WARS: TALES OF THE JEDI - THE SITH WAR #1-6, STAR WARS: TALES OF THE JEDI - REDEMPTION #1-5, and material from STAR WARS TALES #23 and DARK HORSE COMICS #7-9
synopsis: The complete ancient Jedi history from Dark Horse's Legends era, spanning 36,000 years of galactic history. John Ostrander and Jan Duursema's Dawn of the Jedi (Force Storm, Prisoner of Bogan, Force War) explores the Force's discovery on Tython. Tom Veitch and Kevin J. Anderson's Tales of the Jedi saga (Golden Age through Redemption) chronicles the Great Sith War and introduces Exar Kun, Ulic Qel-Droma, and Nomi Sunrider. These mythic stories established the Jedi/Sith conflict's ancient foundations and influenced The Old Republic era across all media.
connection_notes: Connects to: Knights of the Old Republic Epic Collections (set centuries later). Essential reading for understanding the deep lore of Jedi and Sith history that influenced prequel-era storytelling.

title: Star Wars Modern Era Epic Collection: Star Wars Vol. 1 TPB
issues_collected: STAR WARS (2015) #1-14 and #1 DIRECTOR'S CUT; STAR WARS: VADER DOWN (2015) #1 and DARTH VADER (2015) #13-15
synopsis: Jason Aaron launches Marvel's new Star Wars canon with Star Wars #1-14, set immediately after A New Hope. The series delivers blockbuster moments like Luke infiltrating an Imperial weapons factory and Han's encounters with his past. The Vader Down crossover event (#1, Darth Vader #13-15) brings the Rebellion's heroes face-to-face with the Dark Lord in a desperate battle. This trade paperback offers an accessible starting point for Marvel's modern Star Wars universe, though the material is collected more completely in the Aaron omnibus.
connection_notes: Leads to: Star Wars Modern Era Epic Collection Vol. 2. Collected more comprehensively in Star Wars by Aaron Omnibus. Best for readers wanting an affordable taste of Marvel's 2015 relaunch.

title: Star Wars Legends Epic Collection: The Rebellion Vol. 6
issues_collected: Star Wars: Shadows of the Empire (1996) #1-6; Star Wars: The Bounty Hunters - Scoundrel's Wages (1999) #1; Classic Star Wars: Return of the Jedi (1994) #1-2; Star Wars: Tales from Mos Eisley (1996) #1; Star Wars: Tag & Bink II (2006) #1; Sergio Aragones Stomps Star Wars (2000) #1; and Star Wars: Shadows of the Empire Minicomic (1996) #1-2 - plus material from Star Wars Kids (1997) #12; Star Wars Visionaries (2005); and Star Wars Tales (1999) #2, #4-8, #10, #12, #14 and #20
synopsis: A sprawling anthology spanning the entire Original Trilogy era, anchored by the multimedia Shadows of the Empire event (#1-6) that bridges Empire Strikes Back and Return of the Jedi with Prince Xizor's criminal empire storyline. This volume is a grab bag of shorter tales including Classic Return of the Jedi #1-2 adapting the film, bounty hunter adventures, Mos Eisley cantina stories, and the comedic Tag & Bink series. The Star Wars Tales material offers standalone vignettes of varying quality and canonicity, making this more of a curiosity collection than essential reading.
connection_notes: Shadows of the Empire connects to other SOTE multimedia (novel, game, comics). Tag & Bink parodies the film trilogy. Most Tales stories are non-canon "Infinities" material.

title: Star Wars Legends Epic Collection: The New Republic Vol. 8
issues_collected: Star Wars: Invasion #0-5, Star Wars: Invasion - Rescues #1-6, Star Wars: Invasion - Revelations #1-5, Star Wars Handbook #2: Crimson Empire; and material from Star Wars Tales #18-19 and #21
synopsis: Chronicles the Yuuzhan Vong invasion storyline through the Invasion series (#0-5, Rescues #1-6, Revelations #1-5), set 25 years after A New Hope as extragalactic invaders wage war on the New Republic. The series focuses on the plight of refugees and soldiers during this brutal conflict that reshaped the post-Jedi galaxy. Also includes the Crimson Empire Handbook and Tales #18-19, #21 for additional New Republic era context. This represents the tail end of the expansive New Jedi Order era in comics form.
connection_notes: Part of the larger New Jedi Order multimedia event. Leads from: New Republic Vol. 7. Essential for fans of the post-ROTJ Legends timeline.

title: Star Wars Legends Epic Collection: The Original Marvel Years - Droids & Ewoks
issues_collected: Ewoks #1-14; Droids #1-8; and Ewoks UK Annual 1989
synopsis: Collects the complete Marvel/Star Comics runs of Ewoks (#1-14) and Droids (#1-8), tie-in series to the mid-1980s animated shows aimed at younger readers. The Ewoks series follows Wicket and friends on Endor adventures, while Droids chronicles C-3PO and R2-D2's pre-A New Hope escapades with various masters. These all-ages stories are charming period pieces but non-essential to the larger Star Wars narrative, plus the UK Annual 1989 for completists.
connection_notes: Standalone adventures tied to the animated series. For fans of vintage Star Wars kids' content or Ewok enthusiasts only.

title: Star Wars: The High Republic Phase II - Quest Of The Jedi Omnibus
issues_collected: Star Wars: The High Republic (2022) #1-10 and Star Wars: The High Republic - The Blade #1-4
synopsis: Phase II of The High Republic era shifts 150 years before The Phantom Menace to the "Quest of the Jedi" storyline. Star Wars: The High Republic (2022) #1-10 follows Jedi Knights investigating mysterious Path of the Open Hand cultists and ancient Force artifacts, while The Blade #1-4 spotlights Porter Engle, the legendary "Blade of Bardotta." This phase explores the High Republic at an earlier, more idealistic period before the Nihil threat, deepening the lore of this publishing initiative set centuries before the Skywalker Saga.
connection_notes: Continues from High Republic Phase I collections. Coordinates with Phase II novels and other comics. Essential for High Republic completionists.

title: Star Wars: The High Republic Phase II - Quest Of The Jedi Omnibus Marc Laming Cover
issues_collected: Star Wars: The High Republic (2022) #1-10 and Star Wars: The High Republic - The Blade #1-4
synopsis: Phase II of The High Republic era shifts 150 years before The Phantom Menace to the "Quest of the Jedi" storyline. Star Wars: The High Republic (2022) #1-10 follows Jedi Knights investigating mysterious Path of the Open Hand cultists and ancient Force artifacts, while The Blade #1-4 spotlights Porter Engle, the legendary "Blade of Bardotta." This phase explores the High Republic at an earlier, more idealistic period before the Nihil threat, deepening the lore of this publishing initiative set centuries before the Skywalker Saga.
connection_notes: Continues from High Republic Phase I collections. Coordinates with Phase II novels and other comics. Essential for High Republic completionists.

title: Star Wars: The High Republic Phase III Vol. 2 - The Hunted
issues_collected: Star Wars: The High Republic (2023) #6-10 [Phase III] and Star Wars: The Acolyte - Kelnacca #1
synopsis: Phase III shifts to "The High Republic: Trials of the Jedi" era. Star Wars: The High Republic (2023) #6-10 follows Jedi as they face a new threat and the consequences of earlier conflicts, with characters on the run and relationships tested. Also includes Star Wars: The Acolyte - Kelnacca #1, a tie-in to the Disney+ series spotlighting the Wookiee Jedi. This volume represents the darker turn of the High Republic initiative as the golden age begins to fracture.
connection_notes: Leads from: High Republic Phase III Vol. 1. Coordinates with The Acolyte streaming series. For invested High Republic followers tracking the full multimedia narrative.

title: Star Wars: Darth Vader Modern Era Epic Collection: Shadows And Secrets
issues_collected: Darth Vader (2015) #1-12, #1 Directors Cut, and Annual #1
synopsis: Kieron Gillen and Salvador Larroca's acclaimed Darth Vader run (#1-12, Annual #1) begins immediately after A New Hope with the Dark Lord in disgrace after the Death Star's destruction. Vader embarks on secret missions to prove his worth to the Emperor, encounters rogue archaeologist Doctor Aphra and her murderous droids, and uncovers the truth about Luke Skywalker's identity. This series brilliantly explores Vader's psychology and expands the period between Episodes IV and V with crucial character development that enhances the films.
connection_notes: Runs concurrent with Star Wars (2015) series, with multiple crossovers. Leads to: Darth Vader Epic Collection Vol. 2. Doctor Aphra spins off into her own series.

title: Star Wars Vol. 9: The Path Of Light
issues_collected: Star Wars (2020) #46-50
synopsis: Star Wars (2020) #46-50 concludes the series' run following the Battle of Hoth with Luke, Leia, and the Rebels navigating threats between Empire and Return of the Jedi. The "Path of Light" storyline deals with the aftermath of recent battles and sets up character positions heading toward the final film. This arc wraps up plot threads from the 2020 relaunch but represents the tail end of Marvel's second modern Star Wars era rather than essential reading.
connection_notes: Concludes the Star Wars (2020) run. Leads from: earlier volumes of the 2020 series. Bridges to Return of the Jedi era stories.

title: Star Wars Legends Epic Collection: The Empire Vol. 2
issues_collected: Star Wars: Dark Times #6-17; Star Wars: Dark Times - Blue Harvest #0; and Star Wars: Dark Times - Out of the Wilderness
synopsis: Randy Stradley and Douglas Wheatley continue their gritty Dark Times series (#6-17, Blue Harvest #0, Out of the Wilderness) following Jedi survivor Dass Jennir in the brutal aftermath of Order 66. These issues depict the early Empire's iron grip tightening across the galaxy as Jennir struggles with his identity as a hunted Jedi, encounters other survivors, and witnesses the moral compromises required to survive the dark times. The series stands as one of the best explorations of the rarely-covered period between Episodes III and IV.
connection_notes: Continues from: Empire Epic Collection Vol. 1. Essential for fans of the post-Order 66 era and morally complex Jedi stories. Connects to the larger Dark Times saga.

title: Star Wars: Darth Vader - Black, White & Red
issues_collected: Star Wars: Darth Vader - Black, White & Red #1-4
synopsis: An anthology miniseries (#1-4) presenting Darth Vader stories in stark black, white, and red artwork by various creative teams. Each issue offers standalone tales exploring different facets of the Dark Lord's character, from his ruthless efficiency to moments of twisted reflection. The limited color palette creates striking visual storytelling but this is an experimental art project rather than essential continuity, aimed at fans who enjoy stylized reinterpretations of the iconic villain.
connection_notes: Standalone anthology with no direct continuity connections. Similar in concept to other Marvel Black, White & Blood series. For Vader fans seeking artistic interpretations.

title: Star Wars: Darth Vader By Greg Pak Vol. 10 - Phantoms
issues_collected: Star Wars: Darth Vader (2020) #46-50 and Free Comic Book Day 2024: Star Wars #1 (Darth Vader story)
synopsis: Greg Pak's final arc on Darth Vader (#46-50) sees the Dark Lord confronting Force phantoms and psychological trauma from his past as Anakin Skywalker. The collection includes the FCBD 2024 story bridging into the next era. Pak wraps up themes of identity and haunting that defined his run, delivering character-driven horror within the Empire's machinery. While well-executed, this functions primarily as closure to Pak's specific narrative threads rather than essential Vader mythology.
connection_notes: Follows: Darth Vader by Greg Pak Vol. 9. Pak's run explores Vader's internal conflicts during the original trilogy era. The FCBD story may preview upcoming Vader directions.

title: Star Wars Legends: The Empire Omnibus Vol. 3
issues_collected: Star Wars: Jabba The Hutt - The Gaar Suppoon Hit (1995) #1; Star Wars: Jabba The Hutt - The Hunger of Princess Nampi (1995) #1; Star Wars: Jabba The Hutt - The Dynasty Trap (1995) #1; Star Wars: Jabba The Hutt - Betrayal (1996) #1; Free Comic Book Day 2012: Star Wars; Star Wars: Boba Fett - Enemy of the Empire (1999) #1-4; Star Wars: Agent of the Empire - Iron Eclipse (2011) #1-5; Star Wars: Agent of the Empire - Hard Targets (2012) #1-5; Star Wars: The Force Unleashed (2008); Star Wars: The Force Unleashed II (2010); Star Wars: Blood Ties (2010) #1-4; Star Wars: Blood Ties - Boba Fett Is Dead (2012) #1-4; Star Wars: Empire (2002) #1-4; and material from Star Wars Tales (1999) #7, #11, #15-16, and #18-20 and A Decade of Dark Horse (1996) #2
synopsis: Dark Horse's deep cut into Imperial operations during the Empire era, spanning from the Jabba the Hutt one-shots exploring underworld politics to the Agent of the Empire spy thrillers featuring Imperial Intelligence operative Jahan Cross. The Force Unleashed adaptations chronicle Starkiller's role in the Rebellion's formation, while Blood Ties explores Boba Fett's family legacy. Empire #1-4 launches the acclaimed series examining Imperial perspectives. This omnibus showcases non-Jedi Imperial narratives often overlooked in favor of Rebellion stories.
connection_notes: Part of Dark Horse's Legends continuity. The Empire series continues in future volumes. Agent of the Empire offers rare Imperial protagonist stories. For fans exploring the galaxy beyond Skywalker saga principals.

title: Star Wars Legends: The Empire Omnibus Vol. 3 Chris Scalf Cover
issues_collected: Star Wars: Jabba The Hutt - The Gaar Suppoon Hit (1995) #1; Star Wars: Jabba The Hutt - The Hunger of Princess Nampi (1995) #1; Star Wars: Jabba The Hutt - The Dynasty Trap (1995) #1; Star Wars: Jabba The Hutt - Betrayal (1996) #1; Free Comic Book Day 2012: Star Wars; Star Wars: Boba Fett - Enemy of the Empire (1999) #1-4; Star Wars: Agent of the Empire - Iron Eclipse (2011) #1-5; Star Wars: Agent of the Empire - Hard Targets (2012) #1-5; Star Wars: The Force Unleashed (2008); Star Wars: The Force Unleashed II (2010); Star Wars: Blood Ties (2010) #1-4; Star Wars: Blood Ties - Boba Fett Is Dead (2012) #1-4; Star Wars: Empire (2002) #1-4; and material from Star Wars Tales (1999) #7, #11, #15-16, and #18-20 and A Decade of Dark Horse (1996) #2

title: Star Wars: Jango Fett - Trail Of Lost Hope
issues_collected: Star Wars: Jango Fett #1-4 and Star Wars: Revelations #1 (E story)
synopsis: This miniseries (#1-4) explores Jango Fett's bounty hunting career before Attack of the Clones, following a mission that tests his moral boundaries and establishes his reputation as the galaxy's premier hunter. Writer Ethan Sacks delves into what made Jango the template for the Clone Army, though the story remains a self-contained adventure. The included Revelations story provides additional context. Solid character work for Fett completists, but not essential to understanding the larger mythos.
connection_notes: Prequel-era story set before Attack of the Clones. For readers interested in Fett family history, pairs with Boba Fett stories. Standalone adventure that doesn't significantly impact wider continuity.

title: Star Wars Legends: The Old Republic Omnibus Vol. 1 Dustin Weaver Cover
issues_collected: Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic #1-50, Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic – War #1-5; Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic Handbook; and material from Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic / Rebellion #0
synopsis: John Jackson Miller's complete Knights of the Old Republic saga (#1-50 plus War #1-5) stands as Dark Horse's finest achievement in Star Wars comics. Set 4,000 years before the films, the series follows Padawan Zayne Carrick, framed for murdering his fellow students, as he uncovers a conspiracy threatening the Republic during the Mandalorian Wars. Miller crafts a sprawling epic featuring Mandalore, young Revan references, and the Jedi Covenant's dark prophecies. This is essential Old Republic storytelling that inspired the beloved video games' expanded universe.
connection_notes: Connects to: Knights of the Old Republic video game continuity and The Old Republic MMO era. The War miniseries provides essential closure. Leads into other Old Republic Era collections.

title: Star Wars Legends: The Old Republic Omnibus Vol. 1
issues_collected: Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic #1-50, Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic – War #1-5; Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic Handbook; and material from Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic / Rebellion #0
synopsis: John Jackson Miller's complete Knights of the Old Republic saga (#1-50 plus War #1-5) stands as Dark Horse's finest achievement in Star Wars comics. Set 4,000 years before the films, the series follows Padawan Zayne Carrick, framed for murdering his fellow students, as he uncovers a conspiracy threatening the Republic during the Mandalorian Wars. Miller crafts a sprawling epic featuring Mandalore, young Revan references, and the Jedi Covenant's dark prophecies. This is essential Old Republic storytelling that inspired the beloved video games' expanded universe.
connection_notes: Connects to: Knights of the Old Republic video game continuity and The Old Republic MMO era. The War miniseries provides essential closure. Leads into other Old Republic Era collections.

title: Star Wars: Inquisitors
issues_collected: Star Wars: Inquisitors #1-4
synopsis: Rodney Barnes' miniseries (#1-4) explores the origins and missions of several Imperial Inquisitors hunting surviving Jedi after Order 66. The series examines how the Inquisitorius operates and the twisted psychology of fallen Jedi serving Vader's purge. While it adds texture to the dark times between trilogies and fleshes out characters from Rebels and other media, this remains a side story rather than required reading. Fans of Inquisitor lore from the TV shows will appreciate the expanded context.
connection_notes: Set during the Dark Times between Revenge of the Sith and A New Hope. Connects to: Darth Vader comics and Rebels/Obi-Wan Kenobi TV series. Adds depth to Inquisitor characters but not essential to main narratives.

title: Star Wars: Crimson Reign Omnibus
issues_collected: Star Wars: Crimson Reign #1-5; Star Wars (2020) #19-25; Star Wars: Bounty Hunters #18-24; Star Wars: Darth Vader (2020) #18-24; and Star Wars: Doctor Aphra (2020) #16-21
synopsis: Charles Soule's ambitious crossover event centered on Qi'ra's Crimson Dawn syndicate challenging both Empire and Rebellion. The core Crimson Reign miniseries (#1-5) orchestrates a galaxy-wide conspiracy while the included Star Wars (#19-25), Bounty Hunters (#18-24), Darth Vader (#18-24), and Doctor Aphra (#16-21) issues show how the plot impacts each title's heroes. This sprawling omnibus captures a pivotal moment in the High Republic/Original Trilogy bridge era, with Qi'ra emerging as a major power player and ancient Sith artifacts surfacing.
connection_notes: Follows: War of the Bounty Hunters. Middle chapter of Soule's Crimson Dawn trilogy. Essential for understanding Qi'ra's post-Solo evolution and the lead-up to Hidden Empire.

title: Star Wars: Crimson Reign Omnibus Rod Reis Cover
issues_collected: Star Wars: Crimson Reign #1-5; Star Wars (2020) #19-25; Star Wars: Bounty Hunters #18-24; Star Wars: Darth Vader (2020) #18-24; and Star Wars: Doctor Aphra (2020) #16-21
synopsis: Charles Soule's ambitious crossover event centered on Qi'ra's Crimson Dawn syndicate challenging both Empire and Rebellion. connection_notes: Follows: War of the Bounty Hunters. Middle chapter of Soule's Crimson Dawn trilogy. Essential for understanding Qi'ra's post-Solo evolution and the lead-up to Hidden Empire.

title: Star Wars: Ahsoka - Season One
issues_collected: Star Wars: Ahsoka (2024) #1-8
synopsis: Official comic adaptation of the Disney+ Ahsoka television series (#1-8), translating Rosario Dawson's live-action adventures into sequential art. The series covers Ahsoka Tano's search for Ezra Bridger and Grand Admiral Thrawn in the New Republic era, reuniting her with Sabine Wren and introducing new threats. While competently executed, this functions primarily for readers who want the TV story in comic format rather than offering new canonical material. The adaptation format limits its necessity for most collectors.
connection_notes: Set after Return of the Jedi in the New Republic era. Follows: Star Wars Rebels animated series and The Mandalorian Season 2. Readers may prefer the original TV series.

title: Star Wars: Darth Maul - Black, White & Red Treasury Edition
issues_collected: Star Wars: Darth Maul – Black, White & Red (2024) #1-4
synopsis: This prestige treasury edition collects Star Wars: Darth Maul – Black, White & Red #1-4, an anthology series presenting short tales of the Sith apprentice rendered in striking monochrome with red highlights. The format showcases various creative teams exploring Maul's brutal efficiency and dark side philosophy through standalone vignettes. Like Marvel's other Black, White & Red anthologies, this is an artistic showcase rather than essential continuity.
connection_notes: Standalone anthology that doesn't require prior reading. For fans who enjoyed the Darth Maul (2017) miniseries or Marvel's other Black, White & Red collections.

title: Star Wars: Battle Of Jakku
issues_collected: Star Wars: Battle of Jakku - Insurgency Rising #1-4; Star Wars: Battle of Jakku - Republic Under Siege #1-4; and Star Wars: Battle of Jakku - Last Stand #1-4
synopsis: This complete collection chronicles the pivotal Battle of Jakku, the final major engagement between the Empire and New Republic one year after Return of the Jedi. Across three interconnected miniseries (Insurgency Rising #1-4, Republic Under Siege #1-4, Last Stand #1-4), witness how this battle reshaped the galaxy and left the wreckage that Rey would scavenge decades later in The Force Awakens. The collection bridges the Original Trilogy era with the Sequel Trilogy's status quo.
connection_notes: Set between Return of the Jedi and The Force Awakens. Essential context for understanding Jakku's significance in the Sequel Trilogy, but not required reading for mainline Star Wars comics.

title: Star Wars: Ewoks - Caravan Of Carnage
issues_collected: Star Wars: Ewoks #1-4
synopsis: Star Wars: Ewoks #1-4 brings the furry warriors of Endor into horror-tinged territory as their caravan faces dark threats in the forest moon's shadows. This modern miniseries reimagines the Ewoks with a darker, more mature tone than their 1980s cartoon incarnation. The collection offers a fresh take on C-3PO's "golden god" worshippers, though it exists outside main Star Wars continuity.
connection_notes: Standalone miniseries with no direct connections. Appeals to readers curious about post-Return of the Jedi Endor, but not essential to any ongoing storylines.

title: Star Wars Legends: The Rebellion Omnibus Vol. 3
issues_collected: Star Wars: Shadow Stalker #1; Star Wars: Rebel Heist #1-4; Star Wars: A Valentine Story #1; Classic Star Wars: The Empire Strikes Back #1-2; Star Wars: Shadows of the Empire #1-6; Star Wars: Shadows of the Empire Minicomic #1-2; Star Wars: Tales from Mos Eisley; Star Wars: The Bounty Hunters – Scoundrel’s Wages; Classic Star Wars: Return of the Jedi #1-2; Star Wars: Tag & Bink Are Dead #2; Star Wars: Tag & Bink II; Sergio Aragones Stomps Star Wars #1; Star Wars Infinities: The Empire Strikes Back #1-4; Star Wars Infinities: Return of the Jedi #1-4; and material from Star Wars Kids #12; Star Wars Visionaries; Star Wars Gamer #4; and Star Wars Tales (1999) #2, #4-8, #10, #12, #15-17, and #20
synopsis: This massive omnibus sweeps up decades of Legends-era material from the Rebellion period, anchored by Shadows of the Empire #1-6, the landmark multimedia project set between Empire and Jedi. Rebel Heist #1-4 and Shadow Stalker provide solid Original Trilogy-era adventures, while Star Wars Tales anthology stories offer everything from serious drama to comedy (including the beloved Tag & Bink parodies). The Star Wars Infinities miniseries explore fascinating "what if?" alternate timelines for Empire and Jedi. A grab-bag for completists, but Shadows of the Empire alone makes this worthwhile.
connection_notes: Follows Star Wars Legends: Rebellion Omnibus Vol. 2. The Shadows of the Empire storyline is essential Legends reading. Infinities stories are non-canon "what if" tales worth exploring.

title: Star Wars Legends: The Rebellion Omnibus Vol. 3 Hugh Fleming Leia Cover
issues_collected: Star Wars: Shadow Stalker #1; Star Wars: Rebel Heist #1-4; Star Wars: A Valentine Story #1; Classic Star Wars: The Empire Strikes Back #1-2; Star Wars: Shadows of the Empire #1-6; Star Wars: Shadows of the Empire Minicomic #1-2; Star Wars: Tales from Mos Eisley; Star Wars: The Bounty Hunters – Scoundrel’s Wages; Classic Star Wars: Return of the Jedi #1-2; Star Wars: Tag & Bink Are Dead #2; Star Wars: Tag & Bink II; Sergio Aragones Stomps Star Wars #1; Star Wars Infinities: The Empire Strikes Back #1-4; Star Wars Infinities: Return of the Jedi #1-4; and material from Star Wars Kids #12; Star Wars Visionaries; Star Wars Gamer #4; and Star Wars Tales (1999) #2, #4-8, #10, #12, #15-17, and #20
synopsis: This massive omnibus sweeps up decades of Legends-era material from the Rebellion period, anchored by Shadows of the Empire #1-6, the landmark multimedia project set between Empire and Jedi. Rebel Heist #1-4 and Shadow Stalker provide solid Original Trilogy-era adventures, while Star Wars Tales anthology stories offer everything from serious drama to comedy (including the beloved Tag & Bink parodies).
